To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and various products for preparing food

loans.name: Francys Santiaga

texts.es: Francys Santiaga tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene esta actividad, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado obtener este medio de vida para mantener a su familia. Inicio por la falta de oportunidades de empleo que tenemos en nuestro país, el deseo de querer salir adelante siempre la ha motivado para mejorar su situación. El crédito que solicita es para la compra lápiz labial, brillos, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, cremas y shampoo.
texts.en: Francys Santiaga sells cosmetics.  She started her own business with a lot of effort and, through it, she supports her family.  She has been working in the business for more than four years now.  She started out in her own business owing to a lack of work opportunities in our country.  Her desire to get ahead in life has always motivated her to improve her situation.  She is requesting this loan to buy lipsticks, lip gloss, powders, creams, treatments and shampoo.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, lip gloss, powder, creams, treatments and shampoo

loans.name: Ma.eileen

texts.en:
This is Ma. Eileen, 45, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Franzales, a vendor, and is the mother of their young children. 

Ma. Eileen operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells coconuts, bananas and other Filipino fruit staples. Also in her product inventory are charcoal and rice, which add to her daily income. Her store is located in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,166 in sales every day.

She manages their own household while operating the business together with her husband. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of fruit, charcoal and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Eileen dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision in a nice location. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional quantities of fruits and other products she sells in her business.

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en: Munhzul is 34 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is an assistant driver at NIC Co. Ltd, one of the biggest oil and gasoline distributors in Mongolia. She manages a mobile meal trading business, which she started in 2005. She makes and prepares her food in a small van and sells to her customers. She is one of the trusted loan recipients of XacBank. She is a kind woman who is planning to make and sell meals during the local Naadam holiday held on 11th of July every year. She is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase ingredients and grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and grocery items

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La señora Nelly se dedica a la confección de calzados para toda edad y su esposo es profesor en un colegio; de esta forma ambos consiguen los ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para comprar materia prima como ser: cuero, plantillas, suelas, clefa y demás, pues ha conseguido un contrato grande para confeccionar 36 pares de tennis, 48 pares de calzados de mujer y 36 pares de calzados para hombre. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito anterior que obtuvo y el crédito actual, ambos han sido canalizados a través de Kiva Y Nelly se encuentra muy satisfecha.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly makes shoes for all ages and her husband is a high school teacher. Both of their jobs provide income by which they can support their family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials such as leather, insoles, soles, adhesive, and other supplies. Nelly was awarded a large contract in which she must make 36 pairs of tennis shoes, 48 pairs of women’s shoes, and 36 pairs of men’s shoes. She is married and has two children. Nelly lives in her own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Just like her previous loan, this request is being referred to Kiva for funding. Nelly is very pleased.

loans.use: to buy leather, insoles, soles, adhesive, and other supplies for making shoes.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy is 47 years old. He is a married man living in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Presently, he is a farmer. He has run his farming business for many years with his wife. He grows rice crops in the land his parents own. From this business, he earns about $1 each day. He and his wife have six children. To assist his income, two daughters of his are working hard as sewing-factory workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn a low salary per month. 

Due to the rainy season, he is requesting a loan in order to grow his farming business. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting the farm. He hopes that this loan will create more income in his family, and allow them to widen their house. He is shown with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Mtakuja Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her late 30's, is married with one child who goes to school.  She also takes care of her younger sister who goes to school.  She has had a grocery business for one year.  She works from 1p.m. to 5p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy items that were missing from the grocery.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She would like a loan to increase on the grocery inventory.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a land.

She will share this loan with her loan group Mtakuja, which has a total of 16 members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.  (1st person on the left front row is a child and does not belong to the loan group.)

loans.use: to increase the inventory at her grocery store.

loans.name: Exaltacion Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Exaltación esta conformado por la señora Virgilia va a comprar con su préstamo rebosos, servilletas y bufandas, la señora María de los Ángeles va a comprar plantas ornamentales de flor, fruto y follaje, la señora Silvina va a comprar dulces, paletas, bombones, chicles, galletas, chicharrones, la señora Hilda va a comprar pulseras y aretes de chapa de oro, moños por paquete, albunes para fotos, la señora Elizabeth va a comprar mesas, bancos, bolsas de plástico por rollo, servilletas, platos desechables para su negocio de antojitos mexicanos. La señora María de los Ángeles tiene 26 años de edad, ella es mama soltera, tiene 2 hijas, una de 7 años de edad está estudiando la primaria y la otra niña de 2 años de edad,  ella vende plantas de ornato, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar plantas, macetas de barro, tierra piedras de ornato y pinturas, ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año, empezó a vender las plantas sin maceta pero como sus clientes son muy especiales las empezo a poner en macetas de barro pintadas y decoradas para que se vean mas bonitas, ella compro las plantas con las ventas de pozole, tostadas y quesadillas de los días sábados y domingo. Su negocio es importante puede sacar adelante a sus hijas que están pequeñas la mayor esta en la escuela como es dejada tiene que echarle ganas al negocio, de su negocio saca para comprarles cosas a sus hijas para la leche, la escuela de su hija, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, sus clientes son los turistas que vienen a visitar su pueblo mágico por el museo de momias, los cerros y la alfarería, ella saca su puesto en el centro no tiene local enfrenta los desafíos del clima cuando llueve, ella utiliza las ganancias una parte para volver a invertir y otra para ir ahorrando, sus padres le ayudan en su negocio su papa la lleva al vivero a surtirse de las plantas y su mama las trasplanta y ella pinta y decora las macetas. Sus sueños y esperanzas son darles estudios a sus hijas, una mejor calidad de vida, mejor alimentación, que sus hijas tengan su propia recamara. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por prestarnos y que sigan ayudando a las personas para crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
Virgilia formed this solidarity group called Exaltación. She is going to buy shawls, napkins and scarves with her loan. María de los Ángeles is going to buy ornamental flowers, plants, and leaves. Silvina is going to buy sweets, ice cream sticks, chocolates, gum, cookies, and pork cracklings. Hilda is going to buy bracelets and gold plated earrings, packaged bows, and photo albums. Elizabeth is going to buy tables, benches, and plastic bags by the roll, napkins and disposable plates for her Mexican snack business. 

María de los Ángeles is 26 years old, a single mother, with 2 daughters. One of them is 7 years old and is in primary school and her other daughter is 2 years old. 

She sells ornamental plants. She is asking for a loan in order to buy plants, clay pots, decorative stones, and paints. She began this business a year ago. She began by selling plants without flowerpots, but as her clients are very special she began to put the plants in painted and decorated pots so that they would appear prettier. She bought the plants by selling pozoles, tostadas, and quesadillas on Saturdays and Sundays. 

Her business is important because she can provide for her two daughters who are little, the oldest in school. From her earnings in her business she provides them with milk and school fees for her daughter. She feels proud of having her own business.

Her clients are tourists that come to visit her magical city for the mummy museum, the hills and the pottery. She has her stand in the city center and does not have to worry about the changes of weather, such as when it rains. She is going to use her income to invest in the business and some is going into savings. Her parents help her in the business. Her father takes her to buy the plants and her mother transplants them, and she paints and decorates the pots. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her daughters, giving them a better quality of life, better food, and a bedroom of their own. The members of the group want to say thank you to Kiva and to the Fundación Realidad. “Thank you for lending, and continuing to invest in the businesses and lives of families.”

loans.use: to buy plans, clay pots, potting soil, decorative stones and paints

loans.name: Heronisa

texts.en:
Heronisa is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 
Heronisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Heronisa is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam  lives in  Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (father and sister).    

Mariam has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mariam sells her products at the market, retail. Mariam has requested  a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Mariam   include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own house. Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 11 filhos  dos quais 5 frenquentam a Escola. Fez 10ª classe e parou por falta de tempo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Manjacaze para Boane para continuar com os seus estudos, acabou aranjando em emprego no Ministerio da Educacao como professor e agora assume a funcao de director de uma Escola primaria. Exerce esta actividade ha mais de 20 anos  e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BCI).
Ja teve emprestimo noutros bancos (BIM) e pagou sem dificuldades, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um colega que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao da sua casa (chapas, vidros, cimento, ferro, areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza province, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 11 children, 5 of whom attend school.  He attended school through the 10th grade but stopped because he did not have enough time to go.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he does not support anyone else.   

He left Manjacaze for Boane to continue his schooling.  He ended up finding work in the Ministry of Education as a professor and now he is the director of a primary school.  He has had this job for more than 20 years and has a salary of 8.000.00mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and savings in his bank account (BCI).  

He had a loan in another bank (BIM) and paid it off without any problems.  He later learned about Hluvuku through a colleague who is also a client.  This is his third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase materials (metal panels, glass panes, cement, iron, sand, beams, etc.) to continue construction on his home.  

He promises to make payments on time.  In the future he plans to complete construction on his home and he intends to request more loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his home (metal panels, glass panes, cement, iron, sand, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, de nuevo se decidió por otro préstamo, porque lo necesita para  invertirlo en su negocio y comprar materia prima como: maíz, leña, cal, el objetivo de ella es mejorar en su negocio y tener lo necesario para darles una buena atención a los clientes. Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron a obtener más ingresos y sobre todo tener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en: Cecilia has once again decided to take out a loan. She needs it to invest in her business and buy supplies such as corn, firewood and lime. Her objective is to improve her business and have what she needs to provide good service to her customers. The previous loans have helped her increase her income, and above all, to have everything she needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene se dedica a la confección de polleras,  es de origen humilde, la señora es muy amable y respetuosa, vive en casa alquilada debido a que no genera grandes ingresos como para obtener un lote propio, tiene un hijo pequeño de 3 años y su esposo el señor Julián se dedica al transporte internacional, el señor se encuentra en Puerto Suarez, llevando así una cisterna, debido a que solo es chofer no genera buenos ingresos.
La señora Irene se dedica a la confección de polleras por mas de 5 años, ella confecciona dos docenas y media por semana de las cuales entrega los días de feria en la localidad de Sacaba como ser jueves y domingos, con el dinero del crédito comprara tela por rollo e hilos para la confección de polleras, ella es conocida por las comerciantes, debido a su responsabilidad a la hora de confeccionar y entregar las polleras, su deseo es tener un taller mas grande así confeccionar por cantidades y poder expandir su mercado a la ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro.
texts.en:
Irene's business is making polleras (traditional skirts).  She is of humble origin and is very kind and respectful.  She lives in a rental house because she doesn't make enough income to buy a plot of land of her own.  She has a young son who is 3 years old and her husband, Julián, works in international transportation.  He is in Puerto Suarez and drives a tank truck.  As he is only a driver, he does not make good income.

Irene has been making polleras for more than 5 years.  She makes two and a half dozen every week and delivers them on market days in the town of Sacaba (Thursdays and Sundays).  She will use her loan money to buy fabric by the roll and threads for making polleras.  Irene is well known by the market traders owing to her responsibility in making and delivering her polleras.  Her wish is to have a larger workshop so that she can make her garments in larger quantities and expand her market to the cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.

loans.use: to buy fabric by the roll and threads for making polleras (traditional skirts)

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una tienda de multiservicios,ella hace mantenimientos de computadoras,limpieza de oficinas y tambien limpieza de vidrios,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere que su hijo termine de estudiar musica.La socia solicita el credito para pagar las mensualidades de la academia de su hijo que estudia musica.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with her work at a multi-service store. She maintains computers and also cleans offices and windows. She works from 8am to 5pm. Through her work she is able to help her children move forward. The member wants her son to finish his musical studies. She is requesting a loan in order to pay for her son’s monthly tuition at an academy where he is studying music.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to pay the monthly tuition for her son's music studies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Rose has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fifteen years now.

Mercy requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment. 

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old, married to John and blessed with four children. She has been a tailor for the last 11 years with a monthly profit of Kenya shillings 8,600.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD of Kes 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase stock of clothing textiles and sewing accessories for her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to grow the business into a large clothing store.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 49, is married to Peter and they are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 38,500. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land for farming purposes. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Gull Afshan

texts.en:
Gull afshan is 34 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Gull afshan has been running her own beauty salon for the past 5 years, so she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose.

Therefore Gull afshan has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Gull afshan is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business

loans.name: Liner

texts.en:
Liner runs a small store where she sells hardware supplies. She started the business out of her home when her husband found himself without a job. With $200 in start up capital she started selling basic supplies such as light bulbs and nails. The business is about the 3 years old and now includes a wider range of products.

Liner is requesting the loan because she wants to purchase her merchandise at wholesale prices and quantities. Currently she does not have this benefit and she sees that her profits are very minimal. She is 35 years old and has two children that are still in school. Her husband now has a job and supports the business in any way he can.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products for her store at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret started her business in 1988 selling grocery items. She is a single lady with six children, all going to school. She is educated to level 7 and dropped out due to poverty.

Given the loan, she wants to diversify her grocery store to enable her to stock a variety of goods. She wants also to start purchasing her goods in bulk to benefit from the reduced price.

She wants to use the income to pay her children's school fees and also buy land and build her home.

loans.use: Business diversification

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is divorced and has one daughter. She sells terrycloth bathrobes and bed linens at the local market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Nina has rich experience working in this sphere of trade. She has been in business for over 11 years. Presently, she has about $1,400 in inventory. Her monthly gross sales amount to around $1,000, and her net profit per month is $300.

Nina is an optimistic, cheerful, and focused business owner. Her customer-friendly service is the reason why her business has been so successful and popular in the community. Nina is a responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine. She has repaid every loan she has received without any defaults.

Nina is requesting a loan for $600 to purchase a variety of soft, premium-quality, cotton terrycloth robes and bedding sets in various designs, sizes, and colors. She believes that broadening her product line will increase her income and allow her to improve the well-being of her family. At the moment Nina is forced to live with her ex-husband who is an alcoholic. She doesn’t have enough money to buy her own apartment. However, Nina hopes that stable business expansion and the resulting income will one day help her dream come true and she will be able to afford to live in her own new apartment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif G. is 42 years old and is married, with three children.  Arif's family lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan.  Arif has had his orchard business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  another plot of land and expand his business, which includes a small vineyard.

loans.use: To buy land to expand his orchard.

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Senerita is a married woman of 53. She has 8 children, 4 schooling, 4 working. Senerita is also the Centre chief for Samalaeulu Centre. She has been doing sewing all her adult life, and from her sewing she has been able to send her children to school and assist in supporting her family. With four working children, she's very glad that she has been able to do a lot to support her family and develop their standard of living.

loans.use: To assist with her sewing business

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Aydin Ismailov was born in the city of Agsu in 1980. He is single. He has been raising bees for more than seven years. It is a very profitable business. Aydin is in need of additional funds in order to expand his business. He came to the Agsu branch of Normicro for a loan. He hopes to be able to borrow $500 to allow him to buy five boxes and increase the amount of bees he owns.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исмаилов Айдын 1980 года рождения. Холост . Родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. Более семи лет занимается пчеловодством. Бизнес очень прибыльный. Айдын хочет расширить свой бизнес и для этого ему требовалось дополнительные средства.После обрашения в Нормикро Ахсинского филиала он получил кредит на сумму пятьсот долларов. На эту сумму он купил несколько ящиков чтобы размножить семейство пчел.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Shadoglan

texts.en: Shadoglan (his son is pictured) was born in 1950. He is married and has 4 children. M.'s family lives in Salyan region, in the village of Yenikand. 10 years ago he decided to start the farming business to support his family. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer  and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer  and pesticides

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en: Joan is a single mother of three children of ages, 18, 10 and 3. She has a bakery. She intends to buy baking ingredients, powder, a fridge and a weighing scale with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhouk and her family live in Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River. She married in 1973 and has six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of the children live in separate houses; the others live with her. She and her husband, Man, are farmers. They grow fruits and vegetables, such as tomatoes and papaya, and make jam, and sell them at the market in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chhouk is requesting her seventh loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $400 to buy more silk products for her daughter to sell.

loans.use: To purchase silk products to sell

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros K. T., 40, is a housewife and her husband works as a construction laborer making approximately $3.30 a day. They have five children. The oldest is married and lives outside of the family home. Two children work in a garment factory and the others are students.

Mrs. K. T. will use this loan to start a business breeding pigs, chickens and ducks.

loans.use: To start a business breeding pigs, chickens and ducks

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean T. is 28 years old and lives in Kampong Chnnang province. She runs a small business selling desserts from her home. Her daily revenue from this only totals to 1.50 USD. Her husband, Sim Rotha, works as a taxi driver at the nearby market, making about 2.50 USD per hour.

They share their family home with many family members: their young child, Hean T.’s parents, and two cousins. She hopes to use the loan to purchase a more reliable motor bike for her cousin, providing an easier means of transportation to his job, which adds to the family income. (Pictured here with the motorbike they plan to buy

loans.use: To buy a more reliable motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Clementina's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Clementina is 24 years old and is married woman with 1 child, age 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 14 and 16 years old. Clementina sells chips and food items to the market. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Herena, who has business dealing in chips, chicken and egg sales.

loans.use: To buy  food items for her businesss.

loans.name: Aisak Sat Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisak S. lives in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is the leader of a four-person business group and she sells fish in the local village. Mrs. Aisak S. and her husband have three children, two of whom are enrolled in school, while the youngest stays at home.

Her husband, Mr. S. Mouth, is a fisherman. He doesn't have enough fishing equipment, so he cannot catch many fish for his business. Therefore, Mrs. Aisak S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets and to fix their leaking boat.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and to fix a leaking boat.

loans.name: Ayawavi Thérèse

texts.fr:
Ayawavi Thérèse S. was born in Lomé and is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her business is selling necessary commodities in Lomé. She began her business in 1994. In her store, she sells mineral water, milk, butter and canned goods. This first loan will allow her to restock her supply in order to free up her consistent incoming revenues.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, S. Ayawavi Thérèse est née à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits de premières nécessités à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1994. Dans son magasin elle vend de l’eau minérale, le lait, le beurre, les boîtes de conserve etc. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock afin de dégager des revenus consistants.

loans.use: Buy general grocery products

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives with her common-law husband and is a 29-year-old mother of 2 children. 

She sells coca leaf (a leaf consumed by the area farmers as an ancestral tradition) streetside at the Ayacucho market. She buys the coca leaf at the National Firm of Coca and she is an accredited seller. She also sells cigarettes. She works from 4am to 5pm. She also has an urban transport vehicle that her husband drives.

Julia is a member of the Rubí Village Bank. She needs a loan in the amount of 1400 Nuevos Soles to repair her car. 
She dreams about expanding her business, buying another, more modern car and rebuilding her house out of better materials.

loans.use: to repair her car

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị Liên chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt,Năm 1995 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn mở rộng chăn nuôi. Với  mức vốn đầu tiên là 300.000đ, anh chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và giành một phần vốn để chồng chị mua phụ tùng mở quán sửa chữa xe đạp. Từ chăn nuôi và sửa xe đạp anh chị thu nhập của gia đình đã được cải thiện hơn với mức400.000đ/ tháng. Đến năm 2000, sau 5 năm vừa làm vừa tích lũy kinh nghiệm nhận thấy nhu cầu, đời sống của  nhân dân ngày một tăng lên  anh chị đã chuyển từ  kinh doanh, sửa chữa xe đạp sang kinh doanh bán hàng ăn uống. Cửa hàng của anh chị rất có uy tín trong vùng nên luôn luôn đông khách. Hiện tại anh chị đang thuê  02 công nhân phục vụ tại cửa hàng với mức lương mỗi tháng 1.500.000đ/người. Năm 2004 anh chị đã cải thiện nâng cấp của hàng của anh chị từ quán nhỏ nhà hàng khang trang có thể  phục vụ khách được 100 khách cùng một lúc. Hiện nay anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm vốn để tiếp tục đầu tư mua thực phẩm, đồ uống để phục vụ khách hàng.
Mức vốn xin vay : 19.000.000đ
thu nhập của gia đình bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Before becoming a member of this organization, Ms. L. depended on raising livestock and providing child daycare services as a source of income for her family. In 1995, she and her husband had decided to join the organization to help expand her business of raising farm animals. Her first loan was 300.000d, in which she use as capital for her farm animals and a portion of the money her husband had used to purchased equipments to repair bicycles. Between the two businesses of raising farm animals and repairing bicycles, her family income has rose averaging 400.000d/month. Then in 2000, after 5 years of business experiences, the couple switch over to the restaurant business after seeing a rise in their community economy. Their restaurant has been a popular eatery and always filled with customers. Presently, they have 2 employees that help run the restaurant each making 1.500.000d/person. In 2004, they expanded their restaurant from a small eatery to a restaurant that can serve up to 200 customers at a time. Currently, she and her husband are requesting a loan to use as capital for buying food and restaurant supplies. The requested loan is: 19.000.000d. Her average income is about 6.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Nuevo Progreso is a community bank found in the Andean Mountains in the community of Viracochan, which is located 2,600m above sea level. This area is principally known for the breeding of animals such as cows and small animals like guinea pigs. In addition, corn, onion and wheat are grown in this area.

Julia A. D. C. is a member of the the Nuevo Progreso community bank in Ayacucho, Perú. She lives with her husband and her three children aged 15, 12 and nine. She runs a grocery store in the area, sells meat, and runs a small restaurant that is patronized by many professionals and teachers visiting the area. When Julia first opened her store she did not have many patrons because she was still unknown, but since then the customers have increased. Since joining FINCA Perú she has been participating in trainings that help her improve her business. With the loan of 600 soles she will invest into her business by purchasing more products for her store and for her restaurant. She is saving for her dream of owning a car and helping her children continue their studies and become professionals.

Aida Rivas R. also is a member of the community bank, Nuevo Progreso, she lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children aged 10 and seven. She runs her own grocery store where there is a kiosk available to buy refreshments. When Aida opened her store, there was political unrest which caused some problems, but since then the area has calmed down. FINCA Perú, which Aida recently joined, has helped her improve her business. With the 200 nuevos soles loan, she will invest in buying more products for her store. FINCA Perú emphasizes saving and with her savings Aida dreams of her children continuing their education and being independent financially.

loans.use: The 19 members need loans between 100 and 600 soles, for their various businesses.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Unidas" is a group of 15 women, all looking to receive a loan. Half of this group will be receiving their second loan, and trying to expand their small businesses. The other half are hoping to receive their first loans. All members of this group come from a very poor pueblo in Puerto Plata and are looking to change their life.

Bellamy G. is the group leader and representative of this group, and I had a chance to talk with her for a short period. After speaking with her, I could instantly tell why she was the group leader, and it's because she is a very talkative and intelligent women. She is receiving her second loan and is having good success selling used clothing.

With this loan, she says, she wants to expand and start selling her clothing in other areas. She is the mother of 2 very young children and says her dream is help them have a good life. She wants them both to attend college someday. This whole group is excited about taking this step towards a better life and are committed to making it happen!

On behalf of Bellamy, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buying and selling used clothing

loans.name: Oriente Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Oriente, somos cuatro mujeres muy luchadoras y que nos gusta mucho trabjar, somos muy dedicadas a nuestros negocios y lo mas importante es que somos muy amigas, diria yo casi como hermanas, estas son las actividades que nosotros realizamos:
Diany A.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, mi actividad principal es el comercio, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a la venta de ropa y zapatos tambien vendo cosmeticos, mis ventas las hago de forma ambulante y por encargos, este negocio me ayuda a contribuir a los gastos de mi hogar.
Karla S.: ella tiene un puesto de ventas de frutas, ubicado en la calle principal salida a Jamastran, operado bajo el nombre de frutas Daniela, ella tiene 3 años de tener su negocio, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hermosos hijos, el padre de sus hijos solo le ayuda con el alquiler de la casa y los demas gastos los tiene que poner ella.
Rosa A.: ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomesticos para el hogar y tambien vende cosmeticos, los electrodomesticos los vende por encargo y la gente se los paga al credito, sus clientes son de diferentes comunidades vecinas a la Ciudad de Danli.
Sorayda B.: ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, ella tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este negocio, durante este tiempo le va muy bien y le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar,
todas nosotras necesitamos el credito ya que viene la epoca de navidad y aqui es cuando las ventas son las mejores, asi que necesitamos el credito para poder surtirnos de mucha mercaderia y asi poder cubrir con las necesidades de todos nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the Oriente Group. We are four painstaking women who love to work. We are very dedicated to our businesses, and the most important thing is that we are friends, or should I say, almost like sisters. These are the businesses in which we are involved: Diany A.: I am the group coordinator. My main business activity is retail. I have been selling clothing and footwear for 3 years, and I also sell cosmetics. I work as a street vendor and take orders. This business helps me cover the household expenses. Karla S.: has a fruit stand located on the main street that leads to Jamastran. She operates the stand under the name of “Daniela Fruit.” She has had her business for 3 years. She is a single mother with 2 beautiful children whose father only helps out by paying rent. Karla must cover the rest of the expenses. Rosa A.: sells home appliances and cosmetics for a living. She sells the appliances by catalog, and her customers pay her with credit. Her customers come from several neighboring communities of the city of Danli. Sorayda B.: sells new clothing for a living. She has been in business for 2 years, during which time her business has prospered. She helps her husband with the household expenses. We all need the loan because the holiday season, which is the time when our sales increase, is almost here, so we need to stock up on merchandise in order to meet our customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 48 años, vive solo ya que migró de la ciudad de Arequipa, hace 3 años. Es un hombre muy trabajador que desde que llegó a la ciudad de Puno, no ha hecho más que trabajar y trabajar en busca de un mejor porvenir, es así que desde hace un año se viene dedicando a brindar servicio de taxi para solventar sus gastos. A Jesús le gusta su trabajo, ya que le no es rutinario y puede visitar diferentes lugares transportando a sus clientes. Para suerte de Jesús, es muy solicitado por los clientes que prefieren de su servicio, es por eso que quiere seguir brindándolo y mejorando, para lograr mayores ingresos. Jesús se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su carro para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jesús is 48 years old and lives alone as he migrated from the city of Arequipa 3 years ago. He has worked hard since his arrival in Puno, only having worked and worked in search of a better future. So one year ago he decided to provide taxi service to meet his expenses. Jesús enjoys the work, as it is always different and he can visit different places while transporting customers. Fortunately for Jesús, he is sought after as customers prefer his service, so therefore he wants to continue providing and improving his service to obtain greater profit. This is Jesús’ first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will repair his car to provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị  L., 39 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn, vịt đẻ và làm ruộng.Hiện tại gia đình chị đang có hơn 100 con lợn, 200 con vịt đẻ, thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ ể đ ầu t ư mua th ức ăn ph ục v ụ cho ch ăn nu ôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 39 years of age, lives in Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2007. The major sources of income of her family are from raising pigs, raising ducks, and farming. Currently her family has more than 100 pigs and 200 ducks that produce an average income of VND6,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to buy foods for livestock and poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy foods for livestock and poultry

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Eleuterio tiene 44 años, está felizmente casado con la madre de sus 4 hijos, 3 de ellos viven en Lima y el menor vive con ellos. Desde muy niño se ha dedicado a labrar la tierra por ser de padres agricultores, pero desde hace dos años, dos veces al mes, también se está dedicando a la venta de carne, obteniendo como mínimo 150 soles de ganancia. Pero aunque el negocio de la carne sea muy rentable Eleuterio, dice no sentirse cómodo con esa actividad, porque las labores agrícolas le agradan mucho más, atender y cultivar sus sembríos lo llena de mucha satisfacción, y en la etapa de la cosecha transporta al mercado su producto, llegando a cotizar a un buen precio. Este esforzado agricultor no pierde sus la esperanza de llegar a  sembrar en grandes cantidades, pero en distintas fechas, para de ese modo hacer un capital y lograr comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Eleuterio trata de  no faltar a todas las reuniones programadas de su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo de vocal, y se encargaba se pasar los comunicados del asesor de crédito a los demás integrantes. Este es su 5to préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para el buen desarrollo de su planta, e insecticidas para contrarrestar el gusano que ataca a la papa.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 44 years old and happily married to his wife, mother of 4 children. Three of them live in Lima, while the youngest lives at home. Being the child of farmers, Eleuterio has worked the land from a very young age, however for the past 2 years, he has also worked twice a month selling meat. From this he earns at least 150 soles of profit. Although the meat business is quite profitable, Eleuterio says he does not feel comfortable with this work, he much prefers agricultural work. Growing and caring for his plants fills him with satisfaction, and harvesting his product and bringing it to market can earn good money. This hard-working farmer does not lose his hope to eventually plant great quantities, but at different times, a method which allows him to build capital and purchase more land to cultivate. Eleuterio tries not to miss a single scheduled meeting of his village bank, and in the last cycle he was responsible for transmitting advice from the consultant to the other members. This is his fifth loan, and in this whole time he has been very responsible with his payments. The money he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers to feed his plants, and pesticides to protect his potatoes from worms.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Nelly Del Socorro Mercado

texts.es:
Nelly M. es una dama muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de colchones desde hace 5 años siendo este un negocio que le ha ayudado a desarrollarse y proporcionar mejores condiciones a su familia.

A sus 50 años de edad, como toda mujer nicaragüense ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora con el propósito de llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación. Ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de colchones ya que requiere adquirirlos para así seguir en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Nelly M. is a hard-working woman whose business is selling mattresses. She has been in this business for 5 years, which has helped her to improve herself and provide the best conditions for her family. At 50, like all Nicaraguan women, she describes herself as an excellent worker with the goal of increasing the well-being of her home. She has come to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase mattresses, since she must acquire them in order to continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mattresses

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.en:
K. Najmidin is 50 years old. He is married with 5 children. Najmidin is a farmer. He plants wheat, onions, carrots, cabbages and garlic. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. Thanks to his savings, he was able to arrange the marriage of his elder son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Najmidin’s income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Simean

texts.en:
Mrs. Simean T. is thirty-six years old and a widow with two children, one son and one daughter. Both of her children are in primary school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.
 
Simean has been growing vegetables for four years.Beside of farming she also has another business is a basket and bag weaver (show in the picture). She takes one kind of edible aquatic plant to dry with the sun and take it to weave bags or baskets. Her house was built on her sister’s land, but now she has her own land so is asking for a loan of $500 to move her house.

loans.use: To move her house.

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Halima has owned a small restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour, sugar, rice, beans, and tomatoes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Halima is 40 years old and married with six children who are ages 15, 9, 7, 4, 3, and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Singa, a woman who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, rice, beans, and tomatoes for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 44 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 4 hijos, quienes la apoyan mucho. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en un espacio dentro de su vivienda. Ana se esfuerza mucho para dar una buena atención a sus clientes, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días de la semana que está abierta su tienda. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que hace muchas amistades, y sobre todo se gana la confianza de sus clientes, además, que poco a poco está creciendo gracias a las ganancias de sus productos. Para el futuro quisiera tener un minimarket. Con MFP ya tiene 6 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos son puntuales y dinámicos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes para implementar su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Ana is a 44-year-old single mother who lives with her 4 children, who give her a lot of support. Two years ago she started selling groceries and other basic goods from her home. Ana works hard to offer good service to her customers, keeping her store open from 6 am to 8 pm, 6 days a week. What she likes about her work is that she makes many friends, and most importantly earns the trust of her customers. Little by little her business is growing thanks to the earnings from sales of her products. In the future she would like to have a minimarket. She has already had 6 loans with MFP and she likes working with her group, because all of the members are punctual and dynamic. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more basic goods and groceries to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of more merchandise

loans.name: Efosa

texts.en: Efosa has a farm where he plants cassava, corn and plantain. He is 46 years old and married with 9 children. He hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more plantain suckers to grow. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain suckers to grow

loans.name: Arlen Ydania

texts.es: Arlen Ydania C. Hernández tiene 28 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. La actividad económica de Arlen es la venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Arlen es profesora, pero debido a su difícil situación tuvo que dedicarse a la venta de ropa, la cual ofrece en su lugar de trabajo a sus compañeros, los fines de semana Arlen sale muy temprano a recorrer muchos lugares para  vender su productos nuevos clientes, Arlen es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada en su trabajo. Es por eso que este financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa pantalones, calzado y shorts. Su  deseo es establecerse en lugar en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Arlen Ydania C. Hernández is 28 years old. She is a married woman. Arlen's job is selling new clothes. She decided to go into this business five years ago. Arlen is a teacher, but due to her difficult situation she had to dedicate herself to clothing sales, which she sells to her co-workers at work. On weekends, Arlen leaves very early to travel to many places to sell her products to new clients. Arlen is a very responsible woman and dedicated to her job. This is why the loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase clothes like pants, shoes, and shorts. Her desire is to establish a place where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara is 39 years old and has six children. She is married to A. who is a taxi-driver.

Omolara sells drinks and water. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en: Ben K. is the leader of Balibaseka group in Mityana. He is a very hard-working man and a farmer with a business of buying and selling produce from Mityana town, sometimes to Kampala. He has been selling his produce, which ranges from maize and beans to coffee, for three years. His main challenge is transportation. Sometimes he uses bicycles or motorcycles, but he would like to buy a car so that he can load more kilograms of produce at once. Ben is married with twelve children, with three not yet in school, and he hopes that he will be able to educate all his children to the very end. He needs a loan in order to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bolivar” estan representadas por la señora Rosa y conformadas por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio de productos como de ropa para todos los gusto y un porcentaje mínimo de las socias se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, pan y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir.  La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The Bolivar Group is represented by Sra. Rosa and consists of 12 members who are mostly engaged in retail businesses selling products such as clothing. A small percentage of the members sell groceries, bread, or provide services such as tailoring. The level of competition among businesses is high, but the members are experienced and know that they must offer a variety of high-quality products in order to get ahead.

The loan that they received will be used to augment the operating capital for their small businesses so that they can increase their earnings. This translates into an improved quality of life for their families, which gradually gets better each day. For this, they are grateful for the confidence that has been placed in them to continue working harder.

The members are undertaking their first loan cycle as a group, but they have previous experience working with other solidarity groups. Therefore, they are committed to proceed with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
A married father of three, Mr. Shadi is 30 years old.  He opened a cafeteria whose profits enable him to provide for his family.  He is running out of stock of the essential ingredients he needs to cook, such as milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc., so he is seeking a loan of $3000.  Mr. Shadi hopes that his tireless work plus a little help from the loan will take him a few steps nearer to the achievement of his dream:  Financial security for his family. 

On behalf of everyone here at Ryada, and from Mr. Shadi himself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: Purchasing essential ingredients

loans.name: Carmen Ivelia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  Ivelia C. Ordóñez  es socia del Banco Comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre que se encuentra a unos 45 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca vía al Valle, este sector se caracteriza por tener  unas llanuras y paisajes muy bonitos y todo el camino nos regala su  belleza natural.

 Carmen  tiene 33 años es casada tiene una buena relación conyugal, concibió 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 3 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia en el Colegio Miguel Merchán, su segundo hijo en la escuela Nicolás Sojos, viven en casa propia fruto de su trabajo de varios años y sobre todo con la ayuda de su  esposo que trabaja en la construcción,  nos manifiesta que es una familia muy feliz.

Carmen trabaja vendiendo productos para la belleza de la mujer como productos Yambal, empezó hace cinco meses con su negocio y le va muy bien porque tiene mucha clientela, son productos muy conocidos y tienen una buena acogida en el mercado, una dificultad que ha tenido es que tiene que caminar mucho porque visita a sus clientas de casa en casa, siendo una gran ventaja que los productos son buenos y se venden.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando con el banco comunal y le agrada la manera que les enseñan a ahorrar y para acceder a los prestamos no tienen que realizar muchos tramites.

El préstamo obtenido en la Fundación  lo va a invertir en la compra de un stock surtido de productos Yambal para satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientas.

Su meta es seguir  incrementando las ventas de los productos de belleza para la mujer Yambal y llegar a obtener la estrella número 1 que en la empresa entrega.
texts.en:
Carmen Ivelia C. Ordóñez is a member of the Communal Bank Maluay; she lives in a community with the same name which is located about 45 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca on the way to El Valle. This region is known for having very beautiful plains and scenery, and the surrounding area offers us its natural beauty.

Carmen is 33 years old, is married in a good marital relationship, and conceived 3 children ages 12, 10, and 3; her eldest child studies in the Colegio Miguel Merchán, and her second child in the Escuela Nicolás Sojos. They live in their own house, which is the product of many years of work, especially with the help of her husband that works in construction. She tells us that they are a very happy family.

Carmen works selling beauty products to women such as those of the Yambal brand; she began this business 5 months ago and things are going very well because she has a large clientele, her products are well known, and the products have been well accepted in the market. One difficulty that she has faced is that she has to walk a great deal because she visits her clients from house to house, with the great advantage that her products are good and sell well.

She is in her third loan cycle working with her Communal Bank, and she likes the way that they have been taught to save and that they do not have to carry out many transactions to gain access to loans.

The loan obtained through the Foundation will be invested in the purchase of an assorted stock of Yambal products to satisfy her clients’ requests.

Her goal is to continue expanding her sales of Yambal beauty products, and to gain the ‘Number 1 Star’ honor given by the company.


Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of an assorted stock of Yambal products.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the town of Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old. Teresita is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks and other basic needs in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from Paglaum-MPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital on her Grocery Store or Sari-sari store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 52 years old and married with four children. She sells cooking oil at retail to her customers. This season is a high season for the sale of her cooking oil and she hopes to meet the requirement of her customers. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Sabougnouman sont tous des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et  habitent  le quartier Djaka (Kirango)  de  Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ce groupe est uni par des liens de parenté, de mariage, d’amitié, de voisinage et est membres de l’association traditionnelle « Traoré Ton » qui donna son nom  à leur actuelle association. Elles ont comme activité la vente du poisson sous diverses formes.  
Sabougnouman est un groupe qui collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso et  qui est à son 5ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 paniers de poisson frais et 50 barres  de glace (fournies par les transporteurs venant de Bamako). Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger. Une bonne partie de ce poisson est séchée soit sur du gravier soit sur de la paille ou sur des « seccos ».Le poisson se vend sous toutes les formes : les poissons frais  se vendent sur place au bord du fleuve, à Kirango et à Diamarabougou Markala dans les foires ou en ambulant dans les quartiers, le frais  conservé dans de la glace se vend à Ségou  (au marché château), une partie du poisson séché est conservée jusqu’à l’hivernage où elles gagnent plus d’argent et est surtout revendu dans les foires de Dougabougou, Siribala, Boussin et Ségou Les ventes se font généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 37.000 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux. 
Leur ambition est  d’acheter et d’élever des animaux afin de construire dans l’avenir leurs propres maisons.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Sabougnouman group are all married women, the majority in monogamous families. On average they are 31 years old with 4 children and live in the Djaka (Kirango) neighborhood of Markala (4th administrative Region of the republic of Mali). This group is united by bonds of kinship, marriage, friendship, and neighborhood. They are members of the traditional "Traoré Ton" association that gave its name to their current association. Their activity is the sale of fish in various forms. Sabougnouman is a group that collaborates with Soro Yiriwaso and that is on its 5th loan, after having repaid the preceding ones well. This new loan will be used to buy 10 baskets of fresh fish and 50 blocks of ice (furnished by the carriers coming from Bamako). They supply themselves with fresh fish on the spot by the river Niger. A good part of this fish is dried on gravel, on straw or on one of the "dryers". The fish is sold in various ways: the fresh fish are sometimes sold on the spot by the river, in Kirango and in Diamarabougou Markala in the market or on foot in the neighborhoods. The fresh fish is packed in ice and sold in Ségou (in the market house). Part of the dried fish is preserved until winter, when they earn more money and is sold in the markets of Dougabougou, Siribala, Boussin and Ségou. They generally sell the fish themselves to a cash clientele composed of women and men. They hope to realize a monthly average profit of 37,000 FCFA that will serve to satisfy their small family needs. Their ambition is to buy and raise animals in order to construct their own houses in the future.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and ice

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean R., 30, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia and has been a vegetable trader for more than a year.  She also buys various vegetables in bulk from rural farmers and then retails them in the market for income. Chean R. is married to Sun Som, who decorates wooden  furniture. This couple has two school-aged children. Chean R. is requesting a loan to purchase a trailer to connect to an existing motorbike which her husband will use to transport furniture to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect to an existing motorbike to transport furniture

loans.name: Glória Paulo

texts.pt:
Glória Paulo N. L. nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, Província de Maputo, tem 51 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos que apenas se recorda da idade 1 que tem 15 anos ainda frequentando a escola. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos no Distrito de Boane na localidade de Mafuiane, e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Marracuene para Boane com 19 anos de idade, quando se casou com seu marido. Trabalha como agricultora há mais de 30 anos. É dona de 2 parcelas de 2 hectares cada e conta onde produz hortícolas e cereais com ajuda de uma empregada e seus filhos. Faz um horário das 7h as 16 horas todos os dias, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt depois de 45 dias que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agrícolas (sementes, insecticidas, adubos e outros) para aumentar ainda mais as áreas de produção e oferecer a melhor qualidade de produtos.
Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.800.00mt, 11.000.00mt, 11.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um aviário, para a criação de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Glória Paulo N. L. was born in the Marracuene District, Maputo Province. She is 51 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children. One is 15 years old and still in school. She lives in her own house with her children in the Boane District in the town of Mafuiane, and supports two grandchildren that live with her. She left Marracuene for Boane at 19 years old, when she married her husband. She has worked as a farmer for more than 30 years. She owns 2 parcels of land that are 2 hectares each; she grows greens/vegetables and grains with the help of an assistant and her children. She works from 7am to 4pm every day, and brings in about 12,000 MZN in 45 days. She uses this for housing expenses and she even saves some through Xitique (a traditional system of revolving savings). She has never had loans through other banks. She became familiar with Hluvuku through some friends who are clients of this institution. She is her 4th loan. It has a value of 13,000 MZN, and she plans to use it to buy agricultural supplies (seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, etc.) in order to expand into more areas of production and offer products with better quality. Her previous loans were for 2,800, 11,000, 11,000, and 15,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. In the future, she would like to request more loans to build a coop, so she can raise chickens to butcher.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for the growing of greens/vegetables

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Kuña Guapa” se formó gracias al deseo de mejoramiento y superación del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recurso.

Utilizaran el crédito para diversas opciones de compra como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricación de comestibles( harina ,huevos,aceite,carne,condimentos,etc,) , compra de leche azúcar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras, compra venta de melón, sandia , banana, naranja y frutas diversas para su posterior venta, compra de ropas de ocasión para la venta , compra-venta de calzados , compra-venta de productos cárnicos, compra-venta de lácteos,compra-venta de huevos etc, para tratar de aumentar los ingresos y mejorar su forma de vida.
La Sra. Silvia se dedica a la venta de comidas con una pequeña casilla en la vereda de su casa, ella se levanta muy temprano  a la mañana para preparar las comidas ya que sus clientes acuden al copetín desde las primeras horas del día.
Así Doña Silvia trabaja todos los días para sobrellevar sus compromisos con sus 5 hijos quienes ya están en edad escolar. Mediante la ayuda que brinda la fundación puedo hacer muchas cosas y mejorara el nivel de vida de mis hijos manifestó la misma.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee was formed thanks to the desire of the members to improve their quality of living since they had very scarce resources. They will use the loan for different purchases such as: raw materials in producing food (flour, eggs, oil, meat, condiments, etc.), milk, sugar, spices, salt, bread and vegetables, melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges and other fruits, formal event clothing, shoes, meat products, dairy products, eggs, etc. to try to increase their income and better their quality of life. Mrs. Silvia sells food from a small stand on the sidewalk in front of her home. She wakes up very early to start preparing the food as her clients start coming in in the early hours. So, Mrs. Silvia works every day to meet her commitments to her 5 children who are all of school age. Through the help that the foundation offers her, she tells us that she can do many things and improve the quality of life of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of products for direct sale and for making food to sell

loans.name: Susana Xiomara

texts.es: Susana Xiomara M. L. de 34 años de edad, reside en Lourdes, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo. Susana posee un taller de corte y confección, el cual elabora prendas de vestir para hombres, mujeres y niños. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero para poder comprar tela para la elaboración de uniformes escolares, esto debido a que este es el mes de inicio de clases, y Susana desea poder contar con todos los recursos necesarios para poder ofrecer su servicio a sus clientas, y así mismo poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de beneficio para su hogar, esto debido a que tanto Susana como su esposo se esmeran mucho por contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna para ambos.
texts.en:
Susana Xiomara M. L. is 34 years old and a resident of Lourdes, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She and her husband live alone. Susana has a sewing workshop where she produces clothing for men, women, and children. She is requesting a loan so that she can have money to buy material for producing school uniforms, since classes begin this month. Susana wants to have all the necessary resources available so that she can provide her services to her customers. At the same time, she hopes to improve her earnings which will benefit her household. Like her husband, Susana strives hard to have all the necessities so that she can have a decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making school uniforms

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita M. is from the village of Sumasap. She is 54 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carlita owns and operates a retail clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing to local community members. Carlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2002, Carlita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional items of clothing. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes (RTW)

loans.name: Adolfo Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Adolfo S. V., el tiene a su cargo tres  hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar,  es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante 15 meses, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio de piso de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Adolfo S. V. is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are of school age. He has received loans from CEPRODEL for the past 15 months, which he used to improve the condition of his home. He has demonstrated that he is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase building materials needed to change the flooring in his home so that he can provide better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the floors in his house

loans.name: Fatimo

texts.en:
Fatimo is a friendly and a hardworking woman. She sells cosmetics at retail prices in Ibadan and has been in this business for a long time. She uses her years of experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Fatimo hopes to expand her business and hopes for a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Fatimo is married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.

Fatimo has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Aygul's Group

texts.en:
Aygul A., the leader of this group, is a model of open-mindedness and creativity. Multilevel marketing is not very popular in Kyrgyzstan although there are still a lot of well-known companies such as Faberlic, Avon and Oriflame, which promise a better future for those who have a burning desire. With 3,000 KGS ($68) in her pocket, Aygul decided to join this business. She was very ambitious and she did succeed. Now she wants to get a loan to increase her sales by buying cosmetics because the spring holiday season is coming, which is the best time to sell. Aygul is 38 and married to a farmer. They have three children: two daughters and a son. Nuura, 15, is in 8th grade at a local school. The middle daughter is in 2nd grade at the same school and the youngest is at home. Aygul, in the near future, wants to increase her turnover and send her eldest daughter to get a higher level of education. 

Perisat J. is 30 and married to a farmer.  She has four children: two daughters and two sons. In 1996, she and her husband sold their car for 50,000 KGS ($113) and invested all their money in livestock. Now their revenue is 6,000 KGS ($136). They would like to get a loan to buy two small cattle for resale.
