Ayshirin O. is 39 and a determined woman. She is married to an engineer and has a daughter and twin sons. They all attend school. She works as an equipment operator in a shop.  Her future plan is to buy a house. She would like to get a loan for housing improvement. 

Rosa D. is 57 and married. She has six children, now adults, most of whom live independently. Her youngest child lives at home and  attends school. Her eldest son, 24, lives with her and buys cars for spare parts. In 2009, he started with 20,000 KGS ($454) and bought a car in order to sell its spare parts. Now their revenue is 3,000 KGS ($68). They would like to get a loan to buy spare parts. In the future, they are planning to increase turnover and open an auto service.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Deepani

texts.en:
Deepani is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children who are still studying. She and her husband process the business together, which is a tailoring shop.

Deepani started her business seven years ago. She first started with a Singer sewing machine but upgraded to a Juckey machine with her first loan from BRAC. With this loan, she plans to purchase a new overlock machine, which will increase the quality of her tailoring services.

Deepani is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to purchase cloth for her business and help pay for her new overlock machine.

In her business, Deepani and her husband work together cooperatively and she is hardworking. She has seen success because, with the help of her Juckey machine, her services have been of very high quality.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and more cloth

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, es una mujer laboriosa y muy alegre, tiene 53 años y está casada con Jeremías de 60 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales vive solo con dos de ellos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa, arveja, habas y maíz, sobre terrenos propios y arrendados, en donde su esposo la ayuda en esta labor todos los días, empezando muy temprano por la mañana, en tanto que en sus ratos libres teje chompas para caballeros y damas, que luego son comercializados a S/. 70.00 soles cada uno. Asimismo y por temporadas, ofrece prendas de vestir dejando a crédito a sus conocidos. Ella no se queja de sus actividades, pues asegura que le dan buenos beneficios económicos, con las cuales cubre sus gastos domésticos, así como los estudios de sus hijos e incluso le permite ahorrar para prevenir cualquier eventualidad. Es por eso que desea arrendar más tierras, para extender sus siembras y generarle una buena producción agrícola. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque le enseñan a ser responsable y sobre todo puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará dos sacos de arveja.
texts.en:
Julia is a happy, hardworking woman. She is 53 years old and her husband Jeremías is 60. They own their own home and live there with two of their four children. For 30 years, Julia has been a farmer, growing potatoes, peas, beans, and corn on her own land as well as on rented fields. She wakes up very early every morning to work in the fields with her husband. In her free time, she knits sweaters for men and women, which she is able to sell for approximately $25 each. Seasonally, she also sells clothing to her acquaintances on credit. Julia does not complain about working so hard. She knows that it ensures that she has enough income to cover her household expenses, to pay her children's school fees, and to save money for unexpected expenses. She would like to rent more land to increase her harvest and generate more income from farming. This is her first loan from MFP. She has enjoyed working with her communal bank because they are teaching her to be responsible and, above all, on-time with her payments. She will use the loan to purchase two bags of peas.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 2 bags of peas

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her oldest son and daughter attend a high school.
Oyuntsetseg operates a business trading second-hand products, such as shoes, at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. She started her business in 2003 and has had steady growth over the years. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 3,590 USD) and her daily profits average between 15,000 and 20,000 tugrugs (approximately 10 to 15 USD).
Over the years, Oyuntsetseg has gained great business experience and she has used her earnings to support her family and grow her business. She is very hard-working and hopes to continue her success in the future.
Oyuntsetseg’s oldest sister is an invalid. Her sister has three children but they don’t have a house to live in. Oyuntsetseg wants to build a new house for her sister. She says, “I love my sister so much. She is a very patient person. My dream is to purchase a larger house for my sister’s family.”
Oyuntsetseg is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to build the new house for her oldest sister.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build the new house

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Phon Village Bank Group

texts.en: The 18 people in this village bank loan live in Meun Tumrong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Phalla P. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Mey, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her husband’s workplace is far away from her home. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Phalla P. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation. She is the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local public school and the other is five years old.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Malalinta. She is 42 years-old and married with two school-aged children.  Evelyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evelyn joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. and her husband sell vegetables to her new and existing customers for an income of USD 7 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike. This will be used to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike to transport workers from the factory.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Víctor pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios ciclos que participa y le va muy gracias a la responsabilidad y puntualidad de sus pagos. Víctor tiene tres hijos de las cuales Ademir vive a su lado, Saúl y Abel viven a lado de su ex pareja. 

Víctor es un hombre trabajador y responsable que se desempeña como peón en la bloqueteria de la ciudad de Sarahuaylla. Ya son varios años que trabaja por que su jefe confía en su capacidad y su inteligencia. Víctor también tiene una pequeña chacra en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc donde siembra y cosecha.  

Víctor requiere el préstamo para comprar animales críos que comprará de la feria de combapata y Inquilpata para hacerlos engordar y después venderlos en las mismas ferias.
texts.en:
Víctor belongs to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Cusco. He has already had several loans from this field partner, which have had good results thanks to his sense of responsibility and his punctuality in making payments. Víctor has three children. Ademir lives close by, while Saúl and Abel live near his former partner. Víctor is a responsible and hardworking person, who pays his debts by working as a labourer in a concrete block factory in the town of Sarahuaylla. He has worked for several years in this job, since his boss trusts in his ability and intelligence. Víctor also has a small plot of land in the rural community of Rayanniyoc where he sows and harvests crops. Víctor needs the loan to buy young livestock at the markets held in Combapata and Inquilpata, which he will fatten and later sell at the same markets.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young livestock

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn S. is from the village of Capellan. She is 42 years old. Magelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Magelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics and apparel products from Avon and Natasha in the local community. Magelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Magelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Magelyn is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Magelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 26-year-old mother of three small kids who are dependent on her. S. is a sewing employee in the garment industry. Her husband works with her in the same field. S. faced a problem: she and her husband always go to work by hiring a taxi at a high price or by walking. They dream of having their own vehicle, but their dreams do not come true because they don't have enough money to buy a motorbike. In addition to their savings, S. is looking for a loan in order to purchase a new motorbike that she will use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Cristina se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Cristina ayuda en la cocina del jardín de su hijo.
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Cristina vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para la construcción.
texts.en:
Cristina lives with her partner and has three children, who are in school. Cristina sells clothing to order to her friends and family. Most of her sales are made on credit. Additionally, Cristina helps cook for her son’s nursery school. Cristina is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Community Bank, and she needs a loan for 1000 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of pants and jackets. Cristina lives in a rented house, and her biggest dream is to buy land to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en:
Taufau T. is 39 and married with 7 children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Taufau has three years of experience in this business. Taufau needs a loan of 1,500 talas to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $135 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Taufau joined SPBD in 2007. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Taufau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Donadi

texts.en:
N. Donaid's main source of income for the past 3 years has been selling food such as maize grains, groundnuts and sorghum in Muhoro trading centre, Kyenjojo. With the earnings from his business, this hard-working and determined man has managed to sustain his family of 3 children. This 35-year-old, dynamic businessman has reached a point where his profits are now 900,000 Ugandan shillings a month. With steady progress in his small business, he reckons his future prospects are rising with every passing day.

With this loan, Donadi has the conviction that he will be able to buy more cash crops such as maize and beans so that he does not run short of stock. This will improve his sales revenue and will enable him to have a self-sustaining life as he looks to the future to educating his children. In that way, they will become important people who can support themselves in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, like maize and beans, for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man and the father of 3 school-aged children. He is an experienced furniture carpenter; he has owned a carpentry shop for almost fifteen years. He is his family's main income provider. Today, he wants to borrow $1000 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.; he will use the money to purchase an air compressor. This will be his second loan and he is very thankful for the results. In the future, he is looking to further expand his merchandise and invest in a new wood-sanding machine. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: purchasing an air compressor

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren M. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His daughter, age 15, attends local high school. His wife supports and helps out with his business while Nyamsuren works as a carpenter. He has owned his carpentry business for almost 14 years and over this long time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. 

He usually produces a variety of wooden items according to customers' orders and his wife is responsible for sale at the local market. Nyamsuren is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his wooden items production business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mr. Norn O. N., 42, works as a soldier in the Ministry of Defense which is located in PhnO. Penh City. He has been working in this position for over ten years, and he has a formal salary per month. Mr. Norn O. N. currently generates an income of approximately US$ 5 per day. Mr. Norn O. N. is married to Mrs. Po Pisey, age 34, who shares the responsibility for the family by selling clothes in the busy market. They are good parents to both their children who are students at the public school. 

Mr. Norn O. N. said that his wife hopes to enlarge her business, and he wants encourage her, but he doesn’t have enough capital to make it possible. So, Mr. Norn O. N. would like to request a loan to be used to purchase a large number of clothes for his wife’s business.

loans.use: purchase a large number of clothes for his wife’s business

loans.name: Haydar

texts.ru: Назаров Хайдар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Занимается торговлей в торговом центре "Гулчахон". Он в основном продает DVD диски. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: N. Haydar lives in the city of Kulob. He's twenty-eight years old, married and has one child. He has a degree in economics and has worked as a salesman for five years. Currently, he sells DVD disks at the Gulchahon shopping center. He's asking for a loan to increase his goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase his sales.

loans.name: Noor Jahan's Group

texts.en:
Noor Jahan lives in Multan, which is the fourth largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and tombs. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the Dewan Bagh area. She has been living there for over 27 years.

A talented and hardworking lady, Noor carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and also supports her husband financially by making embroidered clothing. She does hand embroidery, which is considered valuable work for women. She has a good number of clients in her community and outside of the community as well. She also exports her embroidered clothes to other cities like Lahore, etc.

Her husband operates a rice-selling business and generates income for the family.  Noor has given birth to 3 children. Her eldest son is completing his bachelor's degree and works as an accountant in a private firm. The next child to him works as a salesman in a factory. Her daughter is 12 year old and studying in in the 5th class (grade).

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy some embroidery materials such as cloth, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will help her fulfill larger orders on time and increase the household income.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Elcita Mercedes

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Elcita ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero que aún viven con ella. Su esposo es pescador.

Ella trabaja y administra el bar en el colegio Teniente Hugo Ortiz en Los arenales, en el cual vende sanduches, corviches, empanadas, jugos, gaseosas, agua entre otros bocadillos, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 11amm hasta las 17h00 y los sabados y domingos se encarga de fabricar y vender adornos y recuerdos.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que sirven para  la preparación de los alimentos y para comprar gaseosa y jugos. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le ha gustado por la amistad que ha hecho dentro del Banco. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que su hija sea una gran medico.
texts.en:
A place called Los Arenales is in Portoviejo’s Crucita parish.  The members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) communal bank meet here every two weeks.  The place is known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We can find Elcita, 47, here.  She is married and has two children who are now adults but still live with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She works at and runs the snack bar at the Teniente Hugo Ortiz School in Los Arenales.  She sells sandwiches, "corviches" (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili), turnovers, juices, soft drinks and water among other snacks.  She works from Monday through Friday from 11am until 5pm.  On Saturdays and Sundays she makes decorations and keepsakes to sell.

She will use this loan to buy products she needs to make the food and to buy soft drinks and juices.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and has enjoyed the friendships she’s made within it.  Her dreams are to see her children finish their studies and that her daughter becomes a great physician.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Sugey Cecilia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SUGEY L. T. TIENE ACTUALMENTE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE  Y CON SUS TRES HIJOS, TODOS ELLOS  EN EDAD ESCOLAR,  SU CONYUGUE TRABAJA COMO CHOFER DE UNA UNIDAD MENOR (TAXI), LA SEÑORA SUGEY SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES Y ROPA EN UNA PEQUEÑA BODEGA UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, POR LO CUAL LA MAYORIA DE SUS VENTAS ESTAN ORIENTADAS A SUS VECINOS, GRACIAS AL NEGOCIO DE SU BODEGA LA SEÑORA SUGEY PUEDE SOSTENER LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA Y LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS, ELLA REQUIERE EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sugey L. T. is 31 years old.  She lives with her husband and their three school age children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Sugey sells groceries and clothes in a small store located in her house.

Therefore, most of her sales are geared towards her neighbors.  Thanks to her store, Sugey is able to help with the family expenses and her children’s education.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old man from Jenin city. He came to FATEN to take out a loan to purchase a television and some bedroom furniture. He is single and wants to prepare the house for his wedding. Mahmoud is a security guard in one of the companies in Jenin city.

Mahmoud appears in the picture here in Jenin's branch office.

loans.use: to purchase a television and bedroom furniture

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo casada su esposa ama de casa, tiene su propio negocio venta de chatarra desde hace tiempo, sus hijos le apoyan en el negocio. Proyecto mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y aumentar sus ingresos mediante las ventas. Al inicio empezó con una carreta de caballo a la actualidad tiene una camioneta obtenido mayor capacidad para la recolección de chatarra.
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, láminas de zinc, tubos, camisa de 4 y codo de 4 entre otros materiales para repellar las paredes y el cambio de techo de la vivienda.
texts.en: Reynaldo is married and his wife stays at home. He has had is own business selling scrap for some time. His children help him with the business. His goal is to improve the conditions of their home and to increase their earnings through sales. He started out with a horse drawn carriage but today he has a van to collect greater quantities of scrap. With this loan he will purchase construction materials such as cement, iron rebars, zinc sheeting, tubes, and other materials needed to plaster the walls and to replace the roof of their house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Milciades Edmundo

texts.es:
Milciades hombre trabajador, professión agricultor desde muy joven inicio con la faena de dedicarse a la agricultura, inicio por el apoyo de la reforma agraria. Planes es mejorar el servicio de agua potable y hacer trabajo de conservación de suelo. 
Con el apoyo de su esposa comercializa el producto y así incrementa su ganancia. Con el préstamo que solicitad comprara fertilizantes e insumos para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Milciades is a hard-working man.  He is a farmer who started out in this line of work when he was very young, with the support of the land reform process.  His plans are to improve his drinking water service and to preserve his soil.

With the support of his wife, Milciades sells his produce and increases his profits.  He will use the loan he is requesting to buy fertilizers and supplies so that he can continue growing in his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem is an employee with a decent salary. He lives with his parents and shares with his father and his brothers the responsibility for taking care of the household expenses. Waseem took out a loan from FATEN to purchase new bedroom furniture for his sisters. Waseem's salary doesn't help him to buy the furniture so he took out a loan.

Waseem appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Hebron.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture

loans.name: Dilcia

texts.es:
la señora Dilcia P. A. tiene 47 años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de ella, su pareja le ayuda economicamente (trabaja para la empresa nacional portuaria) Dilcia tiene una pulperia desde hace 4 años en donde vende ropa inerior, shampoo, abarroteria, sandalias, zapatos.  su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos varios y asi surtir mas su negocio.
 
en lo particular doña Dilcia es una persona seria de pocas palabras y poca paciencia, tiene su casa propia.
su nivel de vida es bueno, tiene lo necesario y su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Dilcia P. A. is 47 years old and has one dependent child. Her partner helps out financially through his job working for the National Port Authority. For the past four years, Dilcia has managed a store where she sells undergarments, shampoo, groceries, sandals, and shoes. Her business is open Monday through Sunday. This loan will be used to buy various products to increase the inventory of her business.

Doña Dilcia is a serious person of few words who has little patience. She owns her home. Dilcia experiences a good standard of living and has what she needs. Her greatest wish is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase various products for her business.

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyny L. (in the photo) is 38, and her husband, Mr. Phaly Sin, is 39. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. Three are in school and another one stays at home. 
 
Sreyny is a fish seller; she buys fish from the market at the other side of Mekong River and resells in her village. Her husband is a wooden house builder. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is a married woman living in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for more than 30 years. Prescilla sells her harvest to rice traders. She works hard to provide her family with better living conditions. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

Prescilla's loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira B. D. T. D. 26 años D. edad, resiD. en casa alquilada con su compañero D. vida y su pequeño hijo en el Municipio D. Cojutepeque del Departamento D. Cuscatlán. Sandra tiene un pequeño negocio, el cual consiste en la venta D. frutas: sandias, melones, manzanas, naranjas, etc. Es una mujer llena D. vida y luchadora que sabe que la única forma D. salir adelante es trabajando y esto es lo que hace Sandra. Sueña con mejorar la oferta D. sus productos ya que sus clientes cada día la prefieren más por ser una mujer amable y por siempre tener la fruta en buenas condiciones y sobre todo al mejor precio. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita invertir en variedad D. frutas como: sandias, melones, mandarinas, manzanas, guineos, uvas, naranjas, y D. más frutas que hagan su negocio más atractivo. Con esto aspira obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan dar a su familia una vida más tranquila y estable.
texts.en:
Sandra Yanira B. D. T., 26, lives in a rented house with her life partner and small son in the town of Cojutepeque in Cuscatlán Department.

Sandra has a small business consisting of selling fruit: watermelon, melons, apple, oranges, etc.  She is a woman who is full of life and hard working who knows that the only way to get ahead in life is working and this is what Sandra does.

She dreams with improving her available stock since her customers prefer her daily because she’s a kind woman who always has fruit in good condition and, above all, at a better price.

This has pushed her to request this loan from INTEGRAL that will make it possible for her to buy a variety of fruit like: watermelon, melons, mandarins, apples, bananas, grapes, oranges and other fruit that will make her business more attractive. She hopes this will lead to better profits that will allow her to proviD. her family with a more tranquil, stable life.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Angines

texts.en:
Angines M. K. has been operating a retail shop for about four years and earns KES 10,000 per month. She is married to Kioko and they still do not have any children yet.
	
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of KES 5,000 to buy soft drinks (sodas), sugar and flour for resale and restocking her retail shop.  
		
In the future, she plans to grow her business and own a wholesale shop. She is a hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks (sodas), sugar and flour for resale

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Transitaire au Port Autonome de Lomé(PAL) depuis 2003, Kofi est marié et père de 03 enfants.il opère dans la Zone portuaire pour les besoins des clients qui le  sollicite pour le dédouanement de leurs  marchandises. Ce  crédit dans notre institution lui servira à acheter une moto pour lui faciliter les navettes effectuées  dans  son  travail et rendre de surcroît plus efficace ce qu’il fait  déjà bien.
texts.en: Koffi is a married father of three who has worked as a freight broker at Lomé's port since 2003. His work at the port entails assisting customers to pass their goods through customs.  This loan would enable him to purchase a motorbike which would enable him to reach his customers' ferries more easily and efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Assurance Group

texts.fr: ASSURANCE est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Mariam. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1961 au Bénin, Mariam vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants dans une ville du Bénin. Mariam est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Djawara et a des enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Mariam assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis environs quinze ans, Mariam vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Mariam achète ses produits dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Mariam et aux autres membres du groupement ASSURANCE de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Assurance is a group of fifteen members, and its president is named Mariam. The group members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. 

In order to increase their working capital, the group is seeking its first loan through Alidé.

Born in 1961 in Benin, Mariam lives with her husband and children in a city in Benin. Her husband Djawara is a farmer, and her children are all in school. Mariam and her husband pay the family's expenses jointly.

For fifteen years Mariam has been selling rechargeable phone cards from her home. This business generates revenue which helps her pay some of the family's expenses. She buys her products at one of Benin's markets.

This first loan will surely allow Miriam and other members of the Assurance group to expand their businesses and increase their client bases and revenues.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards wholesale.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 39 years old, works in the factory. Her husband is motorbike repairer. Their income is $14 per day. They have 3 children: 16, 12, and 8 years old, all studying. 

Every month Chanthorn has to spend around $70 on family expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1100 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She wants to get a place for her husband to run his career more easily and to able to get an increased income. For her children, she will be trying hard to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his wife to travel to work.

loans.name: Francia Nelia

texts.en: Francia lives in the El Paraiso region of Honduras where she makes a living preparing and selling baked goods to local shops and neighbors. She primarily sells a local favorite called rosquilla. Francia is a returning client with a punctual payment history. She is currently requesting a loan of HNL 5,000 to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, eggs, cheese, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Betty provides motorela or habal-habal motorcycle transport services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the business.

Betty is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for utilities

loans.name: Theu's Group

texts.en:
Theu was born in 1980. She is married with two children who are still small. Her husband is a hairdresser. Mrs. Theu sells beverages. She has had this job for three years. 

She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy more goods to sell. 

About another borrowers in her group:

Mong is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store. 

Quyen is 36 years old. She wants to borrow 3,706,000 VND to repair her shop.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Corazón De Jesús nace con el propósito de mejorar sus actividades. Este grupo fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellos, tanto social como económicamente, todas ellos son reconocidos en el lugar. Dominga es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, ella se dedica a una pulpería,  Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, pues cuenta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para ir a comprar sus productos. Ella dice que con el correr del tiempo ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, detergentes entre otros. También los otros integrantes del grupo tienen sus negocios y quieren el financiamiento para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Corazón De Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank was born with the intention of improving their business activities.  This group set their main objective to be the growth, as much social as economical, of each one of them.  All of them are recognized in their area.

Dominga is an enterprising and innovative woman; she has a general store.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman.  Every day she gets up in the very early hours of the morning to go buy her products.  She says that with the passing of time she now has a good customer base.

She is requesting the loan to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, and detergent, among other things.

The other members of the group also have businesses, and they want the loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, and detergent, among other things.

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Khot is a 29 year-old woman living in Baray district, Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. She is married to Nan, who is in the same age.  The couple has three children who are not yet old enough for school. 

Khot and Nan have a small fishing business. After fishing, Khot brings her fish to sell at the local market, which is far away from her community. She spends time riding a bicycle to the market every day. She and her husband have decided to purchase a new motorbike to allow them to transport their business in time. Due to the lack of money, Khot wishes to borrow some funds through HKL's partnership with Kiva.

This is Khot's third cycle of using a loan from HKL and the first cycle from Kiva.  Based on the use of loans from one cycle to another, this family is getting better and better. In the future, they want to live in a bigger house and send their children to university.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to transport their business in time.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Idrissa is 52 years old and married with 8 children, aged 11 to 25.  Six children are currently attending school.

Idrissa runs a provision-and-assorted-foodstuffs store in Goderich, a neighborhood in Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone.  He has owned this business for 4 years and sells batteries, sugar, mayonnaise, soft drinks, rubber drinks, and tea leaves. He also earns income from a small-scale fishing boat at sea. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation.

Idrissa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and assorted foodstuffs. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he plans to build a house and open another branch of his store.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as soft drinks, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 60-year-old married woman from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She makes a living as a farmer and tills her land to plant rice. Wilma also raises pigs to sell and earns about 9,000 PHP monthly doing these activities. 

Wilma is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, piglets, and and pig feed. She hopes to continue earning and providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, piglets, and pig feed

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Rosalinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy materials for her fishing business.
Rosalinda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в районе Кубодиён. Возраст, 55 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей. Его дети находятся в России на заработках. Сам Рустам зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров и теленка.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 55 years old, married and has three sons.  His children are working in Russia.  Rustam earns a living by breeding small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two cows and a calf.

loans.use: to buy two cows and a calf

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Peter is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale. His loan will help Peter to generate greater profits and pay his son's primary school fees. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to transition his business into wholesale.

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy commodities such as sugar to sell

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, este es el negocio de José comprar y vender cerdos, por eso continuamente busca los servicios crediticios para mantener siempre en su granja cerdos, engordarlos y cuidarlos para comercializaros.
Él y su familia viven en mejores condiciones y han solventado muchas necesidades a través del apoyo con los préstamos.
texts.en: José is seeking a loan to buy pigs. His business is buying and selling pigs, and to do so he continues to seek credit to maintain his herd, fattening them up and looking after them until he takes them to market. He and his family live in better conditions now and have resolved many of their difficulties with the support of previous loans.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es:
Gloria Amparo tiene 4 hijos y es consciente que para ofrecerles un mejor futuro necesita contribuir con su trabajo al cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar, para ello, desde hace más de 2 años, esta emprendora vende en su propa casa tropa por encargo, productos por catálogo y variedades, así como helados. 

Gloria necesita de un préstamo para comprar 2 vitrinas para acomodar y exhibir mejor sus productos, así como para comprar algunos productos de belleza de los catálogos que llegan a menor precio con el fin de comprar mayor cantidad y así incrementar sus ganancias. 

En el futuro sueña con tener su propio almacén donde ofrezca gran variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria Amparo has four children and she is aware that, in order to offer them a better future, she needs to work so that she can contribute towards covering her household expenses.  For this reason, more than two years ago this entrepreneur started selling goods from her home.  She sells catalog goods, miscellaneous goods and iced treats.

Gloria needs a loan to buy two display cases in which to better display her products.  She will also buy some catalog beauty products which are cheaper when you buy in bulk.  In this way, she will increase her profits.

In the future, Gloria dreams of owning her own store where she will sell a large variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy display cases and stock

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
Luis es una persona de 56 años, soltero, con  tres hijos, le gusta luchar por el trabajo y es humilde ya migable. Vive con sus tres hijos en San Gabriel que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi al Norte de Ecuador.

Luis es un agricultor responsable, empezó con este trabajo gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres y siembra todo tipo de productos porque le gusta su trabajo. Realizó un nuevo crédito en Fodemi porque va a invertir en la compra de materiales para fumigar su sembrío, que le servirá para proteger a su producción del mal clima y evitaría que tenga pérdidas económicas.

Su sueño es poder brindar productos de calidad ya que eso le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is 56 years old, single, and has 3 children. He likes to work hard, is humble, and friendly. He lives with his three children in San Gabriel located in the Carchi Province north of Ecuador.

Luis is a responsible farmer. He began this job with his parents teaching him and he plants all sorts of crops since he enjoys his work. He is requesting a new loan with Fodemi because he plans to buy fumigating materials for his crops to protect them from the unsuitable climate and prevent financial loses.

His dream is to offer quality products in order to increase profits.

loans.use: buy fumigating materials for his crops since the climate is unsuitable and he can risk loosing his entire crop.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – предпринимательница, торгующая женской обувью.  В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Светлана начала свой бизнес , арендовав торговое место на центральном рынке. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Светлана сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  20,000 сом (KGS). Хороший ассортимент товара Светланы, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе обуви привлекают  все больше и больше клиенток. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Светлана обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение зимнего  ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Светлана планирует вложить в покупку машины для транспортировки.
texts.en:
Svetlana is an entrepreneur selling women's footwear. In 2004, while searching for a source of income for her family, Svetlana started her business, renting a retail space in the central market. Through perseverance and dedicated work Svetlana was able to grow her business to a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). A good assortment of Svetlana's merchandise, friendly service, and practical advice in the selection of shoes attract more and more customers. 

In order to further develop her business, Svetlana contacted Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to expand her range of winter goods. Svetlana plans to use the profits from this loan to purchase a vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 74 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her store.

Carmelina has been in this business for eighteen years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, milk, noodles, etc.  

In the future, Carmelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame Mariame est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle vit avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans une famille polygame à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Mariame s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui est la teinture à Bamako avec la célèbre teinturière de la place ANTOU il y'a maintenant  sept ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (mariages, baptêmes, fêtes, etc.) mais ses ressources propres ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce 7ème prêt  pour acheter 10 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 sachets de soude caustique et 10 boites de teinture de couleurs différentes afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.    
 Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teinture) pour les mettre en couleur et ensuite les revendre soit au comptant et à crédit, a une  clientèle composée de revendeuses de bazins teintés, de couturiers et de femmes de son quartier.
Madame Mariam est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis environ cinq ans, a déjà eu 4 prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier “Association SOUTOURA de Sanoubougou II” et est maintenant à son septième prêt individuel   et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce septième prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 250 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Mariame is 49, married and a mother of 7. She lives with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in a polygamous family in Sanoubougou II, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Since she never went to school, for social reasons, seven years ago, Mariame got into an income-generating activity, cloth dying, with the famous dyer from the ANTOU square. She has quite a reputation in this business and gets lots of orders, especially for ceremonies (weddings, christenings, parties, etc.) but with her own resources, she cannot meet this demand. That is why, in order to meet the needs of her growing clientele, she is applying for a 7th loan so she can buy 10 rolls of white damask, 10 bags of caustic soda, and 10 boxes of dye of various colors.
She buys these items (white damask, caustic soda, and dye) in Bamako so she can dye them and then resell them cash or on credit, to a clientele composed of dyed damask resellers, tailors, and women from her neighborhood.
Mariame has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for about 5 years. She has already gotten 4 solidarity loans with “SOUTOURA Association of Sanoubougou II,” a women's association in her neighborhood and this is her seventh individual loan. All previous loans have been successfully paid back.
With this seventh loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 250.000 FCFA, which she plans on using to contribute to her family's expenses by helping her husband, pay back her loan, and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy damask, caustic soda, and dye.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 33-year-old married woman and she lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

She is responsible for three family members. 

Abeer is requesting a loan of 400 JOD so that she can improve her home living conditions and do some home maintenance. She would like to begin a private project in the near future.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions.

loans.name: Iris Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Iris, and for the last five years I’ve been selling products for men, women, and kids. I order the products from catalogs or buy them at bigger stores, and then resell them to neighbors, family, and friends. I keep the products in my house, and then I distribute them according to the orders I receive.

Loan Use: Purchase shampoo, body and face lotions, deodorants, and nail polish.

Me llamo Iris y me dedico a vender productos a hombres, mujeres, niños, desde hace cinco años. Estas ventas las hago por pedidos de catalogos o compra en tiendas para revender a personas particulares vecinos, familia, amigos. Mi producto los tengo en mi casa y luego los distribuyo por pedidos que las personas me hacen.

loans.use: Compra de shampoo, cremas de cuerpo y cara, desodorantes y esmalte de uñas.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is the mother of four children, ages 13 to 30. For the last 30 years she has had a small business selling baked goods at the market. Currently, she operates two vending kiosks and sees a monthly gross income of around $3,500. Mariya has a reputation as a goal oriented, hard-working, but pleasant merchant. Her desire is to see her children succeed and her business is one way that she is able to accomplish that goal. Mariya enjoys her work and is known to respond to economic opportunity. She has established a good credit history by diligently repaying 3 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Mariya is requesting a loan for $200 which will allow her to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase the assortment of baked goods she offers and continue to sell for affordable prices, which will attract customers and increase her sales profits.

В Марії четверо дітей, від 13 до 30 років. На протязі останніх 30 років вона займається власним бізнесом з продажу випічки на місцевому ринку. Зараз в неї вже два кіоски, щомісяця вона отримує приблизно 3500 доларів доходу. Марія – дуже цілеспрямована, працьовита й дуже привітна жінка. Більш за все вона прагне забезпечити своїх дітей, й бізнес надає їй єдину можливість досягти цієї мети. Марії дуже подобається її робота, вона вміло орієнтується в сфері бізнесу й торгівлі. В неї чудова кредитна історія в «Надії України», вона справно сплатила 3 позики, які отримала в організації. Марія просить про позику в 200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів. Вона планує урізноманітнити вибір здоба, якою торгує у своїх кіосках, за тими ж прийнятними цінами. Це привабить багато нових покупців та збільшить її прибуток від продажів.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German has been able to combine his love of the outdoors with business in his small sales operation where he sells coats and cold weather gear and a variety of denim clothing. He runs several kiosks in the town of Marganetz, near Nikopol, Ukraine.

German has done well with his business. He started 10 years ago. Currently he has about $4000 worth of inventory in his kiosks and he makes about $400 per month. He is able to set himself apart from his competitors by offering a large selection of products for customers to choose from. German is a hard-working, goal-oriented businessman who’d like to continue growing his enterprise by opening new sales locations.

German has requested a loan to increase his working capital. This will give him the flexibility to purchase inventory at reduced prices and help him pursue his goals for business expansion.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives in a domestic partnership and has four children, all of them students. Her partner is a mechanical technician, but isn't able to help with all the home expenses and their children's school. She and the children go without many things they need and to improve their quality of life, Maria started to sell jewelry eight years ago. Little by little, she has increased her customers and incorporated the sales of linen, obtaining very good results.

To continue growing, Maria is requesting a loan of $650 which she will use to buy merchandise to be able to meet her customers' orders and offer good service. She will return this amount in 6 months. Be part of the growth of this business and help improve the life of this family. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos, todos ellos estudiantes, su pareja es técnico mecánico pero no le ayuda con todos los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, ella y sus hijos pasaban muchas necesidades económicas y para mejorar su calidad de vida Maria comenzó a vender joyería hace ocho años, poco a poco fueron incrementando sus clientes e incorporó la venta de lencería obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Para continuar creciendo Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella regresará esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Selafina

texts.en: Selafina is the oldest member of Samalaeulu Centre. She is 70 years of age with 8 children and 24 grandchildren. She has been a tailor since she was young, With the help of her mother, who passed away ages ago, she was able to sew, cut, and learned how to join cuttings into dresses, shirts, and pants. She has decided to pass on her talent to her children, especially her granddaughters. She decided to join SPBD, where she thought she could build her own business, and even her daughters could join whenever they wanted. She bought herself a new sewing machine, and some materials for making dresses and shirts. She is planning to teach her daughters, so that when she dies, she is happy that she has shared her talent with her children. Selafina is a widow.

loans.use: To start a sewing business

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Ganvoy is a 58 year old refugee from the Aghdam region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  Right now she lives with her family of her husband and four children in the Garachukhur settlement in suburbs of Baku.  She started her business of food trade in 1993, right after being relocated, because she had to earn a living for her family.  Her husband does now work and helps in her business with things such as transporting goods to the store.  At the beginning, she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed her first loan to buy goods for the store.  Her husband has also built a booth for her.  Now she wants to buy a counter-refrigerator to store meat, ice cream and diary products.  To do this, she has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her store

loans.name: Enung

texts.en: Enung is 35 years old and a mother of one child, aged 16. She sells sheets and blankets on credit and usually earns US$5 per day. Her husband, A., is a laborer who earns a small income. Enung requests a loan of IDR 900,000 to buy more goods to sell, so she can earn more money for her child's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more sheets and blankets to sell

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old and married with 1 child. She has a crafts shop where she sells various craft pieces.
She intends to buy building materials from the extra profits.

loans.use: Add in stock and increase supplies

loans.name: Solo Fb Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jane N.. She sells used clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jane is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 4 children ranging in age from 2 months to 13 years. Three of the children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGS 40000 (US$24.00) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to pay school fees for the children Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGS 150000 (US$88.00) to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Christine K. and Zam M.. Christine K. sells dry fish and wants to expand her business. Zam M. is currently operating a business in tailoring and selling clothes and wants a loan to buy another sewing machine and more cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ratha Chab's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratha C. (pictured with her husband on the right) was selected to be the group leader for a loan from Maxima. The group includes four families, who live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1- Mrs. Ratha C. and her husband married in 1997. They have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and other two still young and stay at home. Ratha has done laundry at her home for two years and her husband has been a construction worker for ten years. Mrs. Ratha is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $100 to purchase construction material for her husband.

2- Mrs. Sreynorn P. and her husband married in 2004 and have two little sons. Sreynorn is employed cutting grass for cows and her husband has been a construction worker for 7 years. She is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $100 to repairing her house.

3- Mrs. Sinoun L. (pictured with her daughter on the left) is a widow with six children: five sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a motor taxi driver; the second son cuts grass for re-sale; her daughter works in a garment factory, and the other three children are studying in local schools. Sinoun has sold lotus fruit at the market in Phnom Penh for two years. She is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $200 to replace an old trailer with a new passenger trailer for her son’s motor taxi business.

4- Mrs. Sreynet P. and her husband married in 2006 and have one daughter. Sreynet sells corn at the village market and her husband has been a construction worker for 6 years. She is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $100 to buy corn for re-sale.

loans.use: For purchasing construction materials, repairing a house, changing motor taxi trailer, and buying corn for re-sale

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhem S. is 32 years old and has been selling groceries for eleven years in the market of Kbal Hong Village, Pursat Province. She earns about $2.66 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chim Chantha, is a 36-year-old farmer and motorcycle taxi driver, earning up to $3.66 per day. They have two children, both of whom are young students. S. requests a loan of $1,100 to expand her grocery inventory and increase her income. She hopes this loan will strengthen her busines

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a 30 year old woman. She has one child. She lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Zaynab sells women's and children's clothing. This is the fourth time she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ni Kadek Wartini

texts.id:
The first loan that Ni Kadek Wartini received was used to buy one sow. Every morning and evening, she worked to prepare the feed for the sow. The sow bore 8 piglets, which were raised for 3 months. After the piglets were old enough, Ni Kadek Wartini sold them. In Bali, people buy pigs for consumption and for religious ceremonies. A pig can sell for $35 - $40. All her sales reached $300 with a net profit of $70 after all expenses for the feed. This income has not been able to support her family of 5.

With this second loan, Ni Kadek Wartini needs an additional capital of $150, which will be used to buy 2 more sows. She hopes to increase her profit even more in order to help her husband support their household needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman tahap pertama dipergunakan oleh Ni Kadek Wartini untuk membeli 1 induk babi. Setiap pagi dan sore menyiapkan pakan untuk babinya. Satu induk dapat melahirkan 8 ekor bibit babi dan dipelihara selama 3 bulan. Setelah dirasa cukup besar kemudian anak babi dijual. Kebiasaan yang ada di Bali adalah keperluan daging babi untuk konsumsi dan keperluan untuk upacara keagamaan. Harga per ekornya mencapai Rp. 350.000.- sampai dengan Rp. 400.000,- Total penjualan seluruhnya dapat mencapai Rp. 3.000.000,-Keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 700.000,- setelah dikurangi semua pengeluaran untuk pakan. Dari pendapatan ini belum bisa menopang kehidupan keluarganya yang berjumlah 5 orang. Dengan pinjaman tahap kedua ini, Ni Kadek Wartini membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha Rp. 1.400.000.- Pinjaman ini akan dibelikan 2 ekor induk lagi sehingga keuntungan akan lebih banyak lagi, sehingga dapat membantu pendapatan suami untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya

loans.use: To buy pig sows

loans.name: Hellen Nakato's Group

texts.en:
Hellen N. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 24 years old, single, and has no children. Helen lives in a slum in an urban suburb of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Hellen began operating her business of running a canteen upon joining MCDT. There is a ready market for her goods, especially during the school year as children are her biggest customers. Since she began operating, Hellen has expanded her business to include a pay phone that also brings in daily income. Her greatest difficulty is that sometimes the school children do not have enough money to pay for her goods.

With this loan Hellen plans on boosting her business and helping pay her sister’s school fees. Hellen hopes that one day she will have enough profits to open up a big shop.

Hellen has successfully paid back six loans since she began working with MCDT.

loans.use: Invest in business to help pay school fees

loans.name: Thi Tuyen's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Thi Minh, born in 1962 (MS 03050003), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000 to buy marketing supplies. Her husband is a carpenter at the family business. Every day she sells pork meat, bringing in an average income of 150.000vnd/day. She and her husband struggL. with 3 very young children that is currently in school. She hopes to obtain a loan to help improve her family income. Presently, she is the leader of her loan group. She believes that this loan will give her the opportunity to D. more business. Her loan group consists of the following members:

  • Ms. D. Thi Minh, born in 1962 (MS 03050003), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to buy marketing supplies.
  • Ms. L. Thi Hoan, born in 1962 (MS 03050004), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in woodshop.
  • Ms. N. Thi Thoi, born in 1961 (MS 03050006), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in woodshop.
  • Ms. N. Thi Nha, born in 1962 (MS 03050007), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to buy marketing produce supplies.
  • Ms. D. Thi Khuong, born in 1977 (MS 03050002), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd for wood sculpting.
  • Ms. N. Thi Hoan, born in 1964 (MS 03050005), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to buy supplies for her tofu business.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    Đinh Thị Tuyến, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 03050001), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc tại xưởng gỗ của gia đình, bản thân chị hàng ngày đi chợ bán thịt lợn có thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 150.000 vnđ / ngày. Vợ chồng chị có ba con đang đi học nên gia đình chị vẫn còn vất vả. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay vốn để đi chợ giúp kinh tế gia đình cải thiện. Đồng thời chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn sẽ tạo cơ hội để chị mạnh dạn, hoạt bát hơn trước. Nhóm vay của chị còn có: Đỗ Thị Minh, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050003), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ. Lê Thị Hoan, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050004), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Nguyễn Thị Thơi, sinh năm 1961 (Ms 03050006), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Nguyễn Thị Nhã, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050007), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ hoa quả. Đỗ Thị Khương, sinh năm 1977 (Ms 03050002), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Nguyễn Thị Hoàn, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 03050005), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để mua đỗ về làm đậu phụ.

loans.use: sản xuất

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina Y. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Philomina sells Gamrole (made of flour) on the Cape Coast, which she has done since 2005. Philomina uses her income to pay for school fees, and food for the family. Philomina will use the loan to purchase more ingredients like margarine, flour and other ingredients for the Gamrole. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philomina plans to assist her husband in building a family house.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients like margarine and flour to make Gamrole.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela se dedica a la venta de madera trabajada (cortada en diferentes medidas) ingresó en este negocio gracias a la ayuda de unos amigos que laboran en ello. La madera la vende seleccionada de acuerdo a la calidad, y gracias a la buena administración de su negocio, puso a lado del mismo una pequeña ferretería, donde concurren muchos mototaxistas, quienes son sus principales clientes, ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo ya que por medio del mismo solventa las necesidades de su hijo, que es la razón de su vida. Ella es madre soltera, sin embargo, no eso, no truncó su camino por seguir adelante, ya que se considera una microempresaria.Mariela quiere alquilar otro local para el almacenamiento de sus maderas trabajadas y de esa manera proveer a sus consumidores de una forma rápida, sin embargo, para esto estima de un capital para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mariela makes a living selling lumber of different sizes, an activity she entered thanks to the help of friends who also work in the field. The wood she sells is selected according to quality, and thanks to her good business skills, she set up shop on the side of a small hardware store that is popular among taxi drivers, her principle customers. She feels pleased with her work since it has help provide for her son, her reason for living. Mariela is a single mother, but she did not let that stand in her way when she considered starting her small business. She wants to rent another storefront to warehouse her merchandise and in this way can fulfill her customers' orders more quickly. Of course, she needs capital to achieve this objective, which is why she's requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a storefront to store her lumber products

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La señora Inocencia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en la Calle 24 Mz. 24 Lt 9 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como independiente. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal de Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con el negocio de venta de chicharrones. Trabaja todos los días en el mercado Nº 1 desde las 10 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. con la ayuda de su esposo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 30 menudencia diarias, 8 kilos de chanco, 2 racimos de plátanos y un motokar de segunda para tener mas ingresos y pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 
  
Inocencia se siente muy contenta porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo y a su habilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Inocencia belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres de Exito" (Successful Women). She lives at 24th Street, block 24, lot 9 in the Asentamiento Humano, Primavera Segunda Etapa, in the district of Calleria, Coronel Portillo province, in the deparment of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and a mother of 6 grown children. She is married and her husband is self-employed. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in selling candy. She has worked with the communal bank of Manuela Ramos for 8 years.

Nowadays she has a business selling chicharrones (fried pork skin). She works every day in the Number 1 market from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m. with the help of her husband.

With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be paid off in 5 months, she will buy 30 giblets daily, 8 kilos of pork, 2 bunches of plantains, and a used motokar (a motorcycle with a cart behind it) to have more income and pay her loan on time.

Inocencia feels very pleased because all that she has accomplished is thanks to her effort and her skill.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy giblets, pork, plantains, and a second-hand motokar (motocycle with a cart behind)

loans.name: Balvina

texts.en:
Balvina is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Balvina is married and has seven children. She is 43 years old. She sells fruit from a mobile cart near the Magdalena market. She works from 8am to 7pm each day with the help of her children.  Balvina needs a loan of 800 soles to buy pineapples, bananas, papayas, and peaches.  Balvina’s dreams are to build a home from bricks and cement, to proviD. a good education for her children, and to expand her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
 
Balvina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.  
Balvina es casada, tiene 43 años y 7 hijos, Balvina venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria cerca del mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 7 D. la noche con la ayuda D. sus hijos. 
Balvina necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. piña, plátano, papaya, durazno. 
Los sueños D. Balvina son construir su casa con material noble, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy pineapples, bananas, papayas, and peaches to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a dos cosas principalmente, confecciona zapatos con su máquina de coser cuero y cría animales menores, especialmente cuyes, para ello instaló una granja bien acogedora para sus animales, todas las mañanas sale al campo a cortar  y curtir el pastizal que es el alimento especial de sus cuyes, luego, junto a su esposo, comienzan a armar los zapatos para cubrir los pedidos que tiene, venden por docena y su mejor época es durante los meses de marzo y abril, cuando se inicia el año escolar. Para Lina estas dos actividades son las fuentes de ingreso económico para su familia, y se siente muy contenta y satisfecha de su trabajo. Es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y es considerada una de las clientas de mayor confianza. Con el dinero que solicita comprará las piezas para mejorar su máquina de coser cuero, fertilizante para sus pastos y también una parte del pago para la compra de una vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Lina is 26 years old and she lives with her husband and her 2 children. Mainly she makes shoes with her sewing machine and breeds small animals, especially guinea-pigs and she had a cosy farm set up for her animals. Every morning she cuts and treats grass which is the special food for guinea-pigs, then, together with her husband, she begins making the shoes for the existing orders. They sell by the dozen and the best months are March and April when the school-year starts. These two activities represent the income source for the family and Lina is happy and satisfied with her work. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is considered one of the most reliable clients. With the money she will buy spare parts for her sewing machine, fertilizer for the grass, and a downpayment for a milk cow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her sewing machine for leather.

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married and has two grown children and many grandchildren. This year she will be 60 years old.  She lives with her husband in a one bedroom apartment.   Nadiya sells children's clothing at the Melitopol central market. She started this business 8 years ago. Nadiya has her own kiosk and takes good care of it. When she was asked why she decided to sell children's clothing Nadiya said that she loves children and wants them to have good clothing. She does not charge high prices so that parents can afford new clothing for their children. 
Nadiya is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 40 años, tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales dos D. ellos realizan estudios superiores en Lima, y con el resto viven en su casa D. L. chacra. L. agricultura es una actividad que L. ha dado penas, cuando no hubo producción, y también alegrías en tiempos D. buena cosecha. En una D. esas cosechas exitosas D. café logró comprar más campos D. cultivo, asimismo adquirió un motocarro que le permite sacar sus cosechas D. L. chacra a L. ciudad y hace poco ha obtenido el permiso para transporte público en L. municipalidad, generando ingresos económicos adicionales para su hogar. Los cultivos D. sus chacras los realiza junto a su esposo y sus hijos, y ahora que su moto está lista para circular por L. ciudad su esposo L. manejará, y cuando tenga labor agrícoL. L. alquilarán. Eugenia es muy activa en s banco comunal, pese a L. distancia en que vive, está bien enterada D. todas las actividades que realizan donD. participa con mucho dinamismo. Este es su 3er préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en las fechas programadas sin caer en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para terminar D. pagar los trámites para L. circulación D. su motocarro, y también invertirá en L. compra D. fertilizantes para su chacra D. café.
texts.en:
