Eugenia is 40 years old. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are studying in Lima and 3 of whom live at home. The family lives on the plot of land they cultivate together. It hasn't been easy making a living off of agriculture because sometimes there hasn't been anything to harvest. Then again, there have also been good times, when the harvest was large. Once, the family had such a good coffee crop, they were able to buy more land and even a scooter. Not only does the scooter make it easier for them to transport their crops to the market in the city, but they have also received a license to use it for public transportation. Now, when it is not needed at home, Eugenia's husband will drive the scooter as a taxi and bring in some extra income. Eugenia is a very active member of her communal bank and despite how far away from the other members she lives, she is always involved in their activities. This is her third loan, and she has always been punctual with her payments. She plans to use this loan to pay off the cost of getting her scooter licensed and also, to buy some fertilizer for her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transport license and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Jellype

texts.en:
Jellype B. is a rice grower. Her harvest helps her raise her family. The income she gets from her farm helps her pay tuition and book fees for her children. She is 49 years old and has 6 children. Her husband, Rufo B., is the manager on the farm. Together, they are doing their best to increase the harvest for their family.

She is asking a loan of Php 11,000 to CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. She believes the loan will help in increasing her yield. In this way, she will have more support to give to her children. 

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.  CEVI believes their work is important to help alleviate people from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Seven years ago, Mahbuba started her women's clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Mahbuba has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of three chidlren. Throughout the last year, IMON International has provided assistance to Mahbuba’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Mahbuba has used her previous loans wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to replace depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for teenagers.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sitha Luch, 43, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their sons is a cobbler in a shoe factory, one daughter is a garment factory worker and two other children attend school.

Soeun is a farmer. Her husband has been a construction worker since 1989; he works in Phnom Penh. Soeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina is 28 years old and married, with a 10-year-old child. She has been a dressmaker in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works at her business for eight hours every day and earns an average monthly profit of $25.

She belongs to the R'haigawanyiki group loan (group code 2080) and is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more items for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her increase profits and grow her business so that she can save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Thành Lê Thị, 44 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Thành owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. Thành has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Thành joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she could help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Thành has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Thành is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Thành plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, drinks, and other general merchandise

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is a very patient woman who is still single at age 37. She works as a Day Care teacher in their village and her little salary comes from the village fund. To have extra income, Filipina ventured into the hog raising business. To contribute is a big help for her family, especially since she is the only child whom her parents depend on. She is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders to have enough financial support to supply the daily food for her hogs. She wants to give her parents a prosperous life and somehow be able to uplift them from their poor living situation.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: 16 Magnificas Group

texts.es:
“Magníficas” es un grupo de señoras dinámicas, todas escuchan atentas a la explicación de la asesora, sobre la importancia de la garantía solidaria. Ellas tienen negocios pequeños como: venta de víveres, ropa de bebe, garrafas, accesorios de celulares, tejido de prendas, elaboración de embutidos y otros, requieren el préstamo para comprar arroz, lana, funda de celular, carne y así incrementar su mercadería.

Maria Q. tiene el negocio de embutidos y  menciona que la capacitación que recibe en las reuniones  sobre la administración del negocio le ayuda a no perder las cuentas y tener en orden su negocio.
texts.en:
“Magníficas” is a dynamic group of women. All of them listen attentively to the advice explaining the importance of their solidarity loan. They are small businesses owners involved in selling groceries, baby clothes, bottles, mobile phone accessories, woven garments, sausages and others items. They require a loan to buy rice, wool, mobile phone covers and meat in order to increase their merchandise.

Maria Q. has a sausage business. She mentioned that the training she received at the meetings has helped her organize her business and prevented her from losing customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren C. is a 59-year-old widow. She lives with her daughter and two granddaughters in a rented place in Arhangai, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her grandchildren attend local elementary schools and her daughter runs a small business at the local market.

In 2008, Byambasuren started a catering business. She makes a variety of traditional meals and sells them to a local retailers. Her clients are mostly salesman and woman who have a stalls at the local market. She purchases meat, vegetables, rice, and flour for 20,000 tugrugs (equal to $ 14 USD) every day and makes around 40-50 dishes per day.

She says "I'm getting experiences pretty much. So I'm started thinking to rent a small space at the market and open my own cafe since my clients are like to have a meal i cooked for them".

With this loan, she will buy whole animals for meat for her tiny business, because meat is cheapest during the summer.

loans.use: To buy whole-animal meats

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo cuenta con 34 años de edad, vive en su propio taller que está en alquiler, aunque tiene casa propia en la comunidad de las barreras la misma que alquila. Junto a su esposa la codeudora de 29 años y sus 5 hijos de 11-9-8-6-4 años de edad. Eduardo tiene su gomería con muchos años de antigüedad en plena avenida principal de la localidad donde también vende llantas y aros semi nuevos. Finalmente compra chatarras al por menor las acumula y luego las vende al por mayor. Y su esposa la codeudora es profesora de básico en la comunidad de batavia en la unidad educativa del mismo nombre. La competencia es mediana, esto debido a que existen otras gomerías en el medio pero debido a su antigüedad y ubicación de la misma tiene bastante clientela, mas los complementos que tiene para ofrecer. Como dije anteriormente son varios años de trabajo en el rubro y la ubicación sobre todo en plena Av. Principal final norte. En cuanto a su esposa es mensual y seguro. Eduardo invirtió todo el monto del préstamo solicitado en la compra del lote de terreno que tenia predestinado en la comunidad de las barreras, este seria el octavo préstamo de Eduardo y todos los anteriores los a cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 34 years old, and he lives in his auto shop, a space he rents. He also rents a house in the Barreras community where he has his family: His 29 year old wife and their five children, aged 11, 9, 8, 6, and 4 years old. Eduardo has had his auto shop for many years now. It is located in the main street of the area where he also sells tires and used bearings. He buys and sells wrecked cars. His wife is a primary school teacher in the Batavia community. There is a fair amount of competition in the market, especially because there are other auto shops, but given his seniority and the location of his shop he sees a steady stream of clients. His wife has a steady job and earns monthly wages. Eduardo will invest the amount of the loan to purchase a plot of land in the Barreras community. This will be Eduardo's eighth loan, with all previous loans successfully repaid on time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Togetherness #2 Group

texts.en:
Togetherness #2 consists of a group of five borrowers, led by Manyunbry K., who is from Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Manyunbry is single, as a result of having refused to live a life of polygamy with her husband.  She has three children, aged eight to 13 years old who are in fourth through sixth grades. Weedor was forced to drop out of high school and was given to an elderly man as one of his many wives. She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Manyunbry business consists of selling palm oil wholesale, which is used for cooking and making soap in the Bokeza market and other markets in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for the past two years.  Today, her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  She’s requesting a loan so that she can purchase raw materials and increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round.  She treats her customers so well that she believes they will come to her store year-round from adjacent villages.  With the profits, she will invest in the future of her kids, especially to send them to school - of which she was unable to attend.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for soap production so that she can run her business year-round

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: K., a 24-year-old woman living in Siem Reap Province, earns a living by selling ice blocks. K. is married to Sarith, age 23, who assists with her in this business. They live with three teenage children who are attending school. K. has been building her house for months, but the construction is stalled due to lack of tools. Therefore, K. would like a loan of US $200 to buy additional housing tools to continue building.

loans.use: To buy additional housing tools

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem T. is a villager in Sisla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer in the local village. Aside from this farming, she breeds pigs. In these businesses, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy pig food, fertilizers and hire a laborer to plow the field; thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Kheiv Mok, is a cart driver who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sem T. is 60 year old and the mother of a child who is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy pig food, fertilizers and hire a laborer to plow the field.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie N. is 43 years old, married with four children aged 10 through 19, and she takes care of one dependent who is 21 years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district near Kigali. She is a proven entrepreneur! Since 2003, Eugenie has owned a small fruit shop where she employs two people from her community. Her shop is open every day from 7AM to 5PM.

Eugenie is requesting her first loan from vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through buying more volume and varieties of fruit and produce for sale.

loans.use: Fruit and Produce

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 65-year-old married woman with three children aged between 30 and 50 years, none of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, school fees for her grandchildren and water and electricity bills.

Kasifa sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She buys her clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping. 

Kasifa has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for six years and is servicing her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes.

Kasifa is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen O. is a 46-year-old married woman who currently resides in the territory of Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia. She is a local merchant who has been in business for more than three years.

Pen O. is blessed with four children; three are married and have started new homes and the other one is single. All of her children are employed in different jobs. Her husband is a carpenter who decorates wood to be used for furniture. Pen O. hopes to earn more income by using her loan to purchase a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for farmers

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla P. is a 32-year-old woman who has dedicated her life to cattle breeding. That is why, seven years ago, she decided to move forward with raising livestock. She began with just one cow. Every morning, she goes out early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in hopes that they return happy and satisfied.

Leyla is motivated to continue in this arduous work by the thought of her future and her parent who is under her charge. In order to succeed in her business, she and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in hopes of ultimately selling them at a good price. 
However, with the support of this loan, Leyla would now like to purchase more species of livestock to increase her clientele. With your support, she will be able to accomplish her business goals, thus helping to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. Rebecca is a trader. She trades in pastries. She bakes and fries meat pies and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers. Rebecca has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients, in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk.

loans.name: Veang

texts.en:
Veang T. T., 25, is a determined and hardworking woman who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Currently, she owns a hand cart which she uses to hawk (sell) meatballs around her community, typically earning approximately $3 per day which is used to meet her family’s needs.

Her husband helps cover the family's costs by selling ice blocks and also working in construction. The couple now have two school-aged children. Veang T. T. will be using her first loan to increase the financial capital of her business.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her business

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se S. is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Since 2007, Se has been employed at a local garment factory in the city, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband, pictured, is an ice cream seller. Se and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure that their family maintains a good standard of living.

She would like to strengthen her family's earning power to better cover their daily living expenses. Therefore, S. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase a new motorbike and an ice cream container in order to expand and improve her husband's current business. This would be her first loan through CREDIT.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's business by purchasing a new motorbike and an ice cream container

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 48 años y 03 hijos todos independientes. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Vilma, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, lleva 08 años en el negocio. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, su sueño es implementar su propio Minimarket bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en el cumplimiento de ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín, Peru. She is single, 48 years old and has three children, all of whom are grown up and independent. Vilma has a high school education. She decided to sell prepared meals out of a well-conditioned space out of her home and has eight years of experience tending to her customers. She tells us that every day she has very good results because of the rich flavor of her foods. Her primary customers are the townspeople, passers-by and regular clients whom she knows, and she says her food is always well-received. Currently, she plans to continue with the business and is very pleased with the work she does from day to day. Vilma personally tends to her customers with the charisma she is known for. With the loan of 2, 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase ingredients for the daily preparation of her meals, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chicken and vegetables, as well as some utensils to add to her business and provide a better service to her customers. Vilma has a strong desire to keep making headway, and her dream is to start her own mini-market. She is grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her become a great entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her meals

loans.name: Kigunda Tukwatanise Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
T. Colonel has a business of brick laying in Kiboti trading centre. He makes and burns the bricks. His customers are often unpredictable, although they keep coming to him because of his good customer care skills. He is a friendly and hardworking man, married with eight children between the ages of 2 and 15 years.

Colonel works hard to ensure that he expands regionally and has a steady supply. He works to have a stable family. He needs a loan to help him expand his business by enabling him to buy firewood for burning his bricks.

He is shown at the top left in the small photo and also appears in the group photo. He is the leader of his lending group.

loans.use: To buy firewood for burning his bricks

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 34 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Khalil has been working as agriculture for fifteen years. He owns citrus fruit trees. He is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best. He decided on doing his business because he took after his family’s business and gained experience when he was young since he used to work with his father. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from different regions. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and for the harvesting of his trees. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools and for the harvesting of his trees.

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en:
Chourb R., age 28, is married and resides with his children in Takeo province, Cambodia. He has three children. He is engaged in the agriculture sector of grinding rice for sale, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife (pictured) is engaged in a business of weaving Cambodian traditional products, earning an income of 2 USD per day.

Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. R. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Kelly Jovanny

texts.es:
Kelly es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el sector Alan García del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace mas de 4 años ella compró una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con unos ahorros que tenía. Actualmente alquila el vehículo a un chofer de la zona para que este brinde el servicio dentro de la localidad y en los caseríos que la rodean. Los ingresos que percibe constituyen una importante fuente de ayuda a la economía familiar.

El contínuo uso brindado a la unidad móvil y los caminos accidentados de la zona han hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Kelly es una mujer emprendedora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos y asi ayudarlos a salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus coutas.
texts.en:
Kelly, 31, lives with her husband and children in the Alan García neighborhood of Olmos district, Lambayeque province, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. A little over four years ago she used some savings she had to buy a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). She currently leases it to a driver in the area so that he can provide transportation services within the locality and to surrounding settlements. The income she earns is an important source of family support. The continuous use of the vehicle along the rough roads in the area has brought about the urgent need for service and repairs in order for it to continue operating properly. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa to request a 1000 new sol loan. Kelly is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide a good education for her children and help them succeed in life. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has shown responsibility and punctuality with respect to loan installment repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental Province. She is 45 years old. Josephine is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector buying and selling green bananas. The main source of income for the business comes from selling green bananas to the local market and to the local community as well. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional green bananas to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira B. would like to invest in a motorized fishing boat for her husband’s fishing business through a loan she is presently requesting. She would like to grow her fish selling business with the help of her husband to support her dreams for her family. 

It was in the year 1998 that she became a member of ASHI. Then her dream of having her own income generating activity and a source of income came true as it is financed by the loans she received through the institution she became a member of.  By buying and selling fish directly to people around the village, the whole town, and in the market, Elvira has able to support the basic needs of her family, especially her seven children whose ages now ranges from four to 24 years old. Aside from the financial support of her second husband who is a fisherman, Elvira is very much thankful for the love he gives not only to her and their own four children but also to her two children from her earlier broken marriage as well. With him, and with the increasing amount of loans Elvira can access through ASHI, she is hopeful that one day, her children will enjoy their lives and that access to their basic needs such food, clothing and education is no longer limited.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to make clothing

loans.name: Mr. Sarun Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten people living in Ampil Tuek village in Kandal Province. Mr. Sarun Y. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for various purposes.

Sarun is a fisherman, selling his catches to support his family. He is now applying for a loan to repair his fishing boat. His wife, Mrs. Yut Luy, is a baby shell seller. Sarun has six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending local public school.

The day of the loan disbursement Mr. Sarun Y. was busy working, so his wife, Mrs. Yut Luy, shown in the above photo, received the loan for him.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza 1 Group

texts.en:
Gloria is the coordinator of her group, Luz de la Esperanza (Light of Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding San Pedro, a poor area where the economy used to thrive on sugar cane but has more recently waned, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Gloria is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more clothes to sell. She will use the profits to convert her wooden home to a concrete structure that will be more sturdy. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en: Phourng H., 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. H. and her husband sell wooden furniture for an income of USD 6 per day. H. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Phourng appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Meas E..  She lives in a wooden house. She built a small store where she sells dessert and cake to the villagers for a profit.

She is married to Tong Kheng, age 31, who shares responsibility for his family by selling wooden beds. Meas E. has an older wooden house which needs repairs, so Meas E. will be using her first loan to mend and decorate it.

loans.use: To mend and decorate her old house.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut N. is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Ketut N. is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sarwa Wiguna (PK-10252).

Ni Ketut N. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut N. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut N. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut N. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut N. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Ketut N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.



"

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros L., who lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province, was born in 1967. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Moreover, she is also a farm laborer. She is widow with two children who are both seamstresses in a garment factory.

Mrs. Ros L. has a problem because it is time to grow rice but she does not have rice seed. So, to improve matters, she is applying for a loan to buy rice seed; with the rest of the loan she plans to buy fertilizer and hire a farm laborer and a plowing machine to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to hire a laborer and a plowing machine to plow her field

loans.name: Mahram

texts.en:
R. Mahram is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She started her own business ten years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough to cover their family expenses. She sells confectionery like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income she generates allows Mahram to support her family. 

Mahram dreams of educating all of her children with a higher education. Today she is requesting 4,300 TJS. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she sells. She is planning to spend the income for the well being of her family as well as for educating her children.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing confectionery for enlarging the range of goods

loans.name: Sisters Of Bong Mines Bridge Group

texts.en:
Gorpu T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Sisters Of Bong Mines Bridge'.  She is 43 years old, single, and has three children between the ages of 14 and 21 years. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to financial difficulties.

For 14 years, she has been selling palm oil and rice in Bong Mines Bridge Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 21,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of palm oil. She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sweetie is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito B. is from the village of Brgy. Darubba, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Charito is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Charito owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from retailing rice in the local community. Charito has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Charito from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah  K.  lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.    She also takes care of additional family members (mother and her sister's children).  

Norah has a bar business.  She changed her business enterprise from second-hand clothing to the bar business two months ago.  She works 7 days a  week.   Norah sells wholesale/retail out of her home.  Norah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer, soda, and boxes of mineral water.   She also generates additional income through renting rooms.

The main business challenge for Norah includes the transportation of crates of beer in the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar and also to start selling wholesale only.   Norah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, and mineral water for resale.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a divorced woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young to attend. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Everline has operated a vegetable stall, selling sukuma wiki (green vegetables) for over three years. In addition, she operates a firewood business as another source of income. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot, dry season, the supply of green vegetables is low compared to the rainy winter season when the supply of vegetables is high.

Everline decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to boost her business. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase crates of tomatoes, sukuma wiki and sugarcane for her vegetable stall. Everline hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crates of tomatoes, sukuma wiki and sugarcane

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old, married and has two children ages six and one.  To make a living, Nemia plants and harvests rice for sale. Nemia does her best to help provide for her family. 

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Nemia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP  to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen W. is from the village of Zone 2, San Mariano, Isabela. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Karen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Karen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Angelica; ella tiene 60 años de edad, viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de comida por las noches, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de venta de comida.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Mrs. Angelica belongs to the Virgen del Rosario del Cusco Community Bank. The bank is located in the city of Cusco in the province of the same name. 

She is a 60-year old widow and has five children. After completing her daily activities she begins to work selling food on the street. She has had this business for many years and it is the only job she has to help her family.

She will use the loan to purchase supplies for her food stall. She appreciates the loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for food stall business

loans.name: Lilibeth's Group

texts.en:
Lilibeth C. is from the village of Nangalisan. She is 40 years old. Lilibeth is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lilibeth C..

Lilibeth is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Lilibeth is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilibeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
El senor Alfredo M., tiene 61 anos de edad, vive en el Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, casado y tiene solamente 1 hijo; con mas de 50 anos de dedicarse a la agricultura y a la ganaderia.
Inicio en estas actividades desde la edad de 10 anos, ayudando a  su Papa; sembrando granos basicos, y tambien su Papa tenia un poco de Ganado; esa fue la experiencia que logro alcanzar, nunca realizon en toda su vida otro tipo de negocio o de actividades.
En la actualidad el senor M., ha invertido mas en la Ganaderia que en la agricultura;
Don Alfredo solicito este credito, para invertirlo en su Finca, para mejorar un poco su infraestructura, como por ejemplo el Alambrado y tambien para la compra de Pastos, sobretodo para garantizar la comida de su ganado, para que este no tenga que salir a buscar comida.
Su meta es comprar una picadora para hacer rendir mas la alimentaion de su ganado y asi lograr una mejor productividad, sobre todo en los volumenes de Leche y mejorar de esta manera su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo M. is 61 years old and he lives in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo. He is married and he has only one son. He has more than 50 years' experience in agriculture and farming. He started in when he was 10 years old, helping out his father to sow basic grains. His father also had a few cattle. This was the experience he managed to acquire and never in his life has he ever worked in another field of work or employment. 

Mr. M. has recently invested more in cattle farming than in agriculture. He requests a loan to invest in his plantations to improve the infrastructure, meaning the wire fencing and to purchase grasses to supply his herd of cattle with feed. He would otherwise have to go and look for feed. His goal is to purchase a mill to make the feed for his cattle last longer and to improve productivity, especially in terms of milk production. This is an effort to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To invest in his cultivation and on his herd of cattle.

loans.name: La Flor De Limon Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Flor de Limón y está conformado por 9 integrantes, está ubicado en Quintana Roo, México. La señora Jacinta  C. es miembro del grupo y es vecina de  la comunidad  Maya de Limones,  ella  tiene  46 años, vive en una casa de madera y techo de palma de la región que se llama huano, le gusta, pero quiere algo mejor para sus  hijos, ya que no le gustaría que crecieran en un solo cuarto y sin privacidad. La señora Jacinta se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de composturas, arreglos  y encargos de sus vecinos, pero comenta que si tuviera  una máquina  de coser eléctrica  el trabajo seria  más rápido. Ella está contenta  por el crédito que solicito ya que quiere ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes.
texts.en: This group is called Flor de Limón ["Lemon Flower"], and it is made up of 9 members. It is located in Quintana Roo, México. Jacinta C. is a member of the group and a neighbor living in the community of Maya de Limones. She is 46 years old and lives in a wooden house with a thatched roof made from a local palm called huano. She likes it, but she would like something better for her children, because she does not want them to grow up in a single room without any privacy. Jacinta's business is tailoring; she makes all types of garments, repairs clothing, and takes custom orders from her neighbors. However, she comments that if she had an electric sewing machine, her work would go more quickly. She is happy about the loan she is requesting, because she would like to expand her business and be able to satisfy the requests of all of her customers.

loans.use: Buying an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase new tools for carpentry shop

loans.name: Ochirjantsan

texts.en:
Ochirjantsan, 45, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living. Ochirjantsan's wife helps him with the business and his two older children attend a local secondary school.

Ochirjantsan used to work as a carpenter for a small wood production factory until 1998, when he began operating his own carpentry business. He currently operates his business at home and is building a workshop which he wants to finish by the summer. He is a hardworking person who says, "First of all, I want to finish my workshop building and save money to build a house in the future." He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more wood and materials for his woodcraft business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Kaka

texts.en:
Kaka Kavundu is 37 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She runs a tailoring shop, which has been in operation for the past two years.  She earns  approximately 9,000 KES a month. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is requesting for her first loan from KADET LTD  which she intends to use the entire loan a mount to buy textiles, frails, and buttons. 


She hopes to expand her business and create employment. She also hopes to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase textiles, frails, and buttons

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario B. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Apolinario is separated from his wife. To make a living, Apolinario owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Apolinario has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Apolinario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinario is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Apolinario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Angel de 41 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad desde muy pequeño cuando le llevaron como oficial de construcción desde los 20 años. 

Por el momento tiene 4 trabajadores a su cargo. El labora desde las 6H00 am a 4h30 pm. Su dificultad en el trabajo son las lluvias ya que así no puede terminar de trabajar. Esta casado, su esposa tiene una tienda y vende comida los fines de semanas de jueves a domingos. Del fruto de su hogar tiene 6 hijos menores de edad que estudian en colegios y escuela publicas. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en el negocio de su esposa comprando viveres como arroz, canes, bebidas, esencias y parte en la comprar de útiles escolares para sus hijos.

El anhela terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos prosperen en su estudios.
texts.en:
Angel, age 41, has worked in the construction business for the past 20 years.  He supervises four employees and works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.  The challenges he faces at work come when it rains because he can't finish a job.  

He is married and his wife has a grocery store and sells food from Thursday to Sunday.  They have six minor children who are in school.

The loan will be used in his wife's grocery business to buy rice, sugar, beverages and essences.  Part of the loan will go toward school supplies for the children.  

His goal is to build a second floor on the house and for his children to finish their education.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beverages and school supplies for his children

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena manages a tailoring business where she usually earns a net income of 4,000 PHP a month. She spends her income mainly for the education of her four children. Her husband assists her in supporting their daily needs through farming.

Wanting to make her business more productive, Filomena opted for a loan from ASKI and KIVA lenders of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase cloth, needles and threads. In the future, Filomena dreams of having her Ready-to wear (RTW) shop in the market.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, needles and threads

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene grado de instrucción primaria (incompleta).
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella requiere de un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino.  Con éste préstamo comprará cuatro unidades de ovejitas.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando en este negocio ya que le resulta rentable.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del pago.
En la foto se muestra cargando a su bebé que tiene pocas semanas de nacido.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a member of the Sisters of Choquetanca II Communal Bank, located in the Llave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 children; she has some primary school education but never completed it.

Mrs. Ofelia is a new member that has recently become a part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she needs a loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles. The money will be used in her business, buying and selling cattle, sheep and pigs, she will buy four little sheep. Ofelia works with her husband.

Her dream is to keep working on her business since it is profitable.

What Ofelia enjoys about her Communal Bank is the ease of her payments.

She is shown in the picture carrying her baby that is a few weeks old.

loans.use: buy four litte sheep.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, D. 53 años, es una mujer alegre y fuerte, está casada con Nicanor, D. 52 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 D. ellos, Madai D. 18 y Vian D. 7 años, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la selva central (Yurinaki). DesD. que era niña se dedico a la agricultura, “el campo es mi vida”, afirma; en esos tiempos ayudaba a alzar la tierra para poder sembrar, pero ya cuando era joven ahorró lo suficiente y a los 19 años compró su propio terreno D. cultivo; desD. entonces se dedica a la siembra D. café, plátano y maíz. Elva tiene una pequeña casa en la comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani, ahí viaja todos los fines D. semana para cuidar su terreno D. cultivo, ya cuando están maduros los venD. en el mercado central D. su ciudad (Yurinaki). Según nos cuenta antes no tenia el capital suficiente para contratar peones que le ayuden a cosechar el grano maduro D. café, pues lo hacía con su esposo,  “Los dos trabajamos duro, para sacar a tiempo nuestro café”, comenta. Ahora que trabaja con su banco comunal, pueD. invertir capital para poder contratar peones y D. esa manera obtener ganancia en menor tiempo. En los próximos meses juntara el capital necesario para comprar un auto, y D. esa manera trasladarse constantemente a su terreno D. cultivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas D. Pumpuriani”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. espera obtener el apoyo financiero para poder concretar sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elva D. obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su cultivos D. café que hace poco sembró, y que está segura le brindarán buenos granos.
texts.en:
Elva is 53 years old.  She is a cheerful and strong woman who is married to 52 year-old Nicanor.  The couple have six children though they only live with two of them: 18 year-old Madai and 7 year-old Vian.  The family lives in a rental house which is located in the central jungle (Yurinaki).  Elva has been farming since she was a young girl.  "The land is my life" she admits.  When she was a girl she would help to prepare the land for sowing but as a young girl she saved up enough money and, when she was 19, she bought her own plot of farm land.  Since that time, she has been growing coffee, bananas and corn.

Elva has a small house in the indigenous community of Centro Pumpuriani.  She travels there every weekend to care for her farm land.  When her crops are ripe, she sells them in the central market in Yurinaki.  She tells us that in the past she didn't have enough capital to hire laborers to help her harvest her ripe coffee beans and so she did the work together with her husband. "The two of us worked hard to harvest our coffee on time", she says.  Now that she is working with her community bank, she is able to invest capital in hiring laborers and, in this way, she can make profits in less time.

In the coming months, Elva will put together the capital she needs to buy a car.  In this way she will be able to travel to her farm land all the time.  Elva belongs to the "Abejitas D. Pumpuriani" (Little Bees of Pumpuriani) community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP.  She hopes to obtain the financial support she needs to achieve her goals.  On her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.

Elva enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive of each other.  With your support, Elva will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over her coffee crops which she recently sowed.  She is certain that they will proviD. good beans.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 55-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. Her husband is a farmer in their community.  She and her husband till their small rice farm in order to be earn money to support their family. The average income from her business is PHP 20,000, per harvest. Evelyn also raises pigs to fatten and sell.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she can buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

In the future, Evelyn  hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Senderos Al Exito Group

texts.es: Adela del Carmen es miembro del Banco Comunal Senderos al Exito, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, y junto a su familia reside en una Aldea que se llama Zopilotepe.
texts.en: Adela del Carmen is a member of the “Senderos al Éxito” (Paths to Success) communal bank.  She’s 53 years old, has four children and together with her family lives in a village called Zopilotepe.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, a 48-year-old widow residing in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, has four school-aged children. Together with her children, she has been operating a retail sari-sari store to make a living for two years now, earning PHP 8,000.00 a month.

A member of GDMPC for almost one year, Amalia has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase additional commodities such as milk, soap, diapers and more to sell in the local community. She hopes to expand her business and gain more income in the future so as to provide the kind of life her children deserve.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities including milk, soap, diapers, etc. to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 42 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Julieta has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Los Palmares Group

texts.en:
Monica is the coordinator of her group Los Palmares (The Palms). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo and is composed of twenty businesspeople. Monica and the 19 other members are taking loans for their businesses.

Monica requires a loan to buy fabric, thread and haberdashery items to make blankets, bedding sets and curtains. This is Monica´s second loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her services and sales.

She has had her business for 9 years. She lives in a simple home with her 3 children. She is a single mother working like a man to proviD. for her family. Her most difficult challenge was raising her children. She is a hard-working woman. Monica enjoys taking care of her children.

She says that her favorite thing is to sew. She will uses her profits to save because she needs to buy a plot of land to build her house. Monica dreams of having her own house.

Monica and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy fabric for curtains, blankets and quilts

loans.name: Azganush

texts.en:
Azganush is from the village of Anoushavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is a widow with a thirty year old daughter.  She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past twenty years.  She provides economic support to her mother and sister.  

Azganush considers herself to be a hardworking, honest person.  She hopes to save enough money to renovate the family home.  She would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  She expects her income to increase by twenty percent with this investment.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and the prices are reasonable.  She wants to continuing living in Anoushavan, surrounded by her relatives and friends.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 34 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 16. She runs a provisions and assorted drink store in Goderich, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of 4 relatives as well as their immediate families.

Ramatu has owned this business for 7 years and sells soft drinks, bag sugar, sardine cartons, butter, and stout crates at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation and storage of drinks.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and assorted drinks. Ramatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her to continue to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open more branches and invest in another business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married with six children. Concepcion is 61 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Concepcion is a "nipa palm" weaver business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, Concepcion earns approximately PHP 2,600. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase nipa palm in order her to weave and sell to community. Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase nipa palm in order her to weave and sell to community

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 31 years old and married. She has three children.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and networking beauty products.

Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old single man. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a motorcycle transport services business where he provides transport services to the local people in Thika. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair the motor cycle. His business goal is to to grow his business and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a renowned businessman in Thika.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt (traditional nomadic housing tent), in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps him to operate the business. His two older kids are school students and the younger one goes to kindergarden. He started his metal household-goods-making business in 1998. He makes spoons, forks, cups, pot, and ovens. He has one employee and his wife sells the goods. Now that winter is approaching, customer demand is high, therefore he needs to keep up with the demand in order to be successful. He is a sharp and diligent man who says "My kids are growing and I need to be able to afford the college fee when my kids are old enough". He is requesting MNT 1,300,000 to buy raw materials to make goods.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make goods

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es:
Reginaldo, seguirá invirtiendo en el negocio, pues su deseo de prosperar le ayuda para dar fuerzas, solicitando nuevamente otro préstamo, para comprar materiales para hacer flores, papel, colorantes, alambres, espelma, ya que quiere ofrecer a los clientes, arreglos florales para difuntos.
Él ha tenido un efecto positivo con el negocio, ya que compro los cerdos, y productos para la tienda, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades y sus ventas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Reginaldo will continue investing in his business as his desire to do well gives him strength.  He is requesting another loan to buy materials for making artificial flowers: paper, dyes, wire and candles, as he would like to be able to offer his customers funeral floral arrangements.

Reginaldo's [previous loan] has had a positive effect on his business as he bought pigs and products for his store.  So far, he has not had any difficulties and his sales have improved.

loans.use: to buy paper, dyes, wire and candles

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
Elsa se sigue dedicando al trabajo como docente,ella trabaja en el nivel primario,ella tambien se esta dedicamdo al negocio D. venta D. joyas como aretes,collares y pulseras y tambien se dedica al negocio D. venta D. ropa como pantalones,polos,blusas y polos al por mayor,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. joyas y venta D. ropa. La socia solicita el credito para comprar joyas como aretes,pulseras y aretes y tambien para comprar panatalones,polos y camisas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: Elsa continues working as an elementary school teacher.  She’s also working at her jewelry business selling earrings, necklaces and blouses and also sells clothes like pants, shirts and blouses at wholesale.  Through these businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand the jewelry and the clothing sales and is asking for a loan to buy jewelry like earrings, bracelets and earrings and also to buy pants, shirts and Polo shirts at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Isabel; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diA. con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y fideos, la socia también manda productos hacia la provincia de Anta, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes y también para enviar al distrito de Anta como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She’s 30 years old, married, and has five children.  She has a grocery store where she sells primary needs products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and noodles.  She also sends products to the Anta province.  She gets her children ahead in life through these businesses and wants to expand her grocery business.  She is asking for this loan to buy products, such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil in quantity, to stock her store and ship to the Anta district.

[Maria Isabel] is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy inventory to stock her store.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary source of income in the village where Rolando resides. He is involved in this business to earn a living. Rolando is 42 years old and married to Anabelle. His wife works abroad as a domestic helper. In the absence of his wife, he carries the burden of taking care of their two children and also doing farming activities. He plants and harvests rice to sell. 

He wants to improve his output but it requires additional capital so he is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy two liters of Bayluscide (molluscicide) and fertilizers to use in farming. This will ensure good growth of his crops and later on will yield more sacks of rice to sell.

Rolando aims to make his business more profitable so that he can provide for all of his family's needs and to encourage his wife to come back home and not to work abroad anymore.

loans.use: to buy two liters of Bayluscide (molluscicide) and fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is 36-years-old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Clarisa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarisa has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising carabao (water buffalo).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Addah

texts.en:
Addah is 30 years old, married to Joshua and has four children. She has been a tailor for the last five years and earns a monthly income of 17,000 KES. She is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy more textiles for making clothes for her customers. With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees for her children and expand her business.
Addah's hope is to grow her business into a one-stop design and clothes-making store.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making clothes.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 35 years old, married and has two children. He owns a food cereals store in his local trading center and has been in operation for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Alfred is requesting a fourth loan of 90,000 KES from KADET. He will use the funds to purchase more cereals for his store. The profits will be used to educate his children and increase stock levels in his business.

Alfred’s dream is to prosper in business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for his store.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Mr Davaasuren is 44 years old, lives with his wife and 4 children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Enhtuya, is 40 years old. She is running a tea room. His older son, Enhbold, is 19 years ols. His older daughter, Enhzul, is 15 years old. She is a second school student. His younger daughters, Erdenezul and Uyangaa, aged 13 and 8. They are a school student. He started a pants and pants repair of equipment trade in 2009 with his older son.  He is planning to increase products she sells, she buys her products to offer .  He is hardworking and honest man.  He needs 2 000 000 MNT to buy a raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy a raw materials for his business

loans.name: Living

texts.en: Living is 33-years-old and and a practicing farmer. He is married and has six children and of the six, four go to school. He started farming in 1998 with the hope of earning enough profits from the  farming business to educate his children. He does farming in kyamamari–nyanga Bitooma-Bushenyi District. His clients are mainly tea traders from the same locality. His main challenge is the weather which negatively changes and affects his garden and harvest. He says that despite the challenges that he has, he will remain the hard working farmer he has always been and if given the loan money (800000-eight hundred thousand shillings) he will use it to buy mulch for his garden.

loans.use: To buy mulches

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old. He is a resident of Rubaga road ‘A’ Kampala city. He is divorced with one child who is attending school.
  
James deals in a business of brick laying located in a rural area in the city outskirts, which he started in 2002 with an aim of boosting his income. He got a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings to rent more space where he can make more bricks in order to meet the high demand for the bricks. 
  
James sells mostly to all people from different towns; that is to say, some contracting entities, factories, schools and some individual constructors. However, his main challenge is inadequate capital to expand the business and seasonal changes like heavy rainfall, which affects the drying of the bricks. 

James is the kind of man who aims at having a determined and focused future by acquiring more money to boost his business so that it attains a steady growth.

loans.use: To hire land for making bricks.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Many places in Moldova are booming with construction, both residential and commercial. The city of Cahul is no exception. People here spend much of their free time renovating and improving their homes or working on a new one. Cinder-block and wood structures can be seen everywhere and power tools are a common sound.
