Vasile understands the pride Moldovans feel for their homes and knows that proper construction requires good material inputs, so when he was thinking of going into business it was an easy choice to open a construction materials store. He located in the central market, where his goods catch the attention of many shoppers, and began by selling a number of products for construction and for the home in general. He has noticed that his construction related products sell best and that many clients ask for specific and high quality items, so Vasile has decided to specialize in things such as dry cement, tiles, plastering tools, etc. and to discontinue his stock of household detergents and other goods. To purchase a shipment of all the construction supplies he wants to carry, he needs a loan. This will allow him to purchase from a vendor in the capital city of Chisinau and receive the exact products he thinks will be popular.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en: Dimitar D. started his business because of a magazine article. This article wrote about Californian worms. Dimitar was very impressed by the fact of worms’ extremely fast reproduction. Such worms are being used as a fertilizer in biological agriculture. So Dimitar decided to breed Californian worms. He started his business with only 250 leva (It is approximately 150 USD). All the  money he earned he reinvested until this business has grown to the size that Dimitar  wanted. His largest investment so far was for a specialized machine for automatic worm breeding that replaces manual labour. Now Dimitar D. needs another machine for sorting out fertilizer that will cost about $ 1200.

loans.use: To buy a machine for sorting out fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.en:
Nancy is married and has a young daughter of 7 years old. Her husband, Martín, works as an administrative assistant in a furniture company in Escobedo, Nuevo León. Thanks to her husband's help, Nancy has been able to succeed in what she really likes to do: sales. A year ago, a friend invited her to start selling cosmetics . Since then, her outlook on life improved because business went well for her. Also, she started to employ more people and they have provided her with an opportunity to keep on growing.

At this moment, Nancy needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy more merchandise, in order to satisfy customer demand. She commits to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months time.

You can play an important part in Nancy's success, so please help her out!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es casada y tiene una pequeña hija de 7 años de edad, su esposo Martín trabaja como auxiliar administrativo en una empresa mueblera en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, de donde son originarios. Gracias a el apoyo de su esposo Nancy ha sobresalido en lo que a ella le gusta que son las ventas, una amiga la invitó a vender cosméticos hace un año y de ahí en adelante mejoró su perspectiva de vida por lo que empezó a irle muy bien y también ingreso a mas personas al negocio y estas le han dado puntos para seguir creciendo.

En estos momentos, Nancy requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Nancy, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Luth

texts.en: Mrs. Luth L. is 40 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home of the Angkor Wat temple.  Siem Reap has many tourists passing through, and Mrs. Luth L. has started a business buying and selling souvenirs.  She can earn about $2/day in this business, and her husband earns $2.5/day working in construction.  Together, the couple has 5 children to support.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Luth L. to purchase more souvenirs for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenir products for her tourist business

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is a young mother of 25 years of age. She is married with 3 children. The taro plantation has been their family income for all of their lives so she and her husband have a lot of experience in taro farming. She heard of SPBD through the women in the village, so she decided to join. She has been wanting to buy some farm equipment, but money is her biggest problem. Filipina and her husband have been upgrading their farm and they are happy with what they earned when they first sold their crops. Filipina is planning for her business to grow bigger and hopefully to have some changes not only for her family but for her farm as well.

loans.use: To assist her plantation.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto C. is a 45-year-old micro-entrepreneur living with his partner in Asunción, Paraguay. Together they have one child. During the day Ernesto and his partner work together selling various merchandise out of a mobile stand like watches, glasses and wallets. The Foundation has helped them by providing the capital they need so that they may buy more merchandise. They are continuing to work hard to better their standard of living. 
	Initially, Ernesto, took out a very small loan from the Foundation. At this time he was also working with an alternate lender who was charging very high interest rates. Ernesto had to make payments on a daily basis. As a result there was not enough capital to allow them to build their micro-enterprise. Ernesto and his partner are now very happy to accept the help of the Foundation, which lends to the informal sector at very affordable rates.

loans.use: to purchase  merchandise.

loans.name: Hagigat

texts.en: Hagigat R. lives in the Dashburun village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  She is 48 years old and has four children.  Her husband died a few years ago.  She is engaged in animal-breeding.  She has some cows and some sheep.  Hagigat wants to increase her number of sheep.  To do this, she needs a loan in the amount of $700.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru:
Holmurod H. is 50 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 7 children. Holmurod has been farming for 3 years. He will use his loan to work his land and to purchase wheat seeds to plant. After harvest, local residents will be able to purchase wheat at a lower price than they would pay at the market. They will use the wheat for making flour and bread. Holmurod plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хакназаров Холмурод, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Холмурод уже в течение 3 лет занимается земледелием. Полученный кредит он хочелт использовать на обработку земли, а также на покупку семян пшеницы для дальнейшего их посева. После сбора урожая местные жители получат возможность приобрести пшеницу по более низкой цене в отличие от рыночной. Так как большинство жителей этого района покупают пшеницу для дальнейшей ее переработки в муку и выпечки хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Working the land and planting wheat

loans.name: Jagatha Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Jagatha Maiya M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Mahendra M., a son and two daughters. Her older daughters are studying in grade 11 and 8 respectively. Her son is in primary school.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop two years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good so they can't provide a better education for their children because in Nepal the cost of education is very high comparative to the income. To overcome this problem she opened a grocery shop.

Due to a lack of funds she can’t buy goods in her shop. So she is asking for her second loan of Rs 15000 to buy goods like rice, dal, noodles, and other items.

She needs to provide a better education for her children and wishes to help her husband upgrade the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is 25 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 5 and 2. Abiba owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Abiba now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Kim Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Thi H. is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband works in the commune and the family’s main income comes from selling farming products. Mrs. Kim Thi H. also makes rice cakes to sell in the morning. Her business is successful and she wants to borrow $875 to invest in it. She says that if she can earn more money, she will apply it towards furthering her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
This associate sells ronier palm wood for the construction of scaffolds in public construction projects; he is asking for a loan to be repaid in 12 months to increase his stock of ronier palms before the winter.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ce sociétaire vend des rôniers pour les charpentes des chantiers à usage d’habitat social ; Il sollicite un prêt payable en 12 mois pour renforcer son stock de rôniers avant l’hivernage.

loans.use: To enlarge his stock of ronier palms before the winter

loans.name: Tey Man Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tey M. lives in Kampong Tralach Krom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia and she is the leader of a five-person business group. She is a farmer who cultivates her crops twice a year. In the dry season, she grows vegetables and she cultivates rice during the rainy season. Mrs. Tey M. is the mother of five children, one of whom assists his father in his fishing business, while three others are enrolled in the state school. The remaining one is at home because he is too young for school.

Mrs. Tey M.'s husband, Mr. Sar Leb, is a fisherM.. His business not doing well now, because he has insufficient fishing equipment and his boat needs to be repaired. In order to improve his business, Mrs. Tey M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets and to fix the boat.

One member in this group, Mrs. Chilheour M., is not present in the photo. Instead, her husband is in the photo because he is asking for a loan, instead of his wife.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and to fix their boat.

loans.name: Kadidiatou Bassène

texts.fr:
Kadidiatou Bassène D. is married and has 2 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Gadapara village bank in Kolda for the past 4 and a half years. She owns a restaurant and has always grown and evolved in this sector. Her restaurant is very accessible to mechanics and tradesmen in the area who constitute a large portion of her customers. She currently employs two women. She would like to grow her small business, and in turn, increase her income. Kadidiatou is asking for a loan which will be repaid in a single payment after six months.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadidiatou Bassène D., mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Gadapara à Kolda depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle est restauratrice et a toujours évolué dans ce secteur. Son restaurant est très accessible aux mécaniciens et boutiquiers qui constituent une bonne part de la clientèle. Elle emploi deux femmes qu’elle paie. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour augmenter ses revenus Kadidiatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mrs. Muth K. is a villager in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. La Touch, are fishermen who can gather little fish because they do not have enough equipment to catch larger ones. Mrs. Muth K. is applying for a loan to buy equipment to catch larger fish as a way to improve her business and her living conditions. Mrs. Muth K. is 33 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom breeds fish while the others attend school.

loans.use: To buy equipment to improve her business and her living conditions.

loans.name: Elvedina

texts.en:
Elvedina is a married woman from the town Banovići. Her husband has a full-time job and earns about 800 KM monthly. They have one child.

Elvedina works as a supervisor in a furniture factory. This loan in the amount of 1200 KM is her first and Elvedina will use it to buy clothes on wholesale. She will sell them retail in order to earn more money for her household.

Elvedina also does the crochet and sells crochet products.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, junto a su esposo Marcial, quieren dar a sus 4 hijos los estudios necesarios, esperando un día que los mismos sean profesionales. Ellos se dedican a la agricultura; siembran, cosechan y venden sus productos (plátano, yuca, maíz y otros)Marcial es el encargado de sembrar y cuidar los cultivos, cuando ya están listos los entrega a su esposa para que ella los lleve a diferentes lugares y los venda.Ahora, Milka desea arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa, además de comprar semillas para la siembra, para hacer esto posible necesita de una cantidad de dinero, que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Apoyemos a la señora Milka, mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Milka, with her husband Marcial, wants to give her four children an education so they become professionals one day. Currently they all work in agriculture; they sow, harvest and sell products like plaintains, yuca, and corn. Marcial is responsible for the harvest, and when they are ready for delivery his wife takes them to different places for sale. Milka wants to fix some of the structures in her house and buy seeds for the harvest. In order to do this she needs a loan. Lets support Milka, a woman with a lot of dreams to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to reconstruct parts of her house. Purchase of seeds for harvesting.

loans.name: Luz Izola

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista Nº 1299, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico en una tienda de repuestos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de lencería. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad trabaja como profesora en la I.E Comercio y tiene en casa un pequeño taller de costura. En las mañanas labora como docente y por las tardes se dedica a confeccionar sus prendas de vestir para vender a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 9 metros de tela lino, 10 metros de poli ceda, 6 kilos de tela algodón. También hará un viaje a Trujillo para comprar zapatos.  

Luz se siente contenta y agradecida con la vida por tener un trabajo y un negocio propio y por ende agradece al Banco Comunal por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Luz belongs to the Communal Bank called "United Neighbors", located in the district of Calleria in the city of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayali. She's 50 years old. She's the mother of 2 sons who are of age. She's married and her husband works as a mechanic in a shop that sells car parts. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in selling linens. She has been working with the communal bank for 8 years. She currently works as a teacher at the (I.E. Commercio/Commerce). She has a sewing workshop that she runs from home. In the morning, she works as a teacher and in the afternoons she sews her articles of clothing to sell to her clients. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase 9 meters of canvas fabric, 10 meters of silk, 6 kilos of cotton fabric. She will also go on a trip to Trujillo to buy shoes to sell. Luz is very happy and thankful with her life situation for having her own business and she gives her thanks to the communal bank for providing her with all of this help.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various types of fabric

loans.name: Mrs. Chraeng Yang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who all live in Roka Village in Kandal Province make up this village bank loan; all of the members will use the loan proceeds for different purposes. Mrs. Chraeng Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since this current business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is seeking a loan to add more grocery products to her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Uoch T., helps her in the current business. Mrs. Chraeng Y. is 61 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

One of the members in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add more grocery products to her inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes tiene 42 años de edad, habitante del barrio fantasma en la capital, estado civil casada su esposo es comerciante, tiene tres preciosos hijos de 16, 21 y 23 años de edad. Sus planes para la familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecerles nuevas oportunidades en esta vida. Doña Lourdes posee su pequeño negocio  una pulpería desde hace 12 años, la inicio con fondo propio de su trabajo anterior. Los planes en el ámbito comercio es aumentar el volumen de las ventas con nuevos productos. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos  y mas productos para obtener mayores utilidades y variedades de productos para ofertar a sus clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes is 42 years old and lives in the fantasma neighborhood in the capital. She is married and her husband is a merchant. She has three precious children, ages 10, 21, and 23. Her hope is to improve her family's quality of life and offer them new opportunities. Doña Lourdes has owned a small grocery store for the past 12 years, which she started with money she earned at her previous job. The plan for her business is to increase the volume of sales by bringing in new products. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will be able to buy larger quantities of existing and new products to increase earnings, and also increase the variety of products she is able to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde A. is a hardworking woman. She has a shop where she sells drinks and provisions like noodles, sugar, toothpaste, bathing soap, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
D. Juliette a 41 ans et elle a 2 enfants qui s’appellent Jean de Dieu et Mireille. Ses enfants sont scolarisés. Juliette vend les jouets et les tenues hommes et femmes depuis 15 ans. Récemment elle a ajouté les chaussures hommes et femmes. Elle s’approvisionne au marché des vêtements de Missèbo et à Lomé, Togo. Le revenu des ses autres crédits lui a permis de louer sa propre chambre et de répondre aux ses besoins. Juliette voudrait ouvrir sa propre boutique dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Juliette D., 41, has two children named Jean de Dieu and Mireille, both enrolled in school. Juliette has been selling toys and men's and women's clothing for 15 years. Recently, she expanded into men's and women's shoes. She does her buying at the clothing markets at Missèbo and in Lomé, Togo. The income from her other loans has allowed her to rent her own room and support herself. In future, Juliette would like to own her own shop.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora C., 42 years old, married, lives at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Because she is skilled at making toys, she ventured into this business together with running a sari-sari (convenience) store. During her free time, she makes toys out of cloth, together with her husband. Fortunately, her first customer who happened to be her neighbor and saw her work bought it.

Now there are customers who buy her toys from Tangub, Molave, Kapatagan and Dipolog areas. Due to inadequate working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. She was not wrong when she chose Paglaum because of its add-on benefits given to members. She has received loans up to 3 times already. Today, she is appliying for PHP 14,900 to buy meters of cloth for making toys and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. She wants to expand and have a market in toy crafting in different areas.

loans.use: to buy meters of cloth for toy crafting and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gilbert A. est un jeune commerçant  âgé de 26 ans qui est marié et père d’une fille. Depuis 2005, qu’il a crée son BAR dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, il ne cesse d’accueillir un grand nombre de clients.
A l’approche de la fête des Pacques, il désire faire l’approvisionnement des boissons et des produits de premières nécessités afin de pouvoir bien satisfaire ses clients et dégager beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilbert A. is a young, 26-year-old storekeeper who is married and the father of a girl. Since 2005, when he opened his bar in the Adidogomé neighborhood, he hasn’t stopped welcoming a large number of clients. As the Easter holiday approaches, he wants to stock up on drinks and other necessary goods in order to be able to satisfy his clients and draw a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and food

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret K. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more tables and chairs. Margret is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 4 children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big hotel.

In 2007 BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more tables and chairs for better space for the customers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Since 2007, Esther N. has worked as a trader at Kojokram, near Shama Junction, selling goods such as beef and charcoal.  She is married with three children and received an education through senior high school. While Esther works as a trader, her husband is employed at the Tarkwa gold mines. Esther is responsible for assisting her husband in paying for the upkeep of the household. Her loan will be used to purchase additional charcoal and other goods for resale and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and other goods for resale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
D. Nguyen Thi D. is thirty-three years old and lives in the town of Quang Xuong.  She is married and has three children.  To make a living, D. raises cattle for sale.  She earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2007, D. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services that would give her the ability to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation.  D. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to get her business started.  D. is now requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her third loan from TYM Fund.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Ovieseyi

texts.en: Ovieseyi is 43 years old and married with five children. He has a farm where he grows plantain and pineapple. He is requesting the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to hire laborers to clear his farm. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To clear his farm

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. G. enjoys managing her food vending and small eatery business in the village at San Jose Norte 1 of Mallig, Isabela. She is living happily with her family and continues dreaming that someday she will become a successful entrepreneur through her hard work and initiative. She also sells different snacks. She loves what she is doing because it gives her resources that her family needs to survive.

To further develop her business, Susan is requesting PHP 4,000 as an initial loan from Kiva. This is her step in developing a partnership with them.

Susan is married to Noel, who raises pigs. They were blessed with three children. Two of them are already working: one in Singapore as a domestic helper and one in Manila as a parlor shop employee. The youngest is still studying in college. Susan prays for the success of her children so that they will have a better livelihood when they will have their own families someday.

loans.use: To expand her food vending business.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa en su localidad en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de León donde oferte todo tipo de ropa tanto para niños, damas y caballeros.

El señor Marco decidió acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa con el propósito de ofertarla en su localidad y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Marco R. sells clothes from his stand in the Central Market in the city of Leon. He sells all types of clothes for children, women, and men. Marco decided to come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy clothes. His plan is to sell them at his stand; this way he can improve his economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Valarie

texts.en:
After overcoming many hardships, including the loss of her husband to gun violence in 2002, Valarie has finally achieved her long-time dream of owning her own business.

Valarie is the owner of SPA-bulous! A Spa Retreat for FA-bulous Women! in Hayward, CA. SPA-bulous! is a place for women to rejuvenate themselves and also receive education on personal well-being. Valarie has a passion for helping women and keeps the spa open in the evening and weekends to give working mothers access to her services. In addition, SPA-bulous! donates free services to fundraisers for breast cancer, domestic violence, and other charities close to Valarie’s heart.

A single mother, Valarie continues to raise her three-year-old son, work a full time job, and run her business, while trying to complete her bachelor’s degree this fall. She also mentors other single mothers to stay motivated and keep their dream alive.

A $3,000 loan will allow Valarie to replace broken equipment at her spa, such as a steamer and facial bed.


To learn more about SPA-bulous! visit the website at: www.spa-bulous.com

loans.use: Replacement equipment for day spa

loans.name: Las Chicas Top Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Las Chicas Top” están representadas por la señora Victoria y conformada por 14 miembros que residen en el mismo barrio, todas tienen negocios propios como la venta D. pan, venta D. ropa, tienda D. abarrotes y venta D. juguetes usados (americanos). En cuanto a la competencia en sus negocios es elevada pero pese a eso saben sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios  ya que D. ello depenD. la subsistencia D. sus hogares. El destino del crédito  es para hacer crecer sus negocios obteniendo mas capital D. trabajo con el cual adquirir mas mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayudaran a generar mayores ingresos que representan en un futuro mejor para sus hijos. En cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios los socios tienen amplio conocimiento del trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital en la que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para el manejo D. los fondos, responsabilidad en los pagos y sobre todo unidad en el grupo el cual les brinda un apoyo económico para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Las Chicas Top” are led by Sra. Victoria. There are 14 members in the group and they live in the same neighborhood. They all have their own retail businesses selling products such as bread, clothing, groceries, and used toys (maD. in America). Even though competition is high, they know how to succeed in their small businesses because their families’ survival depends on them.

Their loan will be used as additional capital to grow their businesses. They will acquire more merchandise, supplies, and materials to help them generate larger profits and proviD. a better future for their children. As for their previous credit history, the members have extensive knowledge of how solidarity groups work because of loans they have received from other entities similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are starting their second loan cycle and have demonstrated that they can manage their funds responsibly, make their payments on time, and work together so that they can continue to receive financial support and grow as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. Est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et a 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois De ALWAR depuis 2 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle achète des balais, du jus de citron et de l'huile de palme qu'elle revend à Ziguinchor et à la capital (Dakar). Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle soutien son mari par rapport à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Khady D. is a 30-year-old married woman who has three children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois De ALWAR for two and a half years.  With her loan, she's purchasing brooms, lemon juice, and palm oil that she resells in Ziguinchor and in the capital (Dakar).  With the profits she earns, she support her husband in regard to improving family living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business

loans.name: Vut's Group

texts.en:
There are five low-income people who have decided to seek a loan for different purposes. One of these people, Mr. R., 39, has been chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. Most of R.’s life is spent on the river fishing with his wife in order to raise income. They typically generate a daily profit of $5 to contribute their family’s living expenses. R. said that he feels so happy in his current work that is a profitable one for his family, but unfortunately some of his fishing tools are broken. He would like a loan to buy new fishing tools and to repair some broken pieces as well. The other members of this group loan are:  
Mrs. S., who is pursuing a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house for her family.
Mrs. N. is a fish catcher, who is asking for a loan to buy more fishing equipment.
Mr. C. is a fisherman and he will use his loan to repair his old house.  
Mrs. P. will use this Kiva loan to build a new small house for his family’s living purposes.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing equipment

loans.name: Sehrinaz

texts.en:
This kind woman is a mother of 3 children. She lives in Fuzuly region. 4 years ago she started sewing business. 
Sehrinaz was born in 1952. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy cloth and necessary things for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth and necessary things for improving her sewing business

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nyetaa est composé de cinq  femmes toutes mariées qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles  ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants  et habitent dans le quartier Bozo à Diamarabougou Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe se sont connus par des liens professionnels, de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes bozos qui existait  depuis  plus de 10 ans.
Après 4 prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, ce groupe est à son cinquième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso..
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 12 cartons de poissons fumés et 800kg de poissons frais. Ces poissons sont triés selon les espèces et ensuite destinées soit à la vente  frais soit à la friture soit au  fumage ou au séchage. Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés à Macina (Mignon et Diado), en poissons frais sur place à Markala au bord du fleuve Niger au niveau du pont, dans les zones de pêche de Markala et à Niono (Dora). Les poissons sont vendus à Bamako, à Ségou (marché du château) et sur place à Markala sous toutes les formes, frais, frits, fumés et séchés au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles disposent de  fours et séchoirs traditionnels spécialement conçus dans un coin de leurs cours pour le fumage et le séchage des poissons. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 83 500 FCFA qui servira d’épargne en vue de l’achat de congélateur, à la contribution d’achat de matériels de pêche pour leurs maris, à la participation aux évènements sociaux (baptêmes, mariages et funérailles) et aux petites dépenses familiales notamment (savon, habillements).
Elles ambitionnent acheter  chacune un congélateur afin de diminuer les charges.
texts.en:
Nyetaa Group is composed of five married women who live in large traditional expanded families. On average, they are 39 years old and have three children. They live in the neighborhood of Bozo in the city of Diamarabougou Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through professional or family links; they are members of the same traditional association of women from Bozo, which has existed for over ten years. They have repaid without difficulty their previous four group loans and are now applying for their fifth group loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

They will use this loan to buy 12 boxes of smoked fish and 800 kg of fresh fish. The fish will be sorted and then either sold fresh or fried, smoked or dried. They get their supply of smoked fish in Macina (Mignon and Diado) and of fresh fish on location in Markala on the banks of the River Niger, near the bridge, in the fishery zones of Markala and in Niono (Dora). The fish, whether fresh, fried, smoked or dried, will be sold in Bamako, at the Castle Market in Ségou and on location in Markala, for cash and seldom on credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They have at their disposal in their backyards traditional specialized ovens and dryers to smoke and dry their fish.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 83,500 CFA francs (US$191). They will save this money to buy freezers, to help their husbands to buy fishery material, to take part in social events (baptisms, weddings and funerals) and to pay small household expenses, in particular soap and clothing. Their ambition is to buy, each of them, a freezer to bring down their expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: In 2004, after 24 years of experience in the car repair sector, Mohamad, a 38-year-old married man, decided to open his own shop to satisfy the needs of his three children and wife. Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase an electric motor for his business.

loans.use: To purchase an electric motor

loans.name: Jovitha

texts.en: Jovitha Samson is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married woman. She has three school-age children. She runs a café at Yombo Makangarawe in Dar es Salaam. The business goods are purchased from the city markets at Tandika and Kariakoo and from the wholesale shops. She managed to build a house and meet her family's daily demands from her business income. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ann Wangechi

texts.en: Ann is 25 years old and married with two children. She has a beauty salon in Kikuyu town which is her primary business. She has been in the business for about one year and she makes a profit of approximately 16,000 KES. Ann was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client. She has never borrowed from another micro-finance institution but this will be her third loan from KADET. She has repaid the other loans on time. Ann wants to use this loan to buy a hairdryer for her primary business, as well as to buy clothes to sell to others. She hopes to improve her salon and also employ at least two more workers one day. She also wants to expand her secondary business, a small boutique. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer for her beauty salon and clothes to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.en:
The Nuevo Horizonte committee was founded just 7 months ago by women who wanted to improve their businesses and livelihoods and have access to the credit and entrepreneurship training services offered by the Fundacion Paraguaya. They joined several neighbors who also have businesses and have since been meeting every Sunday night to discuss business strategies and to support each other.  
On average, each woman receives 580,952 gs., which will be invested in the purchase of items to be sold in their respective commercial activities. 

Using credit from Fundacion Paraguaya, Silvia opened a small shop selling food. Her business has since attracted numerous clients and grown considerably. Silvia's income has increased concurrently and she uses the money to improve her family's quality of life. 

Herminia C. sells cosmetics. 

Olga M. runs a pool hall. 

Silvia O. sells food. 

Gloria M. sells haberdashery. 

Cristina E. sells empanadas. 

Margarita S. sells jewelry. 

Carmen R. collects and resells recycled materials. 

Norma B. sells Argentinian goods. 

Estela B. sells clothes, candy and plants. 

Severe P. sells food. 

Lourdes B. sells Argentinian goods. 

Estelvina Evans sells plants. 

Sandra B. sells clothes. 

Francisca M. sells food. 

Florentina C. sells charcoal. 

Esther R. sells clothes. 

Elvira M. is a seamstress. 

Casimira M. sells haberdashery. 

Marta R. sells plants. 

Teodora V. sells charcoal. 

Lilian B. sells lingerie.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 19-year-old single man. He has been working as an aluminum worker for the past 7 years when he has too young; in 2008, he decided to open his own shop and began his career. Today, Mostafa is asking to borrow $1,200 to invest in his business.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: grow her working capital

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa E. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 63 years old. Josefa is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To earn a living, Josefa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used for the same purposes. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josefa from PMPC and the second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business and living conditions of her family. Josefa appears together with her husband in the picture.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Tov Province, Mongolia. 

Her husband operates a cell phone business at a counter in the Mobi Shop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Cell phone businesses face high demand in Mongolia. Enhtsetseg and her husband have been planning to expand their cell phone businessand their counter at the Mobi Shop, which is one of the biggest cell phone shops in Mongolia. They started their cell phone business in 2009. 

Previously, Enhtsetseg had spent four years selling recycled raw materials with her husband at the center of the province. Enhtsetseg is a decent, very hardworking and honest person. If she says that she will do something, she always makes an effort and reaches her goal. She says, “I would like to have  a bigger counter for our business." 

She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large quantity of cell phones for her business at wholesales prices.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of cell phones for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 53 years old and married to a pastor. They have five children. Her children are excelling in their jobs and in school. She is a hardworking mother and she is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty. 

She sells drinks and eggs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of 160,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and eggs to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and eggs to sell

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth C., age 26, is married and lives with her five-year-old child in Takeo province, Cambodia.

C. is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning an income of 1.30 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is employed as a repairman at a local factory in the city, earning an income of 3.30 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since C. and her husband have had these businesses.

C. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Daisy's Group

texts.en: Daisy A.'s main source of income comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 51 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Buena Suerte, Cauayan City, Isabela. Daisy has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Daisy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Daisy is the leader of a 5 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Ngoar Surn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan from Tep Archun village in Kandal province consists of 9 members, who will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ngoar S. was selected by the other members as the village bank president.  She is a mother of three children; two are laborers, while the other is attending a local public school. She and her husband are farmers who own more than 1 hectare of land, on which they cultivate rice to support their family. They have some problems with their rice field because the soil is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and a hose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and a hose

loans.name: Petronilla Tagbas Group

texts.en:
Petronilla B T., aged 53, is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Petronilla B is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Petronilla B has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Petronilla B joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Petronilla B is requesting a new loan of 2,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the third loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for the clothing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of cayenne peppers

loans.name: Santos Anibal

texts.es:
Santos Anibal G. P. tiene 29 años. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Santos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes. Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Santos trabaja en instalaciones eléctricas residenciales e industriales y vende materiales eléctricos. Realiza las compras en Guayaquil cada 15 días, y hace sus trabaja dentro y afuera de la ciudad. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales eléctricos para trabajar.  Su sueño es tener un almacén de materiales eléctricos completo. 

Le gusta jugar pelota (una forma de fútbol) con sus hermanos y amigos.
texts.en:
Santos Anibal G. P. is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. Santos is a member of the Santa Rosa rural solidarity group, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes canton. There are 18 members in total, most of whom have their own businesses. This is their first loan with the San José Cooperative. Santos works in residential and industrial electrical installations and sells electrical supplies. He purchases the items in Guayaquil every 15 days, and he does his work within and outside the city. He is requesting the loan to buy electrical supplies for his work. His dream is to have a well-stocked store offering electrical supplies. He enjoys playing pelota (a variation of soccer) with his brothers and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical supplies for his work

loans.name: Orng

texts.en:
Orng R., 56, is married and lives in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$3 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Orng R. included.

In light of these economic difficulties, Orng R. is asking for a loan of US$1,100 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for family transportation. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer plus a motorbike for family transportation

loans.name: Tene

texts.fr: M. est une femme très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des habits et des sacs de dames. elle  exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans déjà au marché local d'akodessewa, elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. son stock est en baisse , elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une trentaine d'habits pour gonfler son stock. elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant.
texts.en:
M. is a very dynamic woman and makes money by selling women's dresses and bags. She has been doing this for five years at the local market in Akodessewa. She sources her goods from the local markets in Lomé. Her stock levels are low and so she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase around thirty dresses to boost her product offer. She is married with one child.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing women's dresses and bags

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah R. is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Nengah R. is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Wiguna Merta (PK-10253).

Ni Nengah R. is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Nengah R. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Nengah R. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Nengah R. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Nengah R. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ni Nengah R. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.



"

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Flordelita

texts.en:
Flordelita P. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old. Flordelita is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Flordelita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Flordelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pig.

Flordelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordelita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Flordelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is 36 years old, married and a mother of two.  For two years, she has been practicing dairy farming.  She is also employed and she earns a salary every month. Therefore, she boosts her income with the dairy business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her income has increased.  Besides, she is able to feed her animals well and her living standards have improved.  She has requested 40,000 Kes. to buy another cow. She describes herself as ambitious, hardworking and patient.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Samuel Kiprugut

texts.en:
Samuel Kiprugut K., a 50-year-old gentleman married to Leah K., is the father of three children aged 26, 22 and 18 years. The sole bread winner in the family, as his wife does not work, Samuel been a shopkeeper for the past six years, earning a profit of about Kshs 10,000 every month.

A client of KADET LTD, he is now requesting his seventh loan, having repaid his previous loans on time. He is planning to use the amount to buy five boxes of cooking oil and five bundles of maize flour, and hopes to make a profit which he will use to boost his business. Samuel has plans of opening other branches in the future so that he can improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy five boxes of cooking oil and five bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en:
Mui T. N. is 44 years-old and she has three children.  They are in high school and university.  

She is a farmer . Her main activities are growing rice and raising pigs for meat.  Doing this work for many years, she has created a stable income for managing her family life and paying big school fees.  Joining with our credit program in 2006, she is always in a good repayment situation. Currently, she is in need of a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy fertilizer and feed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Meoli Ole

texts.en:
Meoli S., aged 37 years, is a tailor. He is married to Ene sinei, a farmer. Together they have three children aged 10,14 and 17 years. His business is at Bissil in Kajiado District. He was introduced to Kadet by the Credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.

Meoli has been running this business for two years and his monthly profit is Kes 15,000. After he gets the loan he will buy fabric for making men's trousers and suits and also ladies suits and dresses. His customers are happy with his designs.

If the loan boosts the business, Meoli plans to open another shop in Kajiado. His future dreams is to start making school uniforms and eventually become a supplier to all nearby schools.

Meoli is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for making men's and women's suits.

loans.name: Nameita

texts.en:
Nameita S., 35 years old, trades livestock and runs a retail shop at the busy Bissil market. She is married to Kilel S., a farmer, and together they have two children: Agnes, aged 4 years and Sapatu, aged 6 years. Nameita has been running these businesses for a period of 4 years and she earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000.

Nameita was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She plans to use KES 30,000 of her loan to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading and KES 20,000 to increase the stock of flour, sugar, cooking fat and detergents in her shop.

If the loan boosts her businesses, Nameita will buy a piece of land and build commercial houses. She describes herself as a hardworking and industrious woman who dreams of building many commercial houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading and to increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Nazraan's Group

texts.en:
Nazraan is a widow who lives with her brother in the small housing colony of Arshad, located in Raiwind, Pakistan. She didn’t want to become a financial burden to her brother; therefore, she started operating a clothing sales business a few years ago. It proved to be a good business for her and she started getting regular orders from nearby areas and earning a good income.

Nazraan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to help her brother improve his vegetable selling business. He will utilize the loan to purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk in order to sell more vegetables and make more money. Nazraan is a very helpful and supportive person by nature. She has confidence that her brother will make good use of the money and earn better profits from his business after this investment.

Nazraan has a daughter, 3 years of age, who has not yet started school. It is her deepest desire to provide quality education for her daughter once she becomes old enough to attend school. Nazraan is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Gladiness

texts.en:
Gladiness M. is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a handbags and shoes business for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Gladiness faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to expand her business and own her own shop in the future.

With the 15000 KES she wants to purchase 15 pairs of shoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 15 pairs of shoes for resale

loans.name: Rita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rita Del Carmen A. C. tiene 42 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Rita Del Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un carro.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Rita Del Carmen A. C., 42, lives with her companion and children in  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE Group, located in Santa Sofia enclosure, earn their living in short-season agriculture, especially corn, rice and beans, spending a great deal of time at their work. Rita del Carmen also grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies in the Comercial Briones and sells her products in the Comercial Vaca y García. She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn, rice, and beans. This loan will help her economically to provide for her necessities. They face challenges such as infestations and diseases, and weather variability. Her dream is to buy a house and vehicle. She enjoys sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad belongs to Gujranwala which is a mid-sized city in Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Kalar abadi with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here 8 years ago. Irshaad is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 5 children: four are working while the last one, a daughter, stays at home and helps her mother in the daily household works. Irshaad's first two sons have a business of making & selling bed-sheets. The next son operates a grocery store and the youngest son works in a factory on low income. 

Irshaad is married to M. A., a daily wage labor. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons’ business. With the loan, they will buy thread in bulk to make more bed-sheets to sell. The increase in number of bed-sheets enables them to sell to more customers and to make more income. 

She is hopeful that an investment will take her sons’ business to a more profitable position. Irshaad is a new loan applicant of Asasah.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Irshaad”.

loans.use: To buy thread for making bed-sheets to sell.

loans.name: Martha Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Libertad # 2  de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 12 y 7 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y la menor en  escuela. El marido trabaja en el mercado de Portoviejo.
 
Tiene un negocio en su casa en donde vende sodas, helados de la marca Topsy. Los días domingos prepara comida para vender. También se dedica a la cría de patos el mismo que cuando están grandes los vende a personas que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos, trabaja todos los días desde las 08 h 00 hasta las 16 h 00. Los helados y las sodas las recibe en su local, nos cuenta que ya son dos años que tiene su negocio y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar helados y sodas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos y por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio progresando dia a dia.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Cristo Resucitado [Risen Christ] meet in the Libertad #2 neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

In this place we find Martha, who is 30 years old, married, and has two daughters who are 7 and 12 years old.  They both attend school.  Her husband works in the market in Portoviejo.

She has a business in her home where she sells soda and Topsy ice cream.  On Sunday, she prepares the food to sell.  She also raises ducks, which she sells to people who come to her home to buy her animals.  She works every day from 8:00am until 4:00pm.  She receives the soda and ice creams at her store.  She has had her store for two years, and it has been going well.

This loan is to purchase ice creams and sodas.  She has been in the community bank for two cycles and she likes it because the interest is low and the institution provides many benefits.  Her dream is to continue improving her business every day.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream and soda

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente vive en casa propia con su esposa y su menor hija de 07 años Policarpio en la actualidad cuenta con dos mototaxis en una el se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y la otra la da en alquiler,el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de una moto carga y asi poder ayudar a su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, se le propone el crédito por tener buenas
referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Policarpio is 23 and lives with his wife and young 7-year-old daughter in their own home. Policarpio currently has two motorcycle taxis. He uses one to offer a transportation service, and he rents out the other. This loan will be used for the purchase of a cargo bike, and to help his wife, who sells fruit. He has been approved for this loan because he has good references, and a desire and ability to repay it.

loans.use: the purchase of a cargo bike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy notebooks, ballpoint pens, paper, paste, folders

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket K. H. has spent her whole life cultivating crops in the province of Kompong Cham. She is now married and has four school-aged children. Her husband works alongside his wife in the fields. She and her husband always grow their crops on an annual schedule, a system with which they have experienced great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year, according to the rainy and dry seasons. 

Ket K. is taking out this loan in order to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming. She plans to grow a variety of crops on her new land.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 42 years old and married with three children, all in school. Petronila works very hard to provide for them.

Petronila runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the purchase of additional stock.

Petronila has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar etc. Petronila also earns income from fish vending.

In the future, Petronila would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more coconuts to sell. Maria has been 11 years in this business. She earns an additional income from tricycle transport rental.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreamsof saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Jose Olaya Group

texts.es:
Ida, D. 37 años D. edad, casada, con 6 hijos. Socia del banco comunal: "Jose Olaya".
Ida tiene como negocio la venta D. pan y lo hace en una moto-carga que le sirve para distribuciòn. Adicionalmente a la venta D. pan tambièn se dedica al bordado D. trajes tìpicos.
Ida tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 5 dependen D. ella. Su esposo trabaja en una panaderìa; D. allì les surgiò la idea D. comprar y distribuir pan por la localidad donD. viven.
El prèstamo solicitado es para acondicionar un techo a su moto-carga para proteger el pan D. la lluvia.
(En la fotografìa Ida esta vestida D. chompa color verD. y falda color azul claro y tiene puesto un sombrero negro tìpico D. la zona; es la segunda D. la izquierda). 
(*)La socia D. la fotografìa pequeña no estuvo presente por motivos D. trabajo: trabaja en una empresa textil para exportaciòn.
texts.en:
Ida is 37 years old and married, with 6 children. She is a member of the "Jose Olaya" communal bank.

Ida's business is selling bread. She uses a cargo motorcycle to distribute the bread. In addition to selling bread, she also embroiders traditional clothing. 

Ida has 6 children, of whom 5 are dependent on her. Her husband works in a bakery, and that is where the idea came from to buy and distribute bread in the area where they live. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to attach a roof to her cargo motorcycle in order to protect the bread from the rain. 

(In the photograph, Ida is dressed in a green sweater and light blue skirt, and she is wearing a black hat which is typical of her area; she is the second from the left.)

(*) Note: the member in the small photograph was not present because of work commitments; she works in a company that makes textiles for exportation.

loans.use: to improve her cargo motorcycle which she uses to distribute bread.

loans.name: Saingerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Saingerel is 31 years old and lives with her two-year-old daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

In November 2010 her husband Munkhdalai 37, went to Korea to work on a labor contract. He is working at a factory there. Saingerel says that they were very lucky, because not everyone who applies is chosen to work abroad on a labor contract. Saingerel said that her husband sends a money back home on a monthly basis. 

A lot of Mongolians, especially youngsters, leave the country to earn some money abroad. Last year Saingerel started the building project and she managed to put a basement in the house. Now she wants to continue her project and complete the building of a family house. Therefore she is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, plaster board, and insulation materials, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for the labor to improve her house.

loans.name: Hector Belisario

texts.es:
Hector Belisario tiene 65 años, es casado vive  con la esposa en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Hector se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y tener mas terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Le gustar ser una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Héctor Belisario is 65 years old, married and lives with his wife in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Patrón San Miguel” (Patron Saint Michael) communal bank is located in Palialoma Recinto, 60 minutes from the office.  It belongs to Chillanes Canton.  The communal bank has 13 members who are corn, potato and wheat farmers.

Héctor is a corn, potato and wheat farmer.  He buys his supplies in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month and his sales take place at the Sunday market in Chillanes.

He is asking for this loan to buy farming supplies in addition to fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs and increase production.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to buy a house and to have more land to farm.

He likes to be a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in addition to fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Doña Erika de 33 años,  de estado civil soltera , con dos  hijos, tiene ya 10 años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y peluches de forma ambulante y en su domicilio los fines de semana. La Sra. Erika  también trabaja como cocinera en una pizzería de nuestra ciudad por las noches. La Sra.   Erika  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la necesidad, oportunidad y  urgencia que posee de comprar más mercadería y su puesto fijo en un mercado cercano a su vivienda y con esta mercadería desea surtir su nuevo puesto.  Ella  tiene un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  es una persona trabajadora que tiene que sacar adelante a familia sola y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Erika, 33, is single with two children.  She’s been selling clothes and stuffed toys for ten years as a street vendor and on weekends from home.  Erika also works as a cook at a pizzeria in our city in the evening.  

Erika found herself in need of requesting a loan at our institution because of the opportunity and urgency she’s facing to buy more merchandise and a fixed stand in a market near her home; the merchandise will be used to stock the new stand.  

She has good credit history; she’s a longstanding client of the institution and she repaid well.  She is a hard working person who has to move her family forward alone and she’s grateful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a stand in her neighborhood market.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 47, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a mechanic, and they have one child. By the grace of God, Melinda has managed to support her child's schooling. She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses

Melinda oversees operations of the family's jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a single unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. Melinda and her husband also manage their motor repair shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Melinda is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy new accessories and parts for the jeepney and to buy some equipment for the repair shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her businesses.  

Melinda dreams of being able to buy another jeepney or to put up new repair shops in other places soon. She also dreams that her child will finish his/her education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Footnote: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins as they were first used by American soldiers to help the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn income and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney. It is open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the items that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, parts and equipment

loans.name: Yimmy Geovanny

texts.es:
Yimmy Geovanny  tiene 21 años, Es soltero vive  solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.

Yimmy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica para ayudar a los padres que estan enfermos.

Le gusta hacer deporte y estudiar.
texts.en:
Yimmy Geovanny, 21, is single and lives alone in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He has no children.

Members of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) communal bank are located in Voluntad de Dios in Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.
