Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Heart Of Mary Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Corazón De Maria está conformado por Gary Antonio de 22 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos El señor se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, la cual distribuye principalmente de manera ambulante, pese a que también recibe pedidos para traer de Managua para vender en las diferentes zona. Cabe señalarse, el señor ya tiene 2 años de estarse dedicando a esta actividad, la cual surgió en principio con ayuda de su papa, el cual le prestó el dinero para comprar y vender ropa, y de allí fue que el continuo con el trabajo, ya al tener capital de trabajo. Algo que aduce el señor, es que en Nicaragua no hay trabajo, por ello es que uno se tiene que dedicar a algo honesto para ganarse la vida. Otra integrante del grupo es la Señora María Auxiliadora, la cual tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 11 meses de edad.  Maria se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante. Ella ya tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual lo aprendió de su mama ya que ella la llevaba a vender frutas al mercado. Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de frutas por cosechas para luego comercializarlas en los mercados.
texts.en: Gary Antonio is a member of the group named "Heart of Mary". He is 22 years old, single and he does not have any children. He sells new clothing that he distributes primarily by travelling door to door but he also receives orders in various regions of Managua. He has had 2 years in the business and he started out with his father's help.  His father loaned him some start up money to purchase clothing for resale. From there he started his business and he began to form a capital fund. Another member of the group is Maria Auxiliadora. She is 22 years old, she is married and she has an 11 month old baby. Maria sells fruits and vegetables by travelling door to door. She has had 4 years in the business. She learned the trade from her mother who used to bring fruits to sell in the market. She will invest her loan in teh purchase of fruit in wholesale to resell in the markets.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is 26 years old and has a husband who is a business man. She has two children, one of whom goes to school.

Hawa is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to work on building a house.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Danitza Soledad

texts.es:
Danitza tiene 19 años, es soltera y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Danitza es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la confección y venta de artesanía de tipo platería en la ciudad de “Aguas calientes”. (La ciudad de “Aguas Calientes” se encuentra ubicada de camino  a una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Danitza con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar materiales de tipo platería para la elaboración de la artesanía. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Danitza is 19 years old and single.  She is a member of Arariwa's “Señor De Los Temblores II” community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Danitza is an enterprising and hard-working young woman who makes and sells silver handicrafts in the city of Aguas Calientes (Aguas Calientes is located on the road to one of the eight wonders of the world, the Inca citadel known as Machu Picchu).

Danitza will use her loan for 1,500 nuevos soles to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy materials for creating her silverwork.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making silver handicrafts

loans.name: Seleina Ene

texts.en:
Seleina Ene S. is 33 years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives in Kimana in the Loitoktok district, and she raises crops and sells them to travelers on the highway between Nairobi and Mombasa and to the local community. She irrigates her crops, so this ensures there is water throughout her field. She has been selling her produce for four years.

Seleina got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has applied for a loan which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm chemicals for her farm. She is very hardworking and determined to change the lives of her family members.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm chemicals

loans.name: Segundo Modesto

texts.en:
Segundo, his wife, and their four dependent children live in their own home. They have electricity and a small well for their home. They live just outside of the small city of Reque, which is twenty minutes to the south of the major northern city of Chiclayo. Reque is a primary transit point for trading fish and other products from the Pacific. The population primarily works in trade, raising animals, and on small farms.

Segundo is well respected in the community and has good references from his neighbors. He is popular with many because he frequently is the organizer of community-wide parties during holidays and festivals. He enjoys building community and helping people come together.

Segundo is a farmer. He has a plot of land on which he plants tomatoes, corn, sweet potatoes, and pickling cucumbers. This will be Segundo’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa and his first experience with a financial institution. Segundo needs to hire laborers in order to harvest the produce from the fields. He will use the loan to pay the laborers. He hopes his current crop will yield good profits in order to be able to continue to plant and properly tend his next crops.

Segundo is very hardworking and has big dreams for his family. He hopes to be able to send all his children through a full course of school study and see them become professionals.

loans.use: To hire laborers in order to harvest the produce from the fields

loans.name: Mvazi

texts.en:
Mvazi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school while four graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mvazi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu because few legal formalities are required to join.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Gloria is married and has three children. She plants rice crops and vegetables. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Gloria wants to grow her business and she works hard to achieve it. She also aims to improve her family's living conditions.

Gloria applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 from CEVI to supply her farm with inputs. She will buy additional seeds and fertilizers using the loan. Gloria hopes to increase her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Phann Nom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group is in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. Its eleven members have selected Mrs. Phann N., born in 1958, to be their president. The group members will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their standard of living. Mrs. Phann N. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. In addition, she wants to breed pigs, but does not have enough money. So Mrs. Phann N. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets and pig food  to start a new business. With part of the loan she is going to hire farm laborers to harvest her rice. Her husband, Mr. ChH. Chheay, is a construction worker and a traditional musician who is able to earn some money to help support his family. They have three children, one of whom is employed in a private company, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the youngest one is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia V. is from the village of Turod. She is 45 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a general store. Lucia has run her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lucia is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lucia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. Lucia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services in 2011.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jose Jacinto

texts.es:
El señor Jose Jacinto E. tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero con tres hijos y se dedica a la pesca artesanal.
tiene mas de 33 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, vive con sus tres hijos varones que le ayudan a realizar la pesca en su lancha.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para arreglar el motor de su lancha.
en estos momentos no puede transportarse hacia el mar y esto hace que tenga perdidas grandes por no poder pescar.
Don Jose Jacinto ademas es agricultor, cultiva maiz para consumo diario de su familia.
ademas de esto los fines de semana transporta turistas hacia la isla de Amapala en su lancha.
cuando esta en su casa lo dedica a costurar las redes que necesita para pescar.
texts.en:
Jose Jacinto E. is 54 yars old and the single parent of three childen.  He is a fisherman with more than 33 years of experience.  Jose Jacinto lives with his three sons, who help him to haul fish into his boat.  The loan proceeds will be used to purchase spare parts to fix his boat's motor.  Currently, he is not able to go out to sea, resulting in big losses due to his inability to fish.  

Jose Jacinto is also a farmer, cultivating corn for his family's daily consumption.  Additionally, he transports tourists to the island of Amapala in his boat on weekends.  When he is at home, he works sewing the nets he needs in order to fish.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for a boat engine.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn A. is a 26-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a Jeep transportation business and a general store.  She lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Jeep and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 20,000. Gelyn is now borrowing PHP 29,000 for Jeep maintenance. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For for Jeep maintenance

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 43, is a married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco. She has five children, the oldest of whom is 23 years old.

Helen is a farmer and primarily plants rice crops. She sells her harvest to the market where she has more access to customers. She needs a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Helen hopes to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 35-year-old single mother of five and has no other dependents living in Hioma, Uganda. She lives in a rented home and her family goal is to build a family house and educate her children. 

For nine years Daisy has been running a restaurant business. She started by selling pancakes, then saved to start the restaurant. However, she faces a challenge of customers not paying on time.

Her dream is to have a bigger restaurant in the future. Daisy intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Dickson Makka

texts.en:
To notch up something lucrative out of any business, diligence is required. Once diligence is embraced as a precept in one's daily activities in any enterprise, the inside lane for success will surely be beckoning. This has been 45-year-old Dickson Makka L.'s philosophy for the past seventeen years as he goes on the trivial rounds of his farming business in Rangulumira-Kayunga. 

Dickson, a happily married father of nine says he set forth in this business after the completion of his studies at Uganda's premier university. At his farm, he plants all genres of cash crops, such as pineapple, passion fruit, rice, cassava, beans, peas, bananas, maize, etc. He harvests and sells most of his crops. As such he is able to make profits to the tune of about $433 weekly and $1300 monthly, respectively. 

With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more maize, bean and pea seedlings to plant. He is looking at the prospect of being able to sell more once he can harvest more and have more in his reserves.

loans.use: to purchase maize, bean and pea seedlings to plant

loans.name: Las Vecinitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Vecinitas, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlayacapan, en el estado de Morelos México, está conformado por 5 integrantes, ellas son la Señora Irene va a comprar con su préstamo mercancía jabón por kilo, aceite por caja, azúcar por bulto, huevo por caja etc. La señora Yuridia Azucena va a comprar bolsa para dulces, globos, serpentinas, gorritos, dulces, la señora Luz María va a comprar cirios pascual para la temporada de semana santa, la señora Isabel va a comprar chiles secos, guajillo, pasilla por kilo frijol peruano, flor de mayo, la señora Irma va a comprar mantelería para los tablones. La señora Irma tiene 47 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos ya casados, Rubén de 29 años de edad, Brenda Mayra de 25 años de edad y Ramiro de 20 años de edad, ella tiene su negocio de renta de mesas y sillas para fiesta, ella solicito su crédito para comprar manteles para las mesas, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, su esposo en su camioneta le echaba viajes a una persona que rentaba mesas y sillas y vio que era negocio, porque son cosas que no se echan a perder  y tiene la camioneta en la que transportan las sillas y las mesas, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos, tiene buenas cuentas, ella proporciona a sus clientes un buen trato y buen servicio, ella más que nada trata de motivar a sus clientes proporcionándoles los manteles del color que más les agrade, lo pida el cliente con meseros, con brin colines, su hijo el más chico le ayuda a acarreas las mesas, sus sueños y esperanzas son que su casa este bien terminada le falta el repellado y el baño ponerle las regaderas, ampliara su negocio para que de ahí vaya saliendo para los gastos y que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propio negocio. Tlayacapan es un pueblo mágico por las artesanías del barro y por su Iglesia que es ex convento y museo donde hay momias. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a KIva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos y vamos a pagar puntualmente para que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group called, Las Vecinitas ( The Neighbors ) is located in the community of Tlayacapan in the state of Morelos Mexico.  It is made up of 5 members, they are: Irene who will use her loan to purchase merchandise such as soap by the pound, boxes of oil, sugar in bulk, boxes of eggs, etc; Yuridia Azucena will be purchasing bags for candy, balloons, streamers, and hats; Maria will purchase paschal candles for the Easter holiday; Isabel will purchase dried peppers, guagillo and pasilla by the pound, Peruvian beans, and May flower; Irma will purchase tablecloths.  Irma is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children who are married.  Ruben is 29 years old, Brenda Mayra is 25 years old, and Ramiro is 20 years old.  Irma has a business renting out tables and chairs for parties and solicited this loan to purchase tablecloths.  She began her business 10 years ago, her husband used to make trips for a person who rented out chairs and tables and she noted that it was good business because they are materials that do not deterriorate plus she has the truck in which to transport the tables and chairs.  Her business is important because it creates earnings, is in good standing, and she gives her clients a good deal and good service.  More than anything else, Irma tries to motivate her clients by offering colored tablecloths of their choosing, waiter service with the tables, trampolines, and her youngest son helps her transport the tables.  She dreams and hopes to complete her home which still needs plastering and the bathroom needs shower heads.  She will expand her business so she can obtain money for expenses and so each one of her kids can have their own business.  Tlayacapan is a magical town due to its crafts of clay and its church that is an ex-convent and a museum that houses mummies.
The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad, " Thank You for the loans, we will pay on time so that you continue to show support with your loans.".

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe KELEGNA, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de charbon de bois, d’arachide et de haricot.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe KELEGNA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, du charbon, de l’arachide et du haricot.                                                                          
NAH D. compte acheter de la friperie avec les commerçants de la ville de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village de Koba, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women in the Kelegna group are all married, average 48 years of age and have three children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Koba, in the "prefecture" of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They met each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in clothes, charcoal, peanuts and beans.

The women in the Kelegna group are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used to buy clothes, charcoal, peanuts and beans.

Nah Dembah is planning to buy second-hand clothing from traders in the town of Dioïla. She carries out her sales on a daily basis in the village of Koba, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 9,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments and to make contributions to social ceremonies; the balance will be reinvested in her clothes trading activity.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Rocio Del Milagro

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 menores hijos con quienes vive en una comunidad urbana del distrito de San José en Lambayeque. El distrito de San José es un puerto pesquero.

Con más de 3 años de experiencia, Rocio se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en localidades cercanas a la suya. Rocio limpia el pescado y lo traslada en grandes cubetas desde el puerto hasta su lugar de venta. Los utensilios que ella utiliza para realizar su actividad se encuentran demasiado gastados y es por eso que Rocío ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar nuevos utensilios y parte de este préstamo también será destinado a la reparación del techo de su casa.


Rocío estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues la compra de utensilios nuevos le servirá para dar una mejor presentación del producto a sus clientes y por lo tanto generar más ventas que le permitirán seguir haciendo reparaciones en su vivienda. 

La reparación del techo de su casa es solo el primer paso de las múltiples reparaciones que Rocio tiene que hacer en su vivienda para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rocio is 22 years old.  She is a single mother who has two dependent children.  They live together in an urban community, in San José district, in Lambayeque.  San José district is a fishing port.

Rocio has more than three years experience selling fresh fish in nearby towns.  She cleans the fish and moves them in large ice trays from the port to her place of sale.  The tools that she uses to carry out her business are very worn and, for that reason, Rocio has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she will use to buy new ones.  Part of her loan money will also be used to repair the roof of her house.

Rocio is very grateful for this loan since buying new tools will help her to better present her products to her customers.  This will enable her to make more sales which will allow her to continue making repairs to her home.  Repairing her roof is only the first step in a series of repairs that Rocio has to make to her home in order to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy utensils and repair her roof

loans.name: Tracey L.

texts.en:
When Tracey started Elegant Minerals in 2006, she did not know how successful her all-natural cosmetics line would be.  She only knew that she had a business opportunity that allowed her to earn money while staying at home with her five children.  At the time, Tracey and her husband, Joe, were supporting their family with his salary as a manager at 7-Eleven and money Tracey made from her eBay business.  Not wanting to go into debt, they started with a modest budget of $145 a month to get Elegant Minerals started.  Now, five years later, Elegant Minerals offers over 300 all-natural cosmetic products to women around the world.

Tracey became interested in all-natural cosmetics after having her third child.  The cosmetic products she used at the time caused her skin to break out, prompting her to begin a trial-and-error period of testing countless cosmetic brands.  She says she tried everything from the most expensive brands to the cheapest without seeing improvement.  As she researched common ingredients used in cosmetics, she discovered that many brands claiming to be “all-natural” still use synthetic ingredients that can irritate skin.  Only after switching to cosmetics with 100% all-natural ingredients did her skin improve.  Tracey reasoned that she couldn’t be the only woman whose skin reacted to cosmetics with synthetic ingredients.  With this assumption, she began building the business model for Elegant Minerals.

Elegant Minerals sells its products to people all over the world.  Through online advertising, Elegant Minerals has become known for their affordable and quality cosmetic products.  Recently, Elegant Minerals was recognized on the Martha Stewart Living Radio as one of the best all-natural cosmetic brands.  This summer, Elegant Minerals will be featured in the independent movie “Liquorice.”  Elegant Minerals has donated its products to be used for the actors’ makeup, and will benefit from the publicity of having their products placed in the movie. 

Elegant Minerals has a diversified sales approach.  While Tracey estimates that roughly 80% of Elegant Minerals’ sales are through their website, they also sell their products through salons, spas and independent contractors.  Tracey says that the independent contractors tend to be stay-at-home moms wanting to earn a living without sacrificing time with their kids.  Recently, Elegant Minerals reached an agreement with a large cosmetic corporation to sell Elegant Minerals products under the corporation’s name and label.  Regardless of where Elegant Minerals is purchased, the price is always the same.  This diversified sales strategy provides multiple avenues for market penetration.  

Tracey and Joe recently built an addition to their house that will serve as their new office.  The cost of this new addition has put pressure on cash flow they need to maintain their business. This loan will be used to order hairbrushes with their personalized logo.  These hairbrushes are an accessory sold at retail outlets carrying Elegant Minerals’ products.

Here is the link to their website http://www.elegantminerals.com/, and here is the link to a blog post on Martha Stewart’s website discussing Elegant Minerals.  http://bit.ly/iVGBPN

loans.use: to pay for a shipment of hairbrushes.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 39, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a side car driver, and father to their children. By the grace of God, Corazon has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Corazon oversees operations of the famly's side car transportation business. They have two units of side cars, or bicycle carts, that carry up to two passengers to their destination within the community. The passengers pay boundary (a daily quota) each day. Corazon also sells processed meat and chicken. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Corazon is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her side car and to buy new stocks of processed meat products to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon dreams of being able to buy another side car soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, maintenance and other items needed in her business

loans.name: Saida Danitza

texts.es:
Saida nació en la ciudad del Cusco(Perú) y tiene 52 años de edad. Actualmente, Saida vive en la misma en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Saida es secretaria y trabaja en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco en la facultad de Medicina. Ya son 30 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Saida requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para viajar. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Saida, 52,  was born in Cusco (Peru) and she still lives in this beautiful city.  Saida is a secretary and she works at the National University of San Antonio Abad of Cusco in the department of Medicine.  She has been there for 30 years and she has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Saida is requesting a loan for personal use so that she can travel.

She is a responsible and hardworking person and that is why the other members invited her to join the communal bank the “Mosoq Allpa” of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: To travel

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  Eseza has a cosmetics shop . She has been in this business for over 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Eseza has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge for Eseza includes ever-increasing prices of cream relaxers and braids. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also build more rental rooms.  Eseza owns her home, which has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1977.  She lives in Phan Xa village, Uy No commune, D. Anh district with her husband and two children who are going to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.  She is a farmer.  Not only do they grow rice and breed pigs, but they also she sells beverages. 

She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 VietnamD. (VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2009.  The last cycle, she borrowed 5.014.000 VND and repaid punctually.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 45 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 15 años y se dedica al oficio de las confecciones, actividad en el cual tiene 15 años de experiencia, pues desde que se casó decidió dedicarse a desarrollar un trabajo en forma independiente, que le permitiera al mismo tiempo atender su hogar y generar  ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su familia. Así fue como inició con una maquina sencilla y gradualmente ha ido incrementando su infraestructura, hasta lograr hoy tener 3 maquinarias, con las cuales produce vestidos, sudaderas, pantalones, cubre lechos y todo lo que su creatividad le inspire. Sus principales clientes están ubicados en la comunidad donde vive y también negocia con colegios a los cuales les confecciona uniformes deportivos. Su meta más adelante, es adecuar un espacio de su vivienda, para ubicar un punto comercial donde exhibir sus productos. Su mayor desafío es contar con un surtido de todos sus diseños y tener suficientes accesorios para adornar sus prendas de vestir, porque ante su creciente clientela, su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales para la fabricación de vestidos femeninos, sudaderas, pantalones y para la compra de una máquina recubridora, con la cual dará a sus prendas un acabado perfecto. Mientras esto ocurre Luz Marina se esmera en lograr una rentabilidad no menor del  20%, que sueña con incrementar con las inyecciones de capital de trabajo con las que ahora inicia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 45, lives in the town of Soledad with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 11 to 15 years.  She is a seamstress; she has 15 years’ experience since she’s been working independently since she got married and she decided to work at something that produced income while leaving her free to care for her home.  This was how she started out with a simple sewing machine and has gradually been improving the infrastructure until today when she has three machines that she can use to make dresses, sweatshirts, pants, bed covers and everything else her creativity inspires. Her main clientele is located in the community where she lives and she also negotiates with schools to make their sports uniforms.

Her goal for later on is to equip her home to set up a commercial sales point there to display her products.  Her greatest challenge is to have a selection of all her designs and enough accessories to decorate her articles of clothing because, in face of her growing clientele, her working capital becomes insufficient.  This is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy materials to make women’s dresses, sweatshirts and pants and to buy an overlock sewing machine that will make perfect finishings to her items possible.  While this occurs, Luz Marina strives to maintain a profit level of no less than 20% which she hopes to increase with injections of working capital like the one she’s starting now.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 28 years old, married and the mother of three school-going children. She has been selling charcoal at the sea breeze area in Malindi town for the last year. She earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000, with which she intends to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Lucy will use the anticipated profit to provide the basic needs for her family.

In the future, she plans to grow her business and open a water-selling point in the town.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en:
Kaingu is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past five years, Kaingu has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business at the market. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate. He dreams of purchasing two more motorcycles and establishing a spare-parts shop in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he plans to purchase motorcycle spare parts for servicing his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for servicing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Nancy has a farming business. She grows rice crops and vegetables to sell to her community. Nancy is able to provide for her family through her business. She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Nancy hopes to have a better income to sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with 3 children. Josie has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.  Josie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Aunte

texts.en:
Aunte is divorced and has 5 children. Aunte sells Banku, a fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water, into a smooth whitish consistent paste, at Elmina.  

Banku is typically served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.

Aunte uses her income to see to the well-being of her children and home. 

Aunte will use the loan to purchase maize to make more Banku.  With the new profits, Aunte plans to build a restaurant one day.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make more Banku.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une commercante qui vend des tissus simples, des tissus "thioub", des draps de lit et des rideaux.Elle pratique cette activité depuis son jeune age en accompagnant sa maman qui faisait le meme commerce.Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l'un est élève au lycée.Elle entretient sa famille avec les produits de son commerce et se charge surtout des dépenses liées aux études de son fils.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 20 pièces de draps, 20 pièces de rideaux et 15 "thioub".Elle ambitionne de construire une maison sur un terrain qu'elle a acheté.
texts.en:
Khary is a merchant who sells ordinary fabrics, "thioubs" (dyed cotton cloth), bedsheets, and drapes. She's been doing so since her young age, with her mother who used to run the same business.

Khary is married and the mother of two children, out of whom one attends high school. Thanks to the profits of her business, she provides for her family. She mainly takes care of her son's school expenses.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, in order to buy 20 bedsheets, 20 drapes, and 15 "thioubs". She ambitions to build a home on a land lot she purchased.

loans.use: to buy 20 bedsheets, 20 drapes, and 15 "thioubs" (dyed cotton cloth)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 42 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 18, 7 años y el menor de 7 meses, todos ellos viven en su casa propia desde donde viven la ilusión de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de María consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajero dentro de la ciudad. Pero ella no es la que se dedica a manejar los vehículos, para esto ella cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, quien maneja el carro, además posee una mototaxi el cual lo da a un chofer que se encarga de trabajar a diario y pagar una suma en forma de alquiler. Ella desde muy temprano esta en su casa para iniciar el día dando al chofer el moto taxi y a su hijo el carro. Lleva dos años en este negocio, permitiéndole tener tiempo disponible para estar a lado de su familia y poder brindarles los cuidados necesarios. Además tiene un buen ingreso sin hacer mucho esfuerzo, por otro lado esta muy entusiasmada en poder comprar otro vehiculo más para así aumentar sus ingresos. Este será su crédito número cinco con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus proyectos, por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo la cliente puntual y muy responsable como fue hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para iniciar un nuevo proyecto que es el de costura e iniciará cosiendo sabanas, cubrecamas, fundas y más.
texts.en:
María, 42, is a good, kind, very responsible woman.  She has a spouse and four children who are 10, 18, and 7 years old and the baby that’s 7 months old.  They all live together in her own house with the hopes of providing a better quality of life for her family.

María’s work consists in transporting cargo and passengers within the city.  But she’s not the one that actually drives the vehicles.  For that she has her son’s support; he drives the car.  She also has a mototaxi that a driver operates and pays her a daily rental fee.  She’s at home very early in the morning to start her day giving the mototaxi to the driver and the car to her son.  She’s been in this business two years which has given her time to spend with her family and to provide them with the necessary care.  Besides, she has a source of income that requires very little effort on her part.  On the other hand, she’s excited to be able to buy another vehicle to increase her income.

This will be her 5th MFP loan and she hopes for your support to continue with her projects.  She commits to continue being punctual and very responsible like she’s been to date.  She will use the requested amount to buy materials to start a new project which is sewing; she will sew sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases and more.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads and pillow cases.

loans.name: Rosa Evila

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Caribeñas del Distrito Manantay, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo.
Lleva trabajando 5 años trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un taller de costura instalado en su misma casa, trabajo que lo realiza desde hace tiempo para poder ayudar a su esposo, quien se desempeña como estibador de madera.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 metro de tela, 1 docena de hilos, 1 kilo de tela gasa, 1 kilo de licra, 1 kilo de algodón licrado, 1 cono de elástico, tiza para sastre, agujas para maquina.
Los días que tiene trabajo se sienta casi todo el día para cumplir con los pedidos, sus hijos son los que le ayudan con los quehaceres de la casa, para no interrumpir su trabajo.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos puede trabajar para mejorar la economía de su hogar y la tranquilidad de su familia, con el aporte de su esposo ya pueden solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Las Caribeñas” communal bank in Manantay District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 46 years old, married and has two children in her care.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for five years.  She has a sewing workshop at home where she’s been working for some time now to help her husband who works as a lumber stevedore.

She will use her new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy: 15 meters of fabric, 1 dozen thread, 1 kilo gauze, 1 kilo lycra, 1 kilo of lycra/cotton blend, 1 cone of elastic, tailor’s chalk and sewing machine needles.  On days when she has work she sits at her machines all day to complete her pending orders.  Her children help her with the household chores so that she doesn’t have to interrupt her work.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she’s able to work to improve her home’s economy and her family’s tranquility.  With what her husband contributes they are able to meet basic household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь замужем. У них с мужем двое детей. Дочь живет вместе с ними, а взрослый сын живет со своей семьей отдельно. Любовь имеет свой бизнес.

Любовь продает женскую одежду. У нее торговая точка на центральном рынке города. Торговая точка раположена удачно с большой проходимостью людей. Она имеет много положительных качеств такие как трудолюбие и ответственность, которые помогаю ей в бизнесе.

Любовь просит прдеставить ей кредит на сумму 20,000 гривен на закупку женских пальто и шуб к зимнему сезону. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и потратить ее на улучшение жилищных условий для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Lubov is married. She and her husband have two children. Their daughter lives with them and their grown son lives separately with his family. Lubov has her own business. 

Lubov sells womens clothing. She has a stall in the city's central market. The stall is well situated in a heavily trafficked area. She has many positive characteristics such as diligence and responsibility that help her in business. 

Lubov is asking for a loan of 20,000 grivna for the purchase of ladies overcoats and fur coats for the coming winter season. She hopes to earn additional profits which can be spent on improving her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy womens overcoats and fur coats for the winter season.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  
  
Madina has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.  
  
Madina has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She also hopes to educate her children up to university.  

Madina lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity, but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, Josefina se dedica a la ganaderia, vende leche, una parte de la leche que saca diario la utiliza para producir queso para venderlo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pasto para el gando y repuestos para reparar dos motocicletas que son el medio para transportar la leche.
doña Josefina es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Josefina is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  Josefina raises livestock, sells milk, and part of the milk that she collects daily she utilizes to produce cheese to sell.  She will use her loan to purchase hay for her cattle and parts to repair two motorcycles that are the means of transport for the milk.  Josefina is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She needs the earnings from her business to cover the expenses of her children.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts and hay for cattle.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en: Fatima is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband works in a private firm for a monthly wage. In order to financially support him, Fatima operates a clothing sales business. She began by going to different shops and communities to sell her clothes but now she has a good reputation among her clients, who give her their orders which she fulfills by visiting different cities. Although she has only five years of experience in her business, her knowledge helps motivate her clients to give her orders. Fatima will invest this loan in expanding her clothing sales business further. She is confident of getting better financial results from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 35 years old and a garment factory worker who always tries to work overtime in order to increase her monthly income. She is married and has been blessed with two children. Presently one of her daughters is working in a garment factory, while the other one is still a student in a local public school.

Chan is acquiring a loan of 500 USD from HKL. She will use it to fill the ground below her house, as in the rainy season it gathers rainwater. She will be very pleased to receive the loan given to her, confident that she will pay it back regularly and punctually.

loans.use: to fill the ground below her house.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 60 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with six children. 
Emelia has a general store and earns approximately PHP3,000.00 each month. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and sugar, etc.

Emelis has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Emelia hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Richard T. J. Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the township of Waterloo, in western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 18,800,000 SLL for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they are going to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Richard is the featured leader of this team of teachers. Richard was born in Moyamba district, in southern Sierra Leone. The 48-year-old is married to a school teacher and together they have 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Richard has been a school teacher for 21 years now. However, Richard is pursuing further studies in college. He has thus requested this loan in order to pay his college fees. 

(These borrowers came in two separate batches to collect the loan hence two sets of photos: one attached on top of the other).

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Anasim Adan Oglu

texts.en:
54-year-old Anasim lives his family life with 3 children. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and second group disabled veteran. Since 2004 Anasim has been engaged in taxi driving to improve his family’s living condition. Due to an inability raise financial resources, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough.

Having borrowed 3 loans of $400-$600-$600 from Komak Credit Union in 2002-2004 Anasim significantly expanded his business. The loans were paid back timely.

He needs $800 loan, in order to further develop his business, to buy new spare parts, to increase his incomes, to improve his family\'s living condition with these additional incomes, and to obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Xx

texts.en: X.

loans.use: XX

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is 28 years old and single. He lost his father during the civil war in Sierra Leone and was forced to take care of his mother and sisters. In 2003, K. started a small business selling jewelry, music tapes and watches by hawking. His first loan with SMT provided him independency from the suppliers’ credit which can be expensive and time constraining. He now has a small space in the open market instead of hawking. He will use the new loan use to increase his stock so he can support his mother and sisters.

loans.use: Muhamed would like to increase his stock of costume jewelry, watches, and music tapes for his small store.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.en:
Juan Ramon Garcia is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. His children are aged 13, 12 and 1. His wife is a pharmacist. Juan has been a shoemaker for 15 years. He initially worked for someone else and later started his own business 5 years ago. He works from Monday to Saturday from 7 am to 6 pm. Every day on average he makes and sells about 4 pairs of shoes. He makes formal leather dress shoes for men, women, and children. His customers mostly are employees and official workers from near-by towns.

Juan owns a small store that is just large enough to display a few of his shoes. Also, he makes his shoes at his store. Juan is requesting a $200 loan to buy more leather material to produce more shoes to sell at his store.

loans.use: Purchase leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en:
Like many other women of Yamasa, Juana María, 23 years old, is running a business of mosquito nets. She began her business 3 years ago and still keeps working hard to help her husband cover the expenses for their 3 children (two boys and a girl).

Juana María applied to borrow U.S $375.00 with the intention of boosting her business and purchasing the necessary quantity of cloth (materials) to make the mosquito nets. She is also thinking of repairing her very old sewing machine, in order to manufacture more mosquito nets and sell a large quantity of her products. She will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy materials for the business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Gonzalez lives in San Juan, Paraguay with his wife and four year old son. They are fortunate to have their own house in addition to a small store out of which they sell movies and music. The store, which they have run for the past five years, is located in the commercial district of Encarnación, Paraguay. With the money he earns from the store he is able to support his wife and children.

His wife is currently in charge of running the house and caring for their children. Before this she worked in a well-known clinic in the city of Encarnación.

Mr. Gonzalez has asked for $625 to buy new merchandise for his store, such as movie and music CDs, which are in high demand at this time. Being able to purchase the most up-to-date items now will greatly increase Mr. Gonzalez ability to continue successfully with his store in future.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise such as movie and mucis CDs for his store.

loans.name: Modesta Peralta

texts.en:
Modesta is married and has three grown-up children (ages 34, 30, and 20). The two elder ones are married and living with their families. The youngest son lives with his mom and goes to the university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

For more than three years now, Modesta has been selling men´s and women´s apparel, mostly pants and shoes. She says she started the business specially to support her youngest son´s studies.

Every day, friends and neighbors from her community visit her home to see and buy her goods. She says the customers are satisfied with the quality of her clothing. Currently, she has a well-established clientele. Her weekly profit is about US$ 100.

Modesta would like to be able to sell more and attract new customers. With this second loan, she will buy clothing in bulk in Santo Domingo to resell in her community. Modesta envisions her business becoming a big clothing store in a few years with a big and beautiful locale.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Sister Daison

texts.en:
Sister Daison S. is 29 years old and is married with two children, aged 5 and 10. She also has two nieces, who are also her dependents. In 2007 Sister Daison established a stationary business. She now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of stationary in bulk

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 48 year old woman. She lives in south Lebanon, in Saida. Dalal owns a grocery store and wants to buy new merchandise for the store. She is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to help maintain and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Gisela's Faraja Group

texts.en:
Gisela is 40 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 16 and 14 years old. Gisela sells shoes. She started in 2005. She earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Gisela has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who sells fish.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Radhia's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Radhia is 27 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 4 years old. Radhia is a soft drink seller and she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaheri, who has business dealings in used clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Elici

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Elici L.. She is married and has six children aged between 7 and 23. In 1999, Elici established her seamstress business. She is assisted by her three employees. Elici requires a loan to purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Ahmad Zay

texts.en:
This is Ahmad Zay, son of G. R.. He is a 45-year-old married man, and he is the father of six children. He lives in the district of Sorkhrood in the Ningarhar province.

Ahmad Zay has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years. During those years, he has faced numerous financial problems because he generates very little income and, as a result, he has not been able to solve all of his family's problems. Now, he is hoping to increase the products he sells for a profit by buying more livestock in order to raise the current level of his income. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $875 (40,000 Afghanis), and he promises to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To generate greater income by purchasing additional livestock

loans.name: Ruth Dávila

texts.es:
Ruth is a young woman, 23 years of age. She is married and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, which belongs to the city of Managua. Ruth has known since she was very young what it is to work in order to earn a living; her parents do not have much money and she has had to help support them. However, now that she is married, she must work for the survival of her own family.

She and her husband have not yet had any children. They work very hard so that when the day comes that they do have children, they will be able to give them a dignified life. Ruth’s husband works as a driver and, like her, contributes to the household expenses. Ruth has been selling clothing for the past nine years. She began the business with her own savings and it has grown little by little in the amount and variety of clothing that she has for sale.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in buying more clothing because she currently does not have much inventory. She hopes to buy more so that she can have better sales and thereby hold on to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruth es una joven de 23 años de edad, es casada, y habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua. Ruth desde muy joven sabe lo que es trabajar para ganarse la vida, ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y los ha tenido que apoyar. Pero ahora que ya está casada debe velar por la superviviencia de su familia. Hasta elmomento no han procreado hijos, es por eso que trabajan muy duro para que el día que vengan los hijos puedan darles una vida digan. El esposo de Ruth trabaja como conductor y al igual que ella aporta para los gastos de su hogar. Ruth se dedica a la venta de ropa y desde hace nueve años está en este negocio.Empezó la venta con ahorros propios y ha ido creciendo poco a poco en la cantidad y variedad de ropa que ofrece. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en compra de productos ya que actualmente no cuenta con mucha inventario y desea reforzarlo para así poder obetener más ventas y tambíen retener a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy clothing with which to stock her store

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Abdusalom N. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a higher education and is a jurist. Because the low salary of law practice is not enough to support Abdusalom’s big family, he has a side business. He buys crop directly from local farmers and sells it to wholesale buyers. The business allows him to support his family. Currently, Abdusalom wants to increase cash flow and decided to obtain a 15 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Носиров Абдусалом житель района Шахринав.Возраст 45 лет,женат , имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности юрист. Так как заработная плата очень маленькая и ее не хватает на содержание его большой семьи клиент занимается бизнесом. Он скупает у местных крестьян товар прямо на полях и сдает товар оптовым закупщикам. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать свою семью. В данный момент Абдусалом хочет увелить денежный оборот ,поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase cash flow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been selling building materials since 1998. Elizabeth is 37 years old and has five children; she lives in Lagos state with her family. She is happy with her business. Building materials for sale  include cement and blocks. Elizabeth is determined to work hard and assist her husband in supporting their children. 
Elizabeth requests a loan amount of $450 to purchase more building materials to sell; She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials for sale

loans.name: Khalilulla

texts.en: Khalilulla lives in Khachmaz town with his wife and three children. He started his farming business seven years ago. He would like a loan of $750 to buy seedlings to help improve the output of his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Kry

texts.en: Mr. Kry T. lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province and he cultivates both rice and vegetables. In this business, he now has an obstacle because the soil in his field is infertile and it affects his crop. To solve this problem, Mr. Kry T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support his field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Phoeurng Soeurn, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Kry T. is 48 years old and the father of three children who are all employed in different businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support his field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mrs. En L. is 48 years old. She lives in Kradass Khor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoung Chhe, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. Since they cannot grow enough rice to support their family on their small plot, they want to expand it. Mrs. En L. is asking for a loan to buy more land to cultivate rice. She has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other four are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị Liễu 34 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiêệntịa chị đang là chủ cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh các lại phân bón  tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập  chính cho gia đình chị Liễu trong thời gian qua. Ngoài ra chồng chị làm nghề lái xe nên hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu rất ổn định từ lương của chồng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh phân bón của gia đình .
texts.en:
Mrs. Đặng Thị Liễu, 34 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1997. She is now the owner of a business which specializes in various types of fertilizer, located in Hưng Nguyên district, Nghệ An province. This business is the main source of income for her family. Her husband earns some additional income as a driver, which provides the family with another very steady source of income. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to invest in her fertilizer business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe de 43 años, vive con su esposo Sebastián que es albañil y sus 3 menores hijos; Ángel de 14, Cristian de 10 y la tierna Paola de 6 años, en una cuarto alquilado, ella quiere mejorar su futuro y quiere lograrlo haciendo crecer su negocio. Se dedica a llevar y vender ropa a las comunidades más alejadas de Puno, montada en un camión transporta toda su mercadería, esto es lo más difícil de su trabajo, pero cuando llega a su destino, se distrae mucho vendiendo la ropa, la cual se acaba rápidamente. Tiene 10 años haciendo esta actividad, desea establecerse y poner una tienda de ropa. A pesar de sus constantes viajes, trata de no descuidar a sus hijos, a los que ama un montón y siempre que puede esta con ellos, lo que más anhela es darles unos estudios adecuados, para que luego sean unos buenos y competentes profesionales. Es el primer préstamo de Lupe con MFP y ya está ahorrando para pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, su banco comunal la apoya puesto que es una de las más entusiastas del grupo. Lupe quiere comprar más mercadería, ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio, así que invertirá todo el préstamo en la compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Lupe is 43 years old. She lives with her husband who is a bricklayer and her three young children, Angel, 14, Cristian 10, and Paola, 6. The live in a rented room. Se wants to improve her future by making her business grow. She makes a living by selling clothing in far away and remote communities outside of Puno. The worst part of her job is riding on the back of a truck with all of her merchandise to get to the locations where she sells the clothes. However, as soon as she arrives the time passes by quickly as she sells the clothing. She always sells out of her merchandise quickly. She has been making a living this way for the past 10 years. She would like to start a clothing store someday.

Despite her constant traveling, she doesn't leave her children unattended. She loves them very much and she is with them whenever possible. Her greatest dream is to give them a proper education so that the can become good and competent professionals. This is Lupe's first loan through MFP and she already started saving so that she will be able to make all her payments on time. Her communal bank helps her a lot and she is one of its most enthusiastic members. Lupe wants to buy merchandise. She wants her business to grow and that is why she will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Her Merchandise

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Agée de 49 ans, Madame Aminata Kassongué vit avec ses 8 enfants et son mari  dans le quartier Kouloukoro  de la ville  de koutiala(troisième région du Mali)
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillante étude , Aminata s’est très vite interessée aux activités génératrices de revenu. Après s’être essayé à plusieurs activités  elle finit par opter pour  le commerce de condiments alimentaires depuis maintenant  10 ans. 
Afin de remedier aux  ruptures de stock elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso   il ya 5 ans.  Après  8 prêts solidaires  ( prêt du groupe ) tous correctement  remboursés,   elle est à son 1 er  prêt individuel. 
 Elle compte acheter différentes sortes de condiments avec ce prêt, telque les poivres, sels de cuisine, soumbala et autres. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossites et effectue sa vente  au marché Kouloukoro de koutiala  à une clientèle  essentiellement feminine au comptant ou à crédit.  
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA  par mois  qu’elle envisage  utiliser  pour rembourser les  intérêts du prêt  et participer aux dépenses familiales.
Elle ambitionne devenir une grossiste de condiments au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Mrs. Aminata Kassongué lives with her 8 children and her husband in the Kouloukoro area of the city of Koutiala (in the third administrative region of Mali). Not having had the chance to pursue a stellar education, Aminata very quickly became interested in revenue-generating business activities. After trying out several businesses, she ended up settling on the condiment business, which she has been engaged in for 10 years. In order to solve the problem of stock shortages, she decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After 8 solidarity (group) loans, all repaid properly, she is seeking her first individual loan. She intends to buy different types of condiments with this loan, such as peppers, edible salts, soumbala, and so on. She obtains her supply from wholesalers and makes her sales at the Kouloukoro market in Koutiala to a primarily female clientele in cash or in credit. She intends to earn an average profit of 45,000 FCFA per month, which she foresees using to repay the loan and take part in meeting her family's expenses. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler of condiments at the grand market in Koutiala.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Taïbatou

texts.fr:
D. Taïbatou est née vers 1947 et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. D. Taïbatou réside  depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Gbégamey, un quartier populaire de Cotonou Capitale économique du Bénin. D. Taïbatou exerce son activité de vente de gari(farine de manioc) et de maïs dans ce même quartier où elle habite. D. Taïbatou s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément dans les marchés locaux.  D. Taïbatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. D. Taïbatou a déjà deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé avec ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Taïbatou D. was born around 1947 and is the mother of two children who attended school. Taïbatou has been living for about 20 years in the neighbourhood of Gbégamey, a densely populated area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Taïbatou sells gari (cassava flour) and corn in the same neighbourhood she lives in. Taïbatou gets her goods from the interior of the country, specifically in local markets. Taïbatou is asking Alidé for a loan in order to meet the ever-increasing demands of her customers. Taïbatou has already had two loans with Alidé which have been repaid. "Alidé" means "there is always a way for the poorest" in Fon, the native language of Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, where the GDP per capita is $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to the very vulnerable and the organisation is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance programme to the beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and of gari (cassava flour)

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita B. currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to buy more bread to sell. Rita is 27 years old and is married to a soldier. She has one child who doesn't attend school. With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to be able to build a house for the family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима торгует кондитерскими изделиями на центральном рынке города Исфары. Ей 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Несколько лет назад потеряла свою работу и стала выходить на рынок торговать. Вначале работала по найму, постепенно накопив свой капитал, стала самостоятельно вести бизнес. Сейчас она уже имеет стабильный бизнес и своих постоянных поставщиков и клиентов. Муслима планирует немного расширить наименование своих товаров и поэтому подает заявку на займ в КИВА.
texts.en:
Muslima sells confectionary products in the central market in the town of Isfara. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. Several years ago, she lost her job and went into sales in the marketplace. In the beginning, she worked for wages while gradually saving her money. She then went into business for herself. Today, she has a stable business with regular suppliers and customers. Muslima plans to slightly increase her assortment of goods and has applied to Kiva for a loan to do so.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: M/wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been been a juice and food spices (mango picle) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $200. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

Khadija is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes, mangoes and sugar for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, get more food for family and pay school fees for her children.

Khadija is 38 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8.

Khadija will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zawadi, Fatma, Zakia and Mwaka. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, sugar and mangoes for her business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Coquitos Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Los Coquitos esta conformado por Mayra Modesta G. R. y Paz Catalina S. en la actualidad ellas no cuentan con el capital de trabajo a suficiente para surtir mas sus negocios. Paz Catalina S. tiene 66 años. la actividad económica es de brindar el servicio de Nintendo, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leña y con el tiempo obtuvo algo de ganancia compro ropa usada la cual distribuía en su barrio y mas tarde logro un triciclo y posteriormente con las ganancias que recibía de ahorro lo suficiente para la compra de Nintendo, a pesar del desafío que atraviesa cuando se acerca el invierno es que su casa se inunda, pero este inconveniente solo hace que los sueños de Catalina se realicen como son de seguir creciendo con este negocio.  Mayra Modesta García R. tiene la edad de 36 años. Es madre soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Este negocio surgió por idea propia y realmente se dio cuenta de que rápidamente almacenó algunos ingresos. Y ahora deciden realizar un financiamiento para que invertir en sus pequeños negocios que por ser pequeños no sean importantes. Ambas son amigas y lo que sueñan es que sus negocios sigan adelante.
texts.en:
The Grupo Solidario Los Coquitos is made up of Mayra Modesta G. R. and Paz Catalina S.. Currently, they do not have enough money to increase the inventory of their businesses. Paz Catalina is 66 years old. Her business is a Nintendo service. She used to sell firewood, and over time she took her profits and purchased used clothing which she sold in her neighborhood. Later on, she was able to purchase a three wheeled cart and eventually with the earnings she saved enough to buy the Nintendo. When winter approaches her house floods, but this inconvenience only helps Catalina achieve her dreams of continuing to grow this business, despite the challenges. Mayra Modesta García R. is 36 years old. She is a single mother and has one child. She sells new and used clothes. She came up with this business on her own initiative and realized that she quickly earned income. Now they have decided to request a loan to invest in their small businesses, because although the businesses are small they are still important. They are friends and their dream is that their businesses continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Mrs. B. is residing at Sinian, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. She owns and operates a business venture; her primary activity is raising livestock and pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for more than 16 years, earning presently 4,000 php per month.

Recently, she's requesting her 3rd loan in the amount of 3,000 php that will be used for purchasing feed for her pigs.Her future plan for her family is to continue to provide their basic needs and send her child to school up through college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
