Susan M. is a 46-year-old woman and is a single parent of four children. Susan remained strong and determined to raise her children and give them better life when her husband left her. She joined ASHI in 1999 and the loan she received from the institution was her capital to start up a business. She had been doing many different kinds of businesses until then just to have an income to sustain the needs of her children. Her eldest child is a college undergraduate and is presently unemployed. Her second child is a high school graduate and was not able to pursue his college degree. Instead he worked as a laborer and supports Susan financially now. Susan’s third child is in high school and her youngest is graduating in elementary this year.

Susan’s primary business now is buying and selling of herbal medicines and cosmetics. She sells them directly in different municipalities of the province. At times she also sells food in the neighborhood and even in offices within the municipality where she lives. To enhance further this business, Susan applied for a loan from ASHI. The amount she borrowed is the same as her previous loan, based on her capacity to pay and the needs of her business. Presently, Susan continues saving her profit for emergency needs of her business and children. She hopes that her children who are still in school will be able to graduate from college.

Susan has been a very good member of ASHI and a strong woman. She cares for her children and her group and center.

loans.use: Cosmetics, herbal medicines, and food for selling.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод Худойдотов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Дилшод по специальности "историк". По специальности он проработал более 5 лет. В данный момент он занимается предоставлением услуги "ювелира" на дому. Кредит просит для того, чтобы арендовать магазин в центре города, т.к. там есть возможность  завести побольше клиентов.
texts.en:
Dilshod H. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Dilshod's profession is a historian in which he worked for more than five years. Now he is a jeweler and works from home. He is asking for a loan to rent out a store in the center of the town so he will have an opportunity to have more customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent out a store in the center of town

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to build his house

loans.name: Antony Gatu

texts.en:
Antony K. is a married man who is blessed with one son. He is a tailor and also sells ready-made clothes. He has been operating the business for the past two years with a monthly profit of approximately 11,000/=.

He wants to use the loan to boost his business by buying plain fabrics and to purchase ready-made dresses.

In the future, he hopes to venture into public transport.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying plain fabrics for dressmaking

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and has two adult children. She sells women's  and men's shoes at Ulana Market in Pavlograd. She has been in this business for 13 years. When she started there was very little competition, but as more people entered this line of work, Galina's commitment to excellent customer service has allowed her small company to remain strong.

Galina has applied for a loan of 15,000 UAH to buy new inventory for the fall season. Galina hopes to earn additional income that she can spend meeting her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy television sets

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 54 años D. edad, es madre D. cinco hijos todos mayores, se dedica a la venta D. leche fresca, queso y panes en el mercado número dos D. esta localidad, actividad que lo realiza todos los días, ella es viuda, pero tiene la ayuda D. una D. sus hijas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas” desD. hace ocho años, donD. siempre se ha caracterizado por su alegría y sus ganas D. salir adelante. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en golosinas para vender en la vereda D. su vivienda, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra D. productos lácteos. La meta D. Carmen es tener una fuente D. soda y también hacer mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali Region. Carmen Rosa is 54 years old and the mother of 5 adult children. She sells fresh milk, cheese, and bread from Market #2 in her city and attends to her business every day. Carmen Rosa is a widow, but she has the support of one of her daughters.

She became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (Virtuous Women) eight years ago. Carmen Rosa is known among the other members for her cheerfulness and desire to succeed. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy candy that she sold from the sidewalk near her home. At the moment, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase dairy products. Her goal is to open a soda fountain and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Mario Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Mario Alejandro R. es padre de familia, tiene un hijo pequeño de edad que actualmente esta empezando a estudiar.
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como encargado de una tienda de pinturas. Su deseo es que su hijo tenga su propio cuatro y viva mejor.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Angélica Bueno ya que el señor Mario Alejandro no se encontraba en su vivienda el día de la visita, estaba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mario Alejandro R. is the father of a young son who recently started school. With two prior loans from FVP, he has built a room which still needs a roof. He also wants to put in concrete flooring so that the house is safer and sturdier. He is requesting a loan for this project and plans to repay the loan with the income he earns as the manager of a paint store. He wishes for his son to have his own room and better living conditions. The person who appears in the photo is his wife, Angélica Bueno. Mario Alejandro wasn't home the day of this visit because he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia K. sells ground nut paste in the market and is requesting a loan to buy other items like beans, peas, maize flour, etc. to sell as well. Lucia is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a potter. She has 5 children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for children up to the university level.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and the empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing other items like beans, peas, maize flour, etc. to sell
